Established in 2009, 4Liberty is a certified Women-Owned and Operated Business Enterprise with headquarters in San Diego, California. As a leading technical and professional services consultancy, 4Liberty helps utilities through the energy transition and grid modernization that will be necessary to meet government mandates and reach sustainability goals. With a diverse and dedicated team of professionals (50% woman, 34% non-white, and over 20 nationalities represented), we work with utility, commercial and government clients to modernize and build resiliency across critical infrastructure, providing turnkey PMO services for large scale programs to diverse clients across the United States and Canada. name: ADEL SYSTEM Inc
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral ADEL SYSTEM Inc View Details (3) Booths Ground Level — 4641 Mark As Visited Company Information adelsystem.com/en/ About ADEL SYSTEM Inc  Adelsystem - a PULS company - was founded in 1991 in Italy, and is a leading manufacturer of DC-UPS systems and battery chargers for industrial applications, including machinery and infrastructure facilities where backup power or charging solutions are required. The company’s mission is to deliver scalable, compact and high-performance devices that enable reliable operation, predictive maintenance and seamless integration into modern industrial environments. WE INVENT INNOVATION. Way back in 2005, we developed a product, the "all-in-one" DC-UPS. In one module it uses three technologies: an industrial power supply, a battery charger and a back-up module. Today, Adelsystem DC-UPSs offer the most innovative solution on the market due to compatibility with every battery technology and product-integrated connectivity. In addition, the Adelsystem product range offers complete solutions for 12 V, 24 V and 48 V applications, all packaged in powerful and space-saving all-in-one systems. With a strong focus on quality and innovation, Adelsystem provides customers with tailored products that stand out in today's competitive landscape. Adelsystem has a proven track record, with over 100,000 units sold annually in more than 60 countries worldwide. About PULS: Founded in 1980 by Bernhard Erdl in Munich, the PULS Group is a global leader in DC power supply solutions for industrial applications. With DIN rail power supplies, field power supplies for decentralized applications and innovations in inductive charging systems, PULS is setting technological standards. PULS has in-house production facilities in Europe and Asia, a dedicated team of over 1,400 employees and a strong focus on efficiency, durability and sustainability, making PULS a trusted partner for customers worldwide. (based in Aurora, IL) with a focus on industrial DC Power Solutions for Critical Power Infrastructure Applications such as (but not limited to) utility substation automation and data centers. He is responsible for collaborating with technical stakeholders to provide DC Power Supply and Backup Power Solutions that improve their power quality while minimizing their operational expenses and risk of power disruptions.  Read More  Matt Biskner  President, PULS, L.P.  President of PULS, L.P. (PULS North America)  PULS is the premier global manufacturer and technology leader engineering the most efficient DIN rail switched-mode power supplies, decentralized field mounted power supplies, electronic circuit protection, DC power and DC backup power solutions on the market today. The company was founded in Munich in 1980 by Bernhard Erdl and currently has around 1400 employees worldwide.  PULS North America is located in the Chicago suburbs and is the North American headquarters of PULS. PULS product families include FIEPOS field mounted power supplies, DIMENSION, PIANO and MiniLine Series, as well as accessories such as DC-UPS, buffer modules, redundancy modules and PISA electronic circuit protection. PULS manufactures all its products in its own factories located in Chomutov, Czech Republic; Suzhou, China; and Drebach, Germany.  In addition, the Wiferion division (a PULS brand), develops innovative technologies in the field of wireless in-process charging systems for automated guided vehicle systems, autonomous mobile robots and industrial vehicles.   ADELSYSTEM (a PULS company) was founded in 1991 in Italy, and is a leading manufacturer of DC-UPS systems and battery chargers for industrial applications, including machinery and infrastructure facilities where backup power or charging solutions are required. full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Beckhoff Booths Ground Level — 5933 Mark As Visited Company Information www.beckhoff.com/en-us/ About Beckhoff  At Beckhoff, automation technology is our calling. We empower engineers to succeed as industry leaders from power generation, transmission, distribution energy storage and consumption. name: Beckwith Electric Co Inc
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Beckwith Electric Co Inc View Details (5) Booths Ground Level — 3711 Mark As Visited Company Information www.hubbell.com/beckwithelectric/en/ About Beckwith Electric Co Inc  Beckwith creates solutions that protect power systems around the world. Beckwith’s field-proven smart distribution automation controls for transformers, regulators and capacitor banks incorporate unique control strategies, advanced microprocessor architecture and cybersecurity compliant communications. Power systems protection solutions include generator, transformer, feeder, recloser and distributed energy resources (DERs). Additionally, Beckwith’s fast motor bus transfer systems at power plants and process industries transfer motor bus from a faulty source to an alternate source to preventing motor damage while preserving the process continuity. Beckwith is the leading provider of innovative solutions for Smart Grid Volt/VAr Optimization (VVO) and Conservation Voltage Reduction (CVR). The capacitor controls and regulator/LTC controls designed by Beckwith Electric incorporate advanced features to enable maximum benefits to be derived from an Integrated Volt/Var Management (IVVM) system. When distribution system is experiencing high penetration of DERs, features such as Smart Voltage Reduction and Smart Reverse Power can be applied to operate properly as stand-alone controls with no communications, or as a critical part of an overall centralized IVVM system with extensive communications. pitch_summary: Bidgely provides an AI-powered SaaS platform called UtilityAI™ that leverages patented load disaggregation and machine learning to transform consumption and behavioral data into actionable intelligence for utilities. The platform enables applications such as load forecasting, EV and solar PV management, energy theft detection, and personalized customer engagement programs to drive decarbonization and operational efficiency.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A market leader in behind-the-meter intelligence using patented AI to bridge the gap between utility meter data and granular customer insights for global decarbonization efforts.
rationale: Bidgely employs a high-leverage SaaS model utilizing patented AI for load disaggregation, enabling utilities to manage grid edge assets (EVs, Solar) without deploying new hardware. With over $75M in funding and global deployments, it represents a mature Venture Scale asset, though it faces the typical friction of long utility sales cycles and incumbent competition.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Bidgely uses AI to itemize utility bills without extra hardware. By analyzing data from existing smart meters, their software acts as a 'digital itemizer' that tells utilities exactly how much energy is being used by specific appliances (like EVs or HVACs) inside a home. This allows utilities to personalize customer engagement and balance the grid by identifying exactly where and when power is being drawn.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and Grid Strain. As consumers add EVs and heat pumps, peak load demand is skyrocketing, threatening grid stability. Utilities urgently need 'Demand Side Management'—the ability to see and shift specific loads—without installing expensive new sensors in every home.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Google Analytics' for Power Grids (or 'Itemized Receipt' for Electric Bills)
vc_dossier.moat_description: Data scale and patent portfolio. Bidgely holds 17+ patents on Non-Intrusive Load Monitoring (NILM) and has trained its models on petabytes of data from millions of homes globally. This creates a data network effect where their appliance detection algorithms (e.g., distinguishing a Tesla charger from a pool pump) are more accurate than competitors lacking this historical volume.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Moore Strategic Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Georgian, Future Energy Ventures, Constellation Technology Ventures, IvyCap Ventures, Accurant International
vc_dossier.key_customers: PG&E, Duke Energy, NV Energy, Rocky Mountain Power, PacifiCorp, Avista, FortisBC, Ameren, Duquesne Light Company

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Centriforce Products Limited Dogger Bank On Site Utility Application  Stokbord® Utility Protection is our pioneering solution for faster and safer installation of heavy duty mechanical protection for underground cables and pipelines.  Identical in performance to Stokbord® Utility Protection in cover format , the roll out version of this product offers significantly faster installation times, reduced manual handling costs and enhanced worksite safety.  Wound onto timber drums, this solution is perfect for long, straight runs on larger scale projects where buried services do not have to be navigated.  Stokbord® Utility Protection in roll format is laid directly into trenches without the need for operators to enter and can be easily cut and joined back together, to allow access to buried utility below if required or to navigate bends on an installation route.  This high level protection can be customised to meet individual requirements and manufactured to accommodate bespoke trench configurations. Stokbord® Utility Protection in roll format is a highly visible, impact resistant protection product with the additional benefits of faster and safer installation for contractors. Growth is sustained by continuous improvement of manufacturing systems and facilities. Extensive CNC capabilities have been established throughout the manufacturing process resulting in the most advanced vertically integrated manufacturing facility in the industry. name: D Volt Co
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral D Volt Co View Details (3) Booths Ground Level — L6419 Mark As Visited Company Information www.d-volt.co/ About D Volt Co  D Volt Co. is a specialized manufacturer and power-infrastructure solutions provider focused on delivering reliable, high-performance electrical systems for data centers, utility applications, renewable energy projects, and large-scale industrial facilities. The company is committed to supporting mission-critical environments where power continuity, safety, and long-term system stability are essential. With a strong understanding of modern data center requirements—particularly those driven by AI workloads, high-performance computing (HPC), and cloud infrastructure—D Volt Co. designs and supplies power distribution solutions that address increasing power density, accelerated deployment timelines, and the need for scalable, future-ready architectures. The company’s core offerings include three-phase distribution transformers, pad-mounted and customized power equipment, and integrated electrical solutions that support key nodes from utility interconnection to internal distribution systems. All D Volt Co. products are engineered to meet applicable North American standards and testing requirements, ensuring dependable performance across demanding operating environments. Leveraging in-house engineering expertise, the company provides a high level of customization across capacity ratings, voltage classes, cooling methods, physical configurations, and interface designs—allowing each solution to be closely aligned with project-specific technical and site constraints. Beyond hardware, D Volt Co. incorporates intelligent monitoring and condition-awareness capabilities into its power systems to enhance operational visibility and asset management. These solutions enable owners and operators to monitor performance trends, load behavior, and potential risk indicators, supporting proactive maintenance strategies and minimizing unplanned downtime—an increasingly critical factor in modern data center operations. D Volt Co. works closely with data center developers, EPC firms, utilities, and engineering consultants to ensure clear communication, efficient execution, and predictable delivery throughout the project lifecycle. Supported by a flexible manufacturing and supply-chain framework, the company is well positioned to meet tight schedules without compromising quality or reliability. As data center infrastructure continues to evolve, D Volt Co. remains focused on advancing power reliability, intelligent system integration, and long-term operational value—serving as a trusted partner for critical power projects today and into the future. full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral envelio Inc. View Details (5) Booths Ground Level — 5733 Mark As Visited Company Information us.envelio.com/ About envelio Inc.  envelio Inc. was founded in Boston in May 2024 to drive the U.S. energy transition through smart grid software. With its proprietary Intelligent Grid Platform (IGP), the cleantech company offers its customers a transparent insight into actual grid operations and a variety of tools for resilient grid planning. The digital twin enables grid operators to optimize processes through automation and digitization, address grid vulnerabilities, visualize and plan hosting capacity, and automate grid connections. More than 70 utilities have now adopted and scaled the Intelligent Grid Platform (IGP), including E.ON, which operates the largest distribution grid in Europe. envelio Inc. is a spin-off of the award-winning German company envelio GmbH, which was founded in 2017 by RWTH Aachen University and is based in Cologne, Germany. envelio’s innovation in grid technology was named a “Best of 2024” Innovator in Power & Utilities by Darcy Partners in the Innovative Grid Technologies category. Additionally, envelio won the internationally renowned BloombergNEF Award for “Relieving bottlenecks in the deployment of clean power.” These awards highlight envelio’s leadership in modernizing grid operations and advancing clean energy solutions. pitch_summary: envelio provides the Intelligent Grid Platform (IGP), a digital twin-based software solution that enables utilities to automate grid planning, streamline grid connection processes, and manage DER integration through advanced data analytics and digitalization.
investment_thesis_one_liner: envelio addresses the critical bottleneck of grid interconnection by providing a proven, automated digital twin platform for utilities to scale renewable energy integration.
rationale: Envelio demonstrates strong venture characteristics as a pure-play software platform solving the critical bottleneck of DER interconnection for distribution utilities. With over 70 utility customers and a scalable digital twin product that replaces manual planning workflows, it has successfully transitioned from university spin-off to a growth-stage market leader in grid digitalization.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Envelio provides software that creates a 'digital twin' of the electrical grid. It automates the complex engineering calculations required to connect new solar panels, wind turbines, and EV chargers to the network. Instead of engineers manually calculating if a new project will blow a fuse, Envelio's algorithms do it instantly, speeding up the 'interconnection queue' for utilities.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Interconnection Bottleneck. As millions of decentralized energy assets (EVs, solar, heat pumps) come online, utilities are overwhelmed by connection requests, creating years-long backlogs that threaten climate goals.
vc_dossier.analogy: Google Maps for Grid Operators (Visualizing capacity and 'traffic' in real-time)
vc_dossier.moat_description: Deep Tech Origins & Data Integration. Spun out of RWTH Aachen University with proprietary power flow algorithms that can ingest messy, fragmented data from legacy utility systems (GIS, ERP) to build a functional model where others fail.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Acquired (Majority Stake) by E.ON in Dec 2021
vc_dossier.key_investors: eCAPITAL, High-Tech Gründerfonds (HTGF), Demeter, E.ON (Acquirer)
vc_dossier.key_customers: Westnetz (Germany), E.DIS (Germany), Helen Electricity Network (Finland), Glitre Nett (Norway), National Grid (US Pilot/Expansion)

investment_thesis_one_liner: FieldFLEX bridges the digital gap between legacy enterprise systems and field technicians through an offline-capable mobile platform that increases asset uptime and workforce productivity.

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Fischer Block Booths ADMIN ONLY — Sponsor Mark As Visited  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Fischer Block provides an end-to-end monitoring solution for the electrical grid, utilizing high-frequency sensors and advanced analytics to provide predictive maintenance insights for critical assets like transformers. Their technology converts raw electrical waveforms into actionable intelligence to prevent equipment failure and improve grid reliability.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Fischer Block enables grid modernization through a cost-effective IoT platform that transforms legacy infrastructure into intelligent, self-monitoring assets.
rationale: Fischer Block addresses the critical problem of aging grid infrastructure through high-fidelity waveform analysis and predictive maintenance, offering a sticky, high-value data moat. However, the reliance on hardware retrofits within a regulated utility sales cycle introduces significant deployment friction and adoption latency.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Fischer Block builds specialized sensors (SMART Block) and AI software that connect to existing electrical grid equipment. Think of it as an 'EKG machine' for power lines—it captures high-speed electrical waveforms to predict outages and equipment failures before they happen, without needing to replace the expensive legacy infrastructure already in place.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization & AI Reliability
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Fitbit' for Grid Assets
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented 'Non-Intrusive' Hardware Retrofit
vc_dossier.key_investors: Ben Franklin Technology Partners, Blu Venture Investors, SRI Capital, Carbon6 Ventures
vc_dossier.key_customers: Certrec (Strategic Partner), Unnamed Global Automotive Manufacturer, Unnamed Vaccine Research Facility

name: Heimdall Power, Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Heimdall Power, Inc. View Details (5) Booths Ground Level — 1644 Mark As Visited Company Information www.heimdallpower.com/ About Heimdall Power, Inc.  Founded in 2016, Heimdall Power is a Norwegian technology company driving the digitalization of the world’s power grids. By combining patented sensors, advanced analytics, and AI-driven software, Heimdall Power enables utilities to unlock capacity, enhance reliability, and accelerate the clean energy transition. Recognized as the world’s leading grid intelligence solution, Heimdall Power is trusted by more than 50 utilities across 20 countries to help manage capacity, prevent outages, protect infrastructure, and streamline regulatory compliance. At the heart of Heimdall’s platform is the Neuron™—a power line–mounted sensor featuring award-winning industrial design, state-of-the-art communication technology, and proprietary drone-based installation capabilities. Together with its plug-and-play software platform, the Neuron empowers utilities with real-time situational awareness across applications such as dynamic line rating (DLR), ambient line rating (AAR), and asset health monitoring. Heimdall Power’s mission is simple: To help utilities optimize the grid and power better lives.  About Heimdall Power, Inc. pitch_summary: Heimdall Power provides a grid intelligence platform that combines line-mounted IoT sensors (Neuron) with AI-driven software to help utilities optimize grid capacity, enhance reliability, and implement Dynamic Line Rating (DLR).
investment_thesis_one_liner: Heimdall Power addresses the transmission bottleneck by providing hardware-enabled grid intelligence that increases existing line capacity without the need for expensive and slow physical infrastructure upgrades.
rationale: Heimdall Power addresses the critical bottleneck of transmission capacity through Grid Enhancing Technologies (GETs), offering a scalable hardware-enabled software solution that unlocks latent grid capacity without massive infrastructure builds. While the regulated utility sales cycle presents friction, the verified deployment across 50+ utilities indicates strong product-market fit and high venture upside in the digitalization of aging grids.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Hardware and software that acts as a 'speedometer' for power lines, using bowling-ball-sized sensors to monitor real-time conditions (temperature, sag, wind). This allows utilities to safely push more electricity through existing wires without building expensive new infrastructure.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Enhancing Technologies (GETs) to meet surging power demand from AI and Electrification without waiting 10+ years for new transmission lines.
vc_dossier.analogy: The Fitbit for Power Lines
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented 'Neuron' sensors that can be installed by drone on live lines in under 10 seconds, creating a proprietary dataset of hyper-local grid conditions.

rationale: IND Technology addresses the critical utility pain point of wildfire mitigation and outage prevention through a patented Early Fault Detection (EFD) system with validated global traction. The combination of a hardware-enabled data moat and strong regulatory tailwinds for grid resilience positions it as a high-growth venture opportunity.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Network of pole-mounted sensors that 'listen' for radio signals from damaged power lines to predict failures before they start fires.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Wildfire Liability & Grid Resilience
vc_dossier.analogy: The Smoke Detector for Power Lines
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented Radio Frequency (RF) sensing hardware combined with a proprietary library of fault signal signatures.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Angeleno Group, Energy Impact Partners (EIP), Virescent Ventures, Edison International
vc_dossier.key_customers: Southern California Edison, Portland General Electric, San Diego Gas & Electric, EDP Renewables

name: Itron
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Itron Booths Ground Level — 2715 Mark As Visited Company Information www.itron.com About Itron  Protecting our world’s energy and water is essential. Amid growing and changing demand, aging infrastructure, rising consumer expectations, physical and cybersecurity threats, extreme weather and sustainability challenges, our customers are transitioning to a cleaner energy and water economy while delivering safe, reliable and affordable service. Itron helps utilities, cities and citizens globally better manage energy and water. Our integrated, intelligent platform of endpoints (such as sensors, switches and meters) collect data, control devices and take action in the field. Our communication networks harvest that data and deliver it where it’s needed. Software and services turn that data into insights. With Itron, our customers improve operational efficiency, system resilience and reliability, consumer engagement, demand management and profitability. Itron’s innovations have fueled the industry for almost 50 years. With edge intelligence, analytics and AI, our solutions—supported by our ecosystem of partners—help solve complex challenges while accelerating the transition to cleaner energy and water. pitch_summary: Kraken Technologies provides a cloud-native operating system for energy companies, automating the end-to-end utility value chain from billing and customer service to the orchestration of distributed energy resources like EVs, heat pumps, and batteries.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A market-leading utility-in-a-box platform that drives operational efficiency and enables the digital transformation required for a decentralized, decarbonized energy grid.
rationale: Kraken represents the quintessential venture-scale software play in energy, successfully displacing legacy incumbents (SAP, Oracle) by integrating billing (financial) and device orchestration (physical) into a single cloud-native stack. Its high operational friction (rip-and-replace) is offset by immense stickiness and network effects as it becomes the operating system for major global utilities.

vc_dossier.hq_location: London, United Kingdom (Global HQ) / Houston, TX (US Hub)
vc_dossier.corporate_status: Independent (Spun out from Octopus Energy Group in Dec 2025)
vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: A cloud-based operating system that replaces clunky, decades-old utility software. It handles everything from billing customers to balancing the electric grid in real-time.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' requires utilities to manage millions of new devices (EVs, heat pumps, solar) instead of just a few power plants.
vc_dossier.analogy: The Shopify for Utilities (modernizing the backend so they can sell complex new services)
vc_dossier.moat_description: High Switching Costs & Operational Complexity. Migrating 10M+ utility customers is risky and hard; once done, utilities rarely switch away. Kraken has successfully migrated 50M+ accounts.

name: LVT
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral LVT Booths Upper Level — L956 Mark As Visited Company Information www.lvt.com/ About LVT  From rapid deployment to platform-as-a-service, LVT helps you add security to even the most remote locations. Our cloud-based solution and security systems provide total site security with mobile and mounted camera options. Implement top-of-the-line security in almost any physical environment and still monitor them from the comfort of your office. Here’s what sets us apart: LVT Units consume as little as half the amount of power our competitors’ units use. We lead the industry in uptime. We use a private network so data never touches a public network. Your data is safe with us. LVT can scale quickly and easily for large system deployment. Our units are smart—they can problem solve and self-heal on their own, only requiring humans for bigger decisions. Get fewer alerts and save your energy for the ones that actually need your attention. Our units use significantly less cellular data than competitors. This will save you time and money while ensuring data safety and privacy. LVT’s mission is to make the world safer and more secure through mobile security.  About LVT Contact Us  Terann Wagner  Marketing Events Manager  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: LVT (LiveView Technologies) provides a cloud-based security platform-as-a-service integrated with rapidly deployable, mobile surveillance units. Their solution is designed for remote site security, featuring high power efficiency, private networking for data safety, and smart units capable of autonomous self-healing and alert filtering.
investment_thesis_one_liner: LVT scales remote site security for critical infrastructure through energy-efficient mobile hardware and a secure, AI-driven cloud monitoring platform.
rationale: LVT successfully bridges heavy hardware with a high-margin PaaS model, addressing critical physical security needs for utilities and commercial sectors with a rapidly deployable, off-grid solution. Their proprietary edge-AI and private networking stack create a defensible moat against commodity surveillance competitors.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: LVT builds solar-powered, mobile security trailers that can be deployed in minutes to monitor parking lots, construction sites, and remote infrastructure without needing power cords or Wi-Fi. They combine rugged off-grid hardware with a cloud-based software platform for real-time threat detection.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Retail Crime Wave' & Flexible Infrastructure. With organized retail crime costing retailers billions ($100B+ globally) and police departments understaffed, businesses need autonomous, private security that doesn't require expensive trenching for power cables.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Ring Doorbell' for Enterprise Parking Lots
vc_dossier.moat_description: Vertical Integration of Power & Data. Unlike generic camera vendors, LVT builds the entire stack: the solar power management (to stay alive in winter), the cellular connectivity (multi-carrier reliability), and the cloud VMS (Video Management System). This 'turnkey' reliability creates high switching costs for national chains.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Series B ($50M) in 2022; Valued at >$1B in 2025

name: Pointerra
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Pointerra Booths Upper Level — UL625 Mark As Visited Company Information www.pointerra.com About Pointerra  Pointerra3D: Transforming Utility Operations Through Digital Twin Intelligence Pointerra empowers electric utilities to build safer, more resilient networks by fundamentally transforming how they manage infrastructure, mitigate operational risk, and respond to changing conditions. At the center of this transformation is Pointerra3D, a cloud-native digital twin platform designed to unify lidar, imagery, BIM/CAD, and GIS datasets into a single, ultra-fast browser-based environment capable of scaling from individual assets to entire service territories. By eliminating traditional workflow bottlenecks and enabling enterprise-wide insights, Pointerra3D delivers measurable improvements in safety, reliability, and operational efficiency. Proven Outcomes at Utility Scale Leading US utilities rely on Pointerra3D to accelerate key programs and derive greater value from their geospatial data. A major US utility demonstrates the platform’s impact across storm response, grid hardening, and backlog reduction: • Storm Response: Automated damage assessments using post-event lidar enabled rapid, feeder-level reporting and dispatched field crews 60% faster than traditional methods. • Grid Hardening: Automated pole loading analysis reduced engineering time from 20 minutes per pole to 2 minutes, enabling analysis of more than 65,000 poles to guide hardening and resilience initiatives. • Backlog Elimination: Systematic analysis of 600,000+ poles uncovered 66,000 double poles and 9,000 with remaining third-party attachments, compressing what would have been a multi-year remediation program into just six months. These results highlight Pointerra3D’s unmatched ability to process massive datasets in the cloud while producing actionable intelligence that directly improves operational outcomes. Utility-Specific Applications Pointerra3D supports a broad range of mission-critical utility programs: Vegetation Management The platform’s vegetation analytics automate encroachment detection, tree classification, and growth modeling across transmission and distribution networks. Individual tree segmentation and predictive growth analysis enable utilities to optimize trimming cycles, reduce vegetation-related outages, and improve regulatory compliance. Poles & Wires Analytics Pointerra3D automatically extracts detailed asset attributes such as pole dimensions, conductor sag, attachment points, clearances and flags potential violations. Automated pole loading supports large-scale grid hardening efforts, and accelerates engineering to enhance system integrity and third-party oversight. Storm Response & Resilience During extreme weather events, utilities can rapidly assess damage using post-storm aerial lidar or imagery. Pointerra3D enables immediate triage, resource coordination, and restoration planning. Historical data supports trend analyses and predictive models that identify assets most vulnerable to future events. Asset Inspection & Compliance Virtual inspections powered by digital twins can reduce field labor by 60–70%. Automated conformance checks verify construction against engineering design, while condition assessments and heat maps help prioritize high-risk assets and streamline maintenance scheduling. Enterprise Integration & Scalability Pointerra3D integrates seamlessly into existing enterprise ecosystems via REST APIs, supporting platforms such as Esri ArcGIS, Maximo, SAP, and other utility systems of record. Its Master Model capability ensures that digital twins remain dynamic, continuously updated, and historically contextualized as new survey data is ingested. The platform’s cloud-native architecture removes traditional constraints associated with desktop-bound GIS and CAD tools. Pointerra processes statewide lidar programs in hours, not weeks, while handling complex coordinate systems and projection environments common in utility operations. Secure, two-factor authenticated share links simplify collaboration with contractors, partners, and regulators. Competitive Differentiation Traditional utility workflows rely on a patchwork of desktop software, slow data transfers, and disconnected systems. Pointerra3D stands apart by offering: • Immediate Access: A browser-based environment with no installations or IT rollout • Universal Data Support: Side-by-side streaming of lidar, imagery, BIM/CAD, 3D meshes, GIS vectors, and GPS-based video • Enterprise-Scale Performance: Cloud compute that effortlessly handles utility-wide datasets • Real-Time Collaboration: All stakeholders—internal or external—working from the same live dataset This unified approach eliminates versioning issues, accelerates project cycles, and reduces IT overhead. Security & Reliability Pointerra3D is architected to meet the rigorous cybersecurity and reliability standards of critical infrastructure operators. Built on AWS, it employs MFA, SSO, OAuth, and routine penetration testing to protect data integrity and access. With nearly five years of near-perfect uptime, the platform delivers reliability essential for mission-critical operations. Industry Leadership & Ongoing Innovation Pointerra supports utilities, transportation agencies, mining operations, and government entities across six continents. 2025 platform innovations such as in-browser BIM/CAD rendering, native DWG/DGN support, massive vector streaming, photogrammetric processing, and automated mesh clash detection continue to reinforce the company’s technological leadership. As utilities accelerate grid modernization, electrification, and resilience programs, Pointerra3D provides the digital infrastructure necessary for data-driven operational excellence. By replacing slow, fractured workflows with a cloud-based enterprise common data environment, Pointerra enables utilities to enhance safety, reliability, and service quality across their networks. A Complete Digital Twin Platform: CORE + ANALYTICS + ANSWERS Pointerra3D delivers an integrated suite of capabilities that collectively support the full lifecycle of utility asset management. CORE Platform The CORE platform enables utilities to ingest, process, store, visualize, and share digital twins, at unprecedented scale, directly in a web browser. With patented streaming technology and 99.996% uptime since 2019, CORE eliminates the need for heavy desktop software or specialized hardware. Built on AWS with MFA, SSO, and OAuth, it provides enterprise security and seamless accessibility. CORE’s ability to handle multi-terabyte datasets in real time sets the foundation for reliable, scalable digital twin operations. ANALYTICS Engine Pointerra’s ANALYTICS engine introduces advanced machine learning purpose-built for utility workflows. These capabilities include: • Automated feature extraction and classification for poles, wires, vegetation, and structures • Change detection to identify new attachments, damage, or compliance issues • Conformance validation against engineering standards • AI-driven risk quantification In 2025, enhancements include utility-scale poles & wires analytics, advanced tree segmentation, unified viewing of point clouds and 3D models, photogrammetric processing, and in-browser BIM filtering. This enables utilities to transform raw spatial data into structured, standardized asset intelligence. ANSWERS Dashboard ANSWERS provides predictive insights, business intelligence tools, and role-specific views that convert analytics results into practical actions. Executives gain clear operational dashboards, while field teams receive work orders and prioritization guidance—creating a seamless bridge between data and decision-making.  About Pointerra  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Pointerra offers Pointerra3D, a cloud-native digital twin platform that unifies lidar, imagery, and GIS data to help electric utilities automate asset inspections, manage vegetation, and accelerate storm response through AI-driven geospatial analytics.

name: PraXel Line Services
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral PraXel Line Services Booths Upper Level — UL342 Mark As Visited Company Information www.praxel.energy/ About PraXel Line Services  PraXel Line Services is an electric utility emergency response company specializing in safe, efficient, and rapid response for storm damage restoration on Distribution and Transmission systems. However, we are your one stop shop for new construction, maintenance and or general project work. PraXel has the ability, equipment, resources, and experience to perform energized work on all underground and overhead distribution voltages, both Wye and Delta, including but not limited to 4kV, 12kV, 13kV, & 34.5kV. In both energized or de-energized settings, pole replacements, cross arm replacements, conductor repair and stringing, sagging conductors, and both minor or major re-conduct jobs are a few examples of PraXel's capabilities. Not to mention, we also has the ability to perform energized hot sticking and de-energized hands on work for transmission systems. We offer heavy equipment hauling and rigging, right of way access road building and matting, reclamation, vacuum excavation, general excavation and much more! Most of our equipment and resources are based in London, KY, but we have satellite yards in strategically placed locations. We routinely respond to storm restoration work throughout the United States. We have completed project work for various IOU's (Investor Owned Utilities) in the South East and Mid-Western US. At PraXel we hold the values of safety, quality, efficiency, and a solid work ethic, as paramount, which has allowed us to build strong relationships across the utility industry with an impeccable reputation. name: Schaefer, Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Schaefer, Inc. Booths Ground Level — 4805 Mark As Visited Company Information www.schaeferpower.com/content/industry/alternative-utility-storage-energy/ About Schaefer, Inc.  For over 55 years, Schaefer has delivered high-reliability power conversion solutions for mission-critical Utility and Nuclear applications. We design and manufacture AC/DC power supplies, DC/DC converters, battery chargers, and custom power systems engineered for uncompromising performance in demanding environments. All products are engineered and manufactured in-house, ensuring full control over quality, configuration management, and long-term support. Our power solutions are widely deployed across the energy sector—including fossil, nuclear, and renewable generation—and throughout the power infrastructure, from power stations and substations to generation, transmission, and distribution systems. Schaefer products are trusted in safety-related and balance-of-plant systems, including protection and control, switchgear, SCADA/telecom, and auxiliary power applications. They are designed to meet stringent industry standards for electrical performance, environmental durability, seismic resistance, and electromagnetic compatibility. From high-temperature operation and vibration tolerance to extended-life components and conservative electrical design practices, every detail is focused on reliability, longevity, and predictable performance. Schaefer offers a broad portfolio of standard and custom products covering a wide range of input voltages, output voltages, and power levels. Product offerings include: • AC/DC power supplies for utility and industrial distribution voltages • DC/DC converters for critical electronics and controls • Industrial battery chargers for lead-acid, nickel-cadmium, and lithium-based battery systems • Redundant and modular power systems with load sharing and fault tolerance • Custom engineered power shelves, racks, and cabinets Power levels range from 150W – 40kW and 400VA-45kVA for enclosed supplies for control electronics to multi-kilowatt chassis, rack-mounted, and cabinet-based systems capable of supporting large auxiliary and infrastructure loads. Solutions are available for both single-phase and three-phase applications, with wide input tolerance, high efficiency, and tightly regulated outputs to support sensitive loads in harsh electrical environments. Schaefer works as an engineering partner—not just a supplier. Our applications engineers collaborate closely with customer design teams to develop optimized standard or fully custom solutions tailored to exact system requirements, including mechanical packaging, input/output configuration, redundancy architecture, monitoring and communications, and environmental hardening. With long product life cycles, stable form-fit-function control, and responsive technical support, Schaefer supports all designs for 32 years—helping utilities and nuclear operators minimize risk, simplify qualification, and maintain confidence in their power infrastructure for decades.  About Schaefer, Inc. name: Schneider Electric USA
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Schneider Electric USA Booths Ground Level — 1201 Mark As Visited Company Information www.se.com/us/en/ About Schneider Electric USA  Schneider Electric: Powering a Digital, Sustainable Future Schneider Electric is a global leader in energy management and automation, committed to driving efficiency, resilience, and sustainability across industries, businesses, and homes. Operating in more than 100 countries with 160,000 employees and one million partners, Schneider Electric consistently ranks among the world’s most sustainable companies. Our mission is clear: to empower all to make the most of their energy and resources, bridging progress and sustainability for everyone, everywhere. As the energy landscape evolves, Schneider Electric stands at the forefront of innovation—electrifying, automating, and digitalizing infrastructure to meet the demands of a rapidly changing world. Our technologies enable buildings, data centers, factories, infrastructure, and grids to operate as open, interconnected ecosystems. This approach enhances performance, reliability, and adaptability while reducing environmental impact. From intelligent devices and software-defined architectures to AI-powered systems and expert advisory services, our portfolio delivers end-to-end solutions that transform how energy is managed and consumed. The modern energy ecosystem faces unprecedented challenges: rising demand, extreme weather events, surges in distributed energy resources, interconnection delays, and growing cybersecurity threats. These complexities require solutions that go beyond traditional approaches—solutions that simplify operations while ensuring resilience and flexibility. Schneider Electric addresses these challenges by leveraging advanced digital technologies, predictive analytics, and automation to create smarter, stronger, and more sustainable systems. With over 30 years of domain expertise in grid modernization, Schneider Electric has helped utilities worldwide navigate these complexities and accelerate their transition to a digital-first energy infrastructure. By integrating AI-driven insights and real-time data, we enable utilities to optimize performance, anticipate disruptions, and maintain reliability even under the most demanding conditions. This commitment to innovation ensures that energy systems are not only efficient but also resilient and secure—capable of supporting cleaner, more affordable energy for generations to come. Our vision extends beyond technology. It’s about creating a future where energy is accessible, sustainable, and inclusive. By combining deep industry knowledge with cutting-edge digital solutions, Schneider Electric empowers customers to achieve their sustainability goals while improving operational efficiency. Whether it’s modernizing grids, optimizing industrial processes, or enhancing building performance, we deliver solutions that make a tangible impact on both business outcomes and environmental stewardship. As we look ahead, Schneider Electric remains dedicated to shaping a world where progress and sustainability go hand in hand. Through collaboration, innovation, and a relentless focus on customer success, we are building the foundation for a smarter, greener, and more resilient energy future—today and for decades to come.  About Schneider Electric USA  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Schneider Electric is a global leader in energy management and automation, providing end-to-end solutions that combine intelligent hardware, software-defined architectures, and AI-powered analytics to enhance resilience and sustainability across buildings, data centers, and utility grids.
customer_type: Utilities, Industrial, Commercial, and Residential sectors
investment_thesis_one_liner: A vertically integrated market leader enabling the energy transition through the digitalization and automation of global electrical infrastructure.
rationale: Schneider Electric is a mature public corporation and a dominant global leader in energy management, effectively functioning as a category-defining incumbent rather than a venture opportunity. Their value proposition relies on massive scale, manufacturing capacity, and established distribution channels, making them a strategic acquirer rather than an investment target.

name: Sentient Energy
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Sentient Energy Booths Ground Level — 1629 Mark As Visited Company Information sentientenergy.com/ About Sentient Energy  Sentient Energy, a subsidiary of Accurant International and a member of the Grid AI Alliance, is a leader in intelligent line sensing, data analytics, optimization, and control solutions for electric distribution grids. Sentient Energy’s advanced hardware and software systems empower utilities to make informed, data-driven decisions to ensure reliable, safe, and efficient power delivery. With the industry's only comprehensive Grid Analytics System, which covers both underground and overhead distribution networks, Sentient Energy also provides the most flexible communication options available, including LTE or AMI networks. The company leads the global market, deploying the largest network of line sensors across North America to deliver real-time data for predictive insights and strategic grid management and wild-fire mitigation as well as improved quality of service to electric customer. Sentient Energy’s Grid Edge Control solutions help utilities manage demand and reduce losses at the grid’s edge through techniques such as Volt-VAR optimization, conservation voltage reduction, and peak demand reduction. Sentient’s next-generation distributed safe batteries deployable on pads or on poles, bring local distributed power sources for capacity or power backup for customers. Join us at booth #1629 or contact us at info@sentient-energy.com or schedulingdtech26@accurantllc.com to schedule a meeting. For further information, visit www.sentientenergy.com or follow Sentient Energy on LinkedIn. Systems Integration Specialists Company (SISCO) delivers solutions for the energy industry by supporting international standards, including IEC 61850 and ICCP-TASE.2, IEEE COMTRADE, and CIM (IEC 61970 and IEC 61968) SISCO technology is dominant in thousands of power systems worldwide, helping our customers build resilient, high-performance power-system applications that are interoperable using widely adopted international standards. pitch_summary: Smart Energy Water (SEW.AI) is a leading vertical AI platform for the utility sector, providing a cloud-native foundation that connects customer engagement, workforce management, and grid asset performance for water, gas, and electric utilities.
investment_thesis_one_liner: SEW.AI is the category-leading enterprise software provider modernizing utility operations through a unified AI-driven ecosystem that integrates disparate CRM, CIS, and grid-edge data sources.
rationale: Smart Energy Water (SEW) is a dominant, cloud-native vertical AI platform that has successfully digitized the interface between utilities and their customers/workforce, achieving massive scale with 450+ clients. Its investment DNA is that of a high-margin enterprise SaaS category leader with deep regulatory moats, leveraging AI agents to overlay modern functionality onto legacy utility infrastructure.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Smart Energy Water (SEW) provides a software platform that modernizes how utilities interact with their customers and field workers. Instead of just sending a paper bill, SEW allows utilities to offer a digital app for billing, outage alerts, and water conservation tracking, while also managing the mobile workforce that fixes pipes and lines. Think of it as the digital front-door for your local power or water company.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Prosumer' Revolution & Grid Modernization. Utilities are facing a shift where customers are no longer passive 'ratepayers' but active participants with solar panels and EVs ('Prosumers'). SEW's software enables utilities to manage these two-way relationships and digital touchpoints, which is critical as distributed energy resources (DERs) destabilize the traditional grid model.
vc_dossier.analogy: Salesforce for Utilities
vc_dossier.moat_description: High Switching Costs & Integration Complexity. SEW integrates deeply with archaic utility back-end systems (CIS, Billing, SCADA) that are notoriously difficult to replace. Once embedded, ripping out their customer portal or workforce management system is operationally risky for a risk-averse utility, creating near-zero churn.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Mezzanine Round (Debt/Equity mix) in early 2025, likely for pre-IPO or expansion liquidity.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Golub Capital (Private Credit/Debt), Founder-led/Bootstrapped origins
vc_dossier.key_customers: SoCalGas, San Diego Gas & Electric (SDG&E), Alectra Utilities, San Jose Water, Liberty Utilities

name: Synerty
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Synerty Booths Upper Level — L952 Mark As Visited Company Information www.synerty.com/ About Synerty  Peek ADMS Diagram: Your Grid On Any Device I would describe Peek as a single pane of glass, an external view to our core ADMS so everyone in our business is looking at the same picture. -Control Systems Manager Real-time ADMS network visibility is no longer locked within the control room. Peek ADMS Diagram transforms utility operations by granting control room visibility to every field crew, engineer, and corporate user who needs it. Unlike legacy systems that lock network data to expensive workstation licenses, Peek delivers live ADMS diagrams to any device—desktop, tablet, or mobile— and works offline when connectivity fails. What makes Peek different? Precision Operations: Our Clients have mitigated switching errors and wrong equipment incidents. Peek's real-time view of the network diagrams with unified asset identification allows technicians to confirm exact pole numbers and equipment locations with your control room, ensuring accurate switching procedures every time. Works in Dead Zones: Field crews operating in rural areas or disaster zones maintain full network diagram access even with zero signal coverage. When infrastructure fails and connectivity disappears, Peek maintains uninterrupted access to network data. Strategic Alignment: Field crews and control room see identical network diagrams in real-time. No more radio calls asking 'what do you see?' - everyone works from the same information. Enhanced with Peek Field: Stop juggling multiple systems. Execute switching operations, manage incidents, and coordinate with control rooms directly from your network diagrams - eliminating paperwork and radio delays. Tested across diverse environments - from remote rural territories to dense urban networks - Peek delivers unwavering performance in every operating environment. See live Peek demonstrations at DistribuTech 2026 - visit us at Booth L952 next to Ballroom 20A on the upper level to experience how we're extending network visibility beyond the control room. full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral TE Connectivity Booths Ground Level — 5714 Mark As Visited Company Information www.te.com/energy About TE Connectivity  You're faced with daily challenges, like unforgiving environments, installation accuracy, animal-induced outages, and evolving technology and regulations. Will a tracked material cause a flashover – or worse, a wildfire? How will you manage the accelerating trends of decarbonization, grid hardening, network decentralization, and digitalization? When you’re tasked with building the energy infrastructure of the future – robust, intelligent, and emission-free – every connection counts. From generation to transmission to distribution, and wherever energy is needed, we’re with you every step of the way. Our comprehensive portfolio includes cable accessories, connectors and fittings, surge arresters, insulation and protection covers, smart grid systems, metering solutions, and installation training. No matter where in the energy landscape, we help optimize asset service life and prevent the costly outages – from underground failures to animal interference, material tracking, and flashovers. Our vision is to be your partner of choice for innovating sustainable energy networks that keep the power on. With over 70 years of experience, you benefit from a portfolio of brands trusted worldwide for safety, performance, and reliability. To serve you with an even broader portfolio, we have acquired Harger, a leader in grounding solutions and lightning protection; and Kries, a pioneer in smart grid monitoring and automation. name: The H-J Family of Companies
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral The H-J Family of Companies View Details (2) Booths Ground Level — 1801 Mark As Visited Company Information www.h-j.com/ About The H-J Family of Companies  The H-J Family of Companies is a global leader in the manufacturing and supply of products and solutions to the heavy electrical industry. These components support the transformer, switchgear, regulator, recloser and breaker industries, along with specialties in the utility market. Founded in 1969, H-J is headquartered outside of St. Louis, Missouri, USA. The company maintains a global presence with offices operating in Brazil, Canada, China, Colombia, India, Mexico, the Philippines, Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, and throughout the United States, all which allow H-J to serve domestic and international customers. The H-J Family of Companies conducts business in more than 70 countries across all continents. The international operation as well as the multicultural company environment leads H-J to a comprehensive understanding of the challenges of its global customers. In addition to the two facilities just outside the St. Louis, Missouri area, H-J has manufacturing facilities in Tianjin, China and Leon, Mexico. H-J employs state-of-the-art manufacturing technology to produce a wide range of insulating components and non-ferrous castings; such as brass, bronze, copper, and aluminum. As an engineered solutions company, H-J has a vast expertise in designing and manufacturing custom products to meet customer needs. The H-J Family of Companies was founded on the very principles that set it apart today – the desire to supply customers with the highest quality products, delivered on time at a competitive price. H-J is a vertically integrated manufacturer with in-house resources allowing product development from concept to design, through testing and final production. These resources include electrical, mechanical & material flow simulation software, full tool & die design and manufacture, and a fully equipped test lab for all electrical, mechanical, chemical & environmental test requirements. Continuous investment in operations and personnel has given H-J a worldwide reputation as a leader in the transformer and switchgear OEM markets. name: Trilliant Networks Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Trilliant Networks Inc. Trilliant Capabilities Video  At Trilliant, we provide the broadest range of connectivity solutions for utilities, cities, and energy companies worldwide. Our secure, device-independent hybrid communications platform helps customers choose the essential next-gen technologies and applications they need to strengthen network reliability, improve energy efficiency, ensure public safety, and reduce risk.   • Customers benefit from our proven enterprise-wide smart communications platform for connecting energy and Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) devices through secure, standards-based, multi-technology and open spectrum solutions.   • Our purpose-built platform enables utilities to securely and reliably deploy any Smart Grid strategy by leveraging Advanced Metering Infrastructure, Analytics & Data Services, Distribution Automation, Distributed Energy Resources, and Outage Management solutions – on one powerful network.   • Smart City customers benefit from solutions that include Smart Street Lighting Control, Smart Buildings, and Sub-metering that support public safety, wireless connectivity, and more.   • We offer exceptional coverage, capacity, network longevity, and performance in the most demanding environments through our globally unlicensed, open spectrum solutions utilizing our 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Mesh, and superior LPWAN, NAN, WAN, and Cellular systems.   Our network technology, applications, services, and unique partner ecosystem enable utilities and cities to help improve the quality of life for the communities they serve.   Next-Gen Network Technologies   • WAN   • NAN   • LPWAN   • Cellular Services   Services  • Our professional services team is here to offer guidance and expertise through each phase of your smart journey. From the moment you engage with us, we help guide you to a solution that meets your needs for today and tomorrow. We listen to your business requirements, challenges and needs and help you get maximum value and ROI.   Applications   Electric, Gas & Water Utilities include:   • AMI 2.0 / Smart Metering   •  Analytics & Data Services   • Distributed Energy Resources   • Distribution Automation   • Outage Management Questions, comments  Smart Cities, Towns & Campuses   • Smart Street Lighting Control   • Smart Building & Sub-metering   • EV Integration   Partner Ecosystem   • We have a broad ecosystem of trusted partners to ensure our customers’ success which includes many of the global leaders in metering.   Committed to Sustainability   • An Energy Transition strategy is imperative to achieve your net zero goals.   • Trilliant’s products & services are all designed for sustainability. We’re committed to supporting your decarbonization goals to ensure a greener, healthier future for generations to come.   • 2023: Certified Level 2 EcoResponsible   • 2023: Environmental Award from City of Granby   • 2022: Ecovadis Silver   • 2022 & 2023: Certified for ISO 9001, 14001, 27001 & 45001   • Participating Member of the UN Global Compact since 2019  To learn more visit Trilliant at booth 2023 or our website www.trilliant.com  Booths Ground Level — 1601 Mark As Visited Company Information trilliant.com/ About Trilliant Networks Inc.  Trilliant® has been empowering the global energy industry for more than 30 years with our proven, device-independence communications platform that enables utilities and cities to securely and reliably deploy any application on one powerful network. Our purpose-built portfolio is designed to offer the power of choice. Trilliant is meter and endpoint agnostic, providing a full range of options that meet each customer’s unique technology needs. We are proud to offer mission-critical solutions that support AMI, Data & Analytics, Smart Grids and Smart Cities. Utilities and communities worldwide benefit from Trilliant’s unique combination of flexibility, scalability, and sustainability that connects them to the Industrial Internet of Things through secure, standards-based, multi-technology, and open spectrum applications. Learn more about how we can support your strategic path to the Energy Transition as your trusted advisor – visit at us @ www.trilliant.com  About Trilliant Networks Inc. pitch_summary: Trilliant Networks provides a device-independent, multi-technology communications platform that enables utilities and smart cities to deploy Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI), grid automation, and Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) applications. Their platform supports a hybrid mix of WAN, NAN, LPWAN, and cellular technologies to ensure secure and reliable connectivity for mission-critical infrastructure.
customer_type: Electric, Gas, and Water Utilities, and Municipal Governments
investment_thesis_one_liner: A mission-critical communications layer for the energy transition, offering a hardware-agnostic platform that enables interoperable smart grid and smart city deployments at scale.
rationale: Trilliant is a well-established incumbent in the smart grid communications sector (AMI/Mesh) with decades of operation and private equity backing, rather than an early-stage venture target. Its business model relies on large-scale, capital-intensive infrastructure deployments for regulated utilities, fitting the profile of a mature industrial provider.

name: Typhoon Hil Inc.

Typhoon HIL is a technology and market leader in ultra-high fidelity Hardware in the Loop (HIL) solutions for design, testing, and validation of power electronics, microgrids, e-Mobility, EV powertrain software testing, and distribution control and protection systems. Typhoon HIL platform ushered a new era of model-based testing and validation of control software and hardware with its embedded, ultra-high fidelity real-time Hardware in the Loop (HIL) platform. The core technology is based on proprietary numerical algorithms, ultra-low latency application-specific processors, and optimized software architecture. Our HIL systems are widely used by engineers in microgrids, solar PV inverters, wind turbine converters, battery storage, marine power systems, motor drives, automotive, and traction industries to speed up time to market, reduce the cost of testing, and improve quality and reliability. pitch_summary: Typhoon HIL is a technology leader in ultra-high fidelity Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) solutions for the design, testing, and validation of power electronics, microgrids, and e-Mobility systems. Their platform utilizes proprietary numerical algorithms and ultra-low latency application-specific processors to provide real-time simulation of complex power systems and control software.
customer_type: Power electronics engineers, renewable energy equipment manufacturers, EV powertrain developers, and utility grid operators
investment_thesis_one_liner: Typhoon HIL provides the essential validation infrastructure required to safely and efficiently integrate power electronics and distributed energy resources into the evolving electrical grid.
rationale: Typhoon HIL is the established market leader in a critical but finite niche (HIL Simulation), making it a high-quality SME or PE target rather than a high-growth VC play. The company possesses a strong technical moat through its vertically integrated hardware/software stack, but the capital-intensive sales model and specialized R&D customer base limit rapid scalability.

name: United Electric Systems Inc
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral United Electric Systems Inc Booths Upper Level — UL207 Mark As Visited Company Information unelsys.com/ About United Electric Systems Inc  United Electric Systems Inc. (UNELSYS) Part of Power Economy Group Company United Electric Systems Inc. (UNELSYS) is a specialized engineering and manufacturing company committed to delivering advanced secondary power system solutions for utilities, industries, and critical infrastructure operators across the Americas and the Middle East. Headquartered in Abu Dhabi under the Power Economy Group Company, UNELSYS has built a strong international presence through its engineering excellence, manufacturing capabilities, and customer-centric approach. Established in 2005 in Allentown, Pennsylvania, UNELSYS began its journey as a Substation Secondary Engineering Design Services provider, offering comprehensive design, integration, and testing services for substation protection, automation and control systems. In its early years, the company supported utility customers across Latin America, the Middle East and key markets in the United States, including New York State, providing highly specialized engineering and onsite field testing services for substation primary equipment. Driven by the growing demand for high-quality protection and automation solutions, UNELSYS expanded from engineering services into advanced panel manufacturing and assembly. Today, the company operates a fully equipped facility that supports end-to-end engineering, fabrication, wiring, integration, and testing—enabling UNELSYS to deliver turnkey secondary systems that meet stringent utility standards. Engineering & Manufacturing Capabilities UNELSYS offers a comprehensive suite of engineered solutions designed for modern transmission, distribution and industrial networks. Its portfolio includes: Protection & Relay Panels Automation & RTU Panels SCMS / SAS Panels Fault Monitoring System Panels LCC (Local Control Cubicle) Panels These systems are engineered, assembled and delivered to leading utilities including Avangrid, PPL, Con Edison, SMUD, PG&E and to regional utilities across Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic. UNELSYS’ strong understanding of diverse utility standards and compliance requirements enables consistent, high-quality delivery across multiple regions. Markets & Customers Served UNELSYS supports a broad and diversified market base, including: • Transmission and distribution utilities • Renewable energy operators • EPC contractors • Industrial and commercial infrastructure • Data center operators • Municipal and government power authorities Its regional reach extends across: • United States – Key utility regions in the Northeast, California, and Midwest • Latin America – Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic and surrounding markets • Middle East – Through the Power Economy Group’s projects and partnerships This geographic spread enables UNELSYS to adapt solutions to varied engineering standards, environmental conditions and operational priorities. Strategic Partnerships for T&D To provide complete transmission and distribution solutions and support the needs of utilities, industries and data centers, UNELSYS collaborates with leading global OEMs. These partners will also join UNELSYS at the DTECH 2026 booth: 1. A-Eberle Solutions for voltage regulation and comprehensive power quality measurements across all grid levels. 2. Fluent Grid A digital transformation software provider offering advanced utility platforms for meter data management, customer engagement and operational analytics. 3. On Load Gear Manufacturers of Medium Voltage Vacuum Circuit Breakers engineered for durability, reliability, and grid stability. 4. Reconnect Energy A leader in renewable energy forecasting, enabling better integration of solar and wind resources into modern grids. 5. Voltap Experts in on-load tap changers, ensuring efficient transformer voltage regulation and long-term reliability. These partners complement UNELSYS’ engineering and manufacturing capabilities, enabling a unified offering across protection, automation, primary equipment, digital systems, and renewable integration. Presence at DTECH 2026 At DTECH 2026, United Electric Systems Inc. is proud to showcase its engineering expertise, manufacturing capabilities and integrated technology offerings alongside its OEM partners. Visitors to the booth will experience a complete ecosystem of solutions—including protection and automation panels, digital substation systems, primary equipment technologies, grid software platforms, and renewable energy forecasting tools. UNELSYS’ mission is to support utilities and industries in building stronger, smarter, and more resilient power networks. Its presence at DTECH reflects its commitment to innovation, partnership, and long-term value creation across the energy sector.
