pitch_summary: United Electric Systems Inc. (UNELSYS) is a specialized engineering and manufacturing firm providing secondary power system solutions, including protection, relay, and automation panels for utility transmission and distribution networks.
customer_type: Utilities, Renewable Energy Operators, EPC Contractors, and Data Centers
investment_thesis_one_liner: A critical infrastructure provider enabling grid modernization through the engineering and manufacturing of essential protection and control hardware for utility substations.
rationale: UNELSYS is a mature subsidiary of the Power Economy Group (est. 2005) operating as a traditional engineering services and manufacturing firm. Its business model is project-based and service-heavy, lacking the scalable software leverage or high-growth trajectory required for venture capital investment.

name: Utilismart Corporation
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Utilismart Corporation Booths Ground Level — 4835 Mark As Visited Company Information www.utilismartcorp.com/ About Utilismart Corporation  Utilismart is a leading provider of digital utility solutions that help electric utilities evolve from traditional poles-and-wires operators into modern Distribution System Operators (DSOs) and energy services providers. Our digital utility platform enables end-to-end transformation, supporting smarter, data-driven decisions across the distribution grid. Central to this is an MDMS with Advanced Grid Visualisation, an essential control room tool that gives operators real-time, intuitive views of network conditions—allowing them to anticipate, respond to, and resolve grid events quickly and confidently. Utilismart’s MDMS unifies operational and enterprise data to deliver both as-designed and as-operated views of the network. This provides control room operators with situational awareness of outages, switching operations, load conditions, and customer impacts. By turning complex data into actionable insights, utilities can restore power faster, operate safely, and improve reliability. Beyond the control room, Utilismart delivers grid visibility and analytics that enhance operational efficiency. Integrated engineering analysis, outage management, and automation allow utilities to proactively monitor and respond to events. Automated meter-to-cash processes reduce manual effort, improve accuracy, and accelerate billing, while intuitive, insight-driven tools enable deeper consumer engagement. Advanced capabilities such as load forecasting, network surveys, and system analytics support short-term operations and long-term planning. These tools help utilities optimize capital investments, manage network constraints, and prepare for electrification, DERs, and electric vehicles. By unifying these capabilities in a flexible, modular platform, Utilismart helps utilities unlock the full value of their data, enhance customer experience, and navigate digital transformation confidently. Utilismart Solutions Next Generation MDMS The Next Generation MDMS processes, validates, stores, and publishes meter and device data while performing ETL operations. By consolidating data across GIS, CIS, AMI/AMR, SCADA, and AVL systems, it enables analytics, visualization, and DSO capabilities. It automates meter-to-cash workflows, unifies device and operational data management, and supports bulk exports, MultiSpeak APIs, and flat-file integrations. MDMS Analytics (SmartMAP) is a control room and engineering analytics platform delivering Advanced Grid Visualization for outage management, load switching, and real-time network awareness. Engineers can perform what-if modeling, transformer monitoring, voltage analysis, DER/EV detection, system loss analysis, and outage analytics. Short-term load forecasting enables proactive decisions, with a roadmap toward market, power trading, and DERMS integration. EnerConnect (Consumer Engagement Platform) empowers utilities and customers with actionable energy insights. It supports tracking energy usage, understanding trends, and accessing personalized insights. For utilities, it enables improved communication, electronic bill delivery and payment, and higher satisfaction. EnerConnect integrates seamlessly with MDMS and analytics platforms for accurate, timely, and secure data. Meridio Solutions digitizes network surveys, staking, and asset management. Its three modules—Works (manages work order lifecycles), Designer (plans and stakes services using GPS and asset data), and Inspector (captures field asset data and synchronizes with GIS)—help utilities improve efficiency, accuracy, and asset management. Green Button Solution provides secure access to customer energy data through a Green Button Data Publishing System and Portal powered by UtilityAPI, supporting transparency and engagement. Professional Services: Includes outsourced meter reading, hosted AMI/AMR solutions, and remote AMR/AMI operator services to reduce risk and improve efficiency.  About Utilismart Corporation Product Categories Customer Services & Management > Customer Data Management/Analytics Customer Services & Management > Mobile Apps Distribution > Advanced Distribution Management Systems (ADMS) Distribution > Distribution Data Management and Analytics Distribution > Distribution Management Systems (DMS) Distribution > Distribution System Network Monitoring Distribution > Distribution System State Estimation Distribution > Outage Management Energy Trading/ Energy Markets > Forecasting/Day-ahead Markets Energy Trading/ Energy Markets > Power - Trading Collateral  BROCHURE  C&I Energy Manager  BROCHURE  Meridio Solutions - Survey/Staking and Work Management Software  BROCHURE  Utilismart MDMS Analytics - HealthMAP  BROCHURE  Utilismart MDMS Analytics - SmartMAP Contact Us  Miro Karlicic  Vice President, Business Development and Innovation  Miro Karlicic Vice President, Business Development and Innovation  Miro Karlicic is Vice President of Business Development and Innovation at Utilismart Corporation, bringing decades of leadership in the energy sector to drive strategic growth and innovation. He oversees global sales, marketing, business development, and product strategies, ensuring Utilismart’s solutions meet evolving industry needs.  Miro combines technical and commercial expertise across utility solutions, including Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI), Meter Data Management, Outage Management, Engineering Analysis, Settlements, Conservation and Demand Management (CDM), Big Data, Utility Analytics, and Cybersecurity. He guides development of scalable, future-ready solutions that deliver measurable value to customers.   He began his career with the International Organization for Migration (IOM) and held positions with the European Commission and the City of London before joining Utilismart in 2003. Since then, he has contributed to the company’s growth through multiple senior roles.  Miro holds an MBA from the Australian Institute of Business and is a certified ISO27001 Lead Auditor. He has served on Fanshawe College’s IT Advisory Committee, the Ontario IESO Smart Metering System Implementation Program (SMSIP), and IT Standing Advisory Committees. He currently sits on the IESO Revenue Metering Standing Committee and represents Utilismart on the Green Button Alliance, advancing industry standards.  Read More  Thomas Code  Customer Success & Sales Representative  Thomas joined Utilismart as a Business Development Analyst in 2023, bringing a diverse professional background and a strong customer-centric mindset to the organization. In his role, Thomas is responsible for driving customer satisfaction and sales growth across Canada and the United States by building and managing strong relationships with both new and existing customers. He works closely with customers to understand their needs, resolve issues, and identify opportunities for upselling, cross-selling, and long-term account growth.  Thomas supports lead generation, sales pipeline management, and the delivery of product presentations and live demos, while ensuring clear communication between customers and internal sales, product, and marketing teams. He also contributes to market research, competitive analysis, and product development initiatives by translating customer feedback into actionable insights that support business and product growth.  Prior to Utilismart, Thomas worked at EllisDon as a Subcontractor Payables Coordinator, where he implemented more efficient invoice processing methods to improve operational workflows. He also competed professionally on PGA Tour Canada, developing a high level of discipline, adaptability, and performance under pressure. Thomas holds a degree in Business Management from Fanshawe College.  Read More  Noah Gray  Customer Success and Sales Representative  Noah Gray joined Utilismart in September 2024 as a Customer Success and Sales Representative, serving as an account manager for customers across Canada, the United States, and Jamaica. In this role, he is responsible for driving customer satisfaction and supporting revenue growth by building and nurturing strong relationships with both new and existing clients.  With experience in B2B sales and marketing, Noah takes a consultative, customer-first approach, focused on understanding each client’s operations, challenges, and objectives. He works closely with customers to address concerns, identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling, and deliver tailored solutions that maximize value and long-term success. Noah also supports lead generation, sales pipeline management, and the development of sales proposals, product presentations, and live demonstrations.  Noah plays an active role in gathering customer feedback and collaborating with internal teams to support product development, service enhancements, and continuous improvement initiatives. He remains engaged in market and industry research to help inform sales strategies and business development efforts.  Noah holds an Honours degree in Business Administration from the Ivey Business School at Western University, where he developed a strong foundation in strategy, relationship management, and data-driven decision-making.  Read More  Dave Kidd  Senior Product Manager  David Kidd joined Utilismart in 2009, initially focusing on distribution engineering simulation software and system analysis for electric utilities. With the introduction of smart metering in Ontario, he helped drive advanced use of meter data through the development of HealthMAP utility analytics. In 2012, through work associated with the Ontario Smart Grid Fund, David brought together distribution simulation and HealthMAP analytics to help create SmartMAP—expanding utility visibility from planning and analysis into near real-time operational intelligence. Since then, he has continued to evolve these solutions into the dynamic grid monitoring and optimization tools used by utilities today.  As Senior Product Manager, David provides strategic leadership across product direction and customer delivery for the SmartMAP and HealthMAP portfolios, working closely with product support, development, sales, and utility stakeholders. He supports customer implementations through discovery, configuration guidance, data validation, training, go-live readiness, and ongoing continuous improvement—driving usability enhancements, product quality, and customer satisfaction. David holds a Bachelor of Computer Science from the University of Windsor.  Read More  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Utilismart provides a comprehensive digital utility platform that enables electric utilities to transition into modern Distribution System Operators (DSOs). Their core offering includes a Next Generation Meter Data Management System (MDMS) with Advanced Grid Visualization, outage management, and automated meter-to-cash workflows, integrating operational data from SCADA, AMI, and GIS systems to optimize grid reliability and performance.
customer_type: Electric Utilities and Distribution System Operators (DSOs)
investment_thesis_one_liner: A mission-critical data orchestration layer that enables mid-market utilities to modernize their grids and manage the complexity of DERs and electrification without full-scale legacy system overhauls.
rationale: Utilismart is an established provider in the Meter Data Management (MDMS) space, positioning itself for the DSO transition; however, it appears to be a mature SME or private-equity style growth asset rather than an early-stage venture disruptor. The value proposition is solid but operates in a crowded legacy market with long utility sales cycles and limited asymmetric upside compared to emerging tech.

They provide critical grid infrastructure components ranging from distribution-level capacitor banks to transmission-level 850kV transformers.
customer_type: Utilities, Federal Government Agencies, Industrial Power Operators, and Renewable Energy Developers
investment_thesis_one_liner: VaOpto provides essential, US-manufactured electrical infrastructure to mitigate global supply chain bottlenecks for utility transformers and support grid modernization.
rationale: VaOpto is a mature (founded 2005) industrial manufacturer of traditional utility hardware rather than a high-growth technology startup. While it serves critical infrastructure needs, its business model (SME manufacturing) and low technology leverage (traditional physics/hardware) do not align with venture capital investment criteria.

pitch_summary: Virtual Peaker is a software-as-a-service platform that enables utilities to manage virtual power plants by integrating distributed energy resource management systems (DERMS), customer engagement, and load forecasting into a single ecosystem.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A leading SaaS platform for the orchestration of behind-the-meter assets, enabling utilities to leverage virtual power plants for grid stability and decarbonization.
rationale: Virtual Peaker operates a high-margin, cloud-native SaaS model that capitalizes on the inevitable decentralization of the grid by aggregating BTM assets for utility control. The company demonstrates strong venture potential through its scalable recurring revenue model and proprietary IP in DERMS orchestration, though it faces risks related to slow utility sales cycles and integration complexity.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: SaaS platform that allows utility companies to remotely manage residential smart devices (like thermostats, water heaters, and EV chargers) to balance the electric grid during peak demand.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and the rise of Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) are destabilizing the grid, forcing utilities to find software alternatives to building expensive fossil-fuel peaker plants.
vc_dossier.analogy: Air Traffic Control for smart home energy devices
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary device integrations (OEM partnerships with Nest, Ecobee, Honeywell, etc.) and 'Gravity Connect' API that creates high switching costs for utilities.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Veriten, Moore Strategic Ventures, Emerson Ventures, FreshTracks Capital, Bluegrass Angels
vc_dossier.key_customers: Southern Maryland Electric Cooperative (SMECO), CoServ, MMWEC, Liberty Utilities

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Wesco Distribution, Inc. Wesco Utility Solutions  The utility industry is rapidly changing and the increasing demand for reliability, resiliency and security has never been more important. Utilities are tasked with meeting electrification demands through grid modernization and infrastructure upgrades, integrating new technologies and automation, harnessing distributed energy resources, upgrading cybersecurity processes, navigating new government regulatory policies, and designing systems to better manage operations.    Wesco has a broad portfolio of solutions, programs and project services to help utilities harden and modernize their transmission, distribution and substation infrastructure. We partner with investor-owned utilities, (IOUs) public powers, contractors, and engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) firms to drive efficiency and reliability at all stages of their power projects.   Booths Ground Level — 3245 Mark As Visited Company Information www.wesco.com/ About Wesco Distribution, Inc.  Wesco has a broad portfolio of solutions, programs and project services to help utilities harden and modernize their transmission, distribution and substation infrastructure. We partner with investor-owned utilities, (IOUs) public powers, contractors, and engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) firms to drive efficiency and reliability at all stages of their power projects. The journey towards a more resilient and reliable grid means that utilities must make upgrades in infrastructure, implement automated distribution and asset management technologies, leverage efficient distributed energy resources, develop a comprehensive cybersecurity framework, and continue grid hardening efforts. When it comes to large, complex utility projects, Wesco can help you put it all together. From planning to project completion and close-out, Wesco is dedicated to our customers throughout their entire project cycle. With years of experience and in-depth knowledge in the utility industry, we are a trusted partner to help utilities shape their future. From strategy to execution, Wesco’s reputation for delivering proven solutions for supply chain efficiency and agility and for finding smarter, faster ways to reduce costs and streamline processes, sets us apart from the competition. Our comprehensive and customizable supply chain services, lean procedures and innovative approaches are specifically designed to address the challenges that modern utilities are facing and help them implement long-lasting solutions. rationale: 1NCE is a high-growth venture scale-up (30k customers, 40m devices) disrupting the IoT connectivity market with a 'lifetime flat rate' software-defined model that removes friction for utilities and OEMs. Their massive scale creates a defensive moat against traditional carrier pricing models, positioning them as a critical horizontal layer for grid digitization.

vc_dossier.hq_location: Cologne, Germany (with offices in Miami, London, Tokyo, etc.)
vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: 1NCE provides a 'Connect & Forget' cellular network for Internet of Things (IoT) devices. Instead of complex monthly phone bills, they sell a pre-paid SIM card for a flat fee (e.g., $10) that lasts for 10 years. This allows utilities to connect millions of smart meters without managing millions of recurring invoices.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Smart Metering Boom' & 'Utilities Digitization'. With 2.2 billion smart meters expected by 2030, utilities need a zero-maintenance connectivity solution to replace manual meter reading and balance the grid in real-time.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Southwest Airlines' of IoT Connectivity (Low-cost, no-frills, flat-rate) or 'The AWS for IoT Data' (Infrastructure-as-Code).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Business Model Innovation (Lifetime Flat Rate vs. Recurring Telco Bill) backed by a Proprietary Software Stack (1NCE OS) that strips out 90% of typical telco overhead. Their 'Tier-1' network access is secured via strategic investment from Deutsche Telekom.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Deutsche Telekom, SoftBank Group, I Squared Capital, Kensington Capital Partners, Vicenda Group.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Over 23,000 customers (20% are Utilities). Includes major gas, water, and electricity providers in Italy, Netherlands, UK, Germany, and USA. Specific names are often under NDA, but they serve the 'Smart Metering' infrastructure for national grids.

name: Abjayon, Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Abjayon, Inc. Booths Ground Level — L6543 Mark As Visited Company Information www.abjayon.com/ About Abjayon, Inc.  Abjayon is a global technology and consulting company empowering utilities and energy enterprises with intelligent, end-to-end digital transformation. Established in 2007 and headquartered in Fremont, California, Abjayon is a trusted Enterprise Solutions and Professional Services provider focused exclusively on the utilities sector. With a team of 350+ professionals across North America, the Philippines, and India, we bring deep domain knowledge, Oracle product expertise, and innovation-driven engineering to help utilities modernize operations, enhance efficiency, and deliver superior customer experiences. As a specialized Oracle Energy & Water partner, Abjayon supports utilities worldwide in the implementation and ongoing support of the full Oracle Utilities product suite — from grid operations to customer engagement. Our leadership and core engineering teams, many of whom come directly from Oracle Utilities R&D, bring hands-on experience across Customer to Meter (C2M), Customer Care & Billing (CC&B / CCS), Meter Data Management (MDM), Work & Asset Management (WAM / WACS), and Network / Outage / Distributed Energy Management (NMS / OMS / ADMS / DERMS). To date, Abjayon has delivered over 30% of Oracle MDM’s global footprint and implemented, upgraded, and supported more than 30 million smart meters for leading utilities worldwide. Abjayon’s service portfolio spans Advisory, Delivery, and Managed Services, covering solution implementation, cloud modernization, process optimization, and long-term support. We serve both public sector and investor-owned utilities, aligning technology with business strategy to drive measurable outcomes. Guided by the principle of “purity of thought and action”, Abjayon continues to enable smarter, connected, and sustainable utilities — building the foundation for a resilient energy future. vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Adaion builds 'Digital Twin' software for power grids, allowing utility operators to visualize and manage their low-voltage networks (the 'last mile' of electricity) in real-time. By using AI to analyze data from existing smart meters, they can detect power theft, predict congestion from EV charging, and plan upgrades without needing expensive new sensors.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Electrification of Everything (EVs, Heat Pumps) is overloading the 'edge' of the power grid, forcing utilities to digitize their blind spots.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Google Maps' for the Power Grid (Real-time visibility into traffic/congestion)
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary AI algorithms that reconstruct grid topology and detect non-technical losses (fraud) using only existing smart meter data, avoiding the need for costly hardware rollouts.

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Aemc Instruments Booths Upper Level — UL144 Mark As Visited Company Information www.aemc.com About Aemc Instruments  AEMC® Instruments, provides professional electrical test, measurement, and protection solutions for industrial, commercial, utility, and infrastructure markets. Our portfolio ranges from power quality analyzers, ground resistance testers and insulation resistance testers to auxiliary relays, analog transducers, and panel meters. Chauvin Arnoux founded in 1893 and AEMC® Instruments (part of the Chauvin Arnoux® group) founded in 1976 are industry leaders in current measurement probes, power quality and energy analyzers, ground resistance testers (including our revolutionary tower testing system) and insulation resistance testers. Our full product line also includes clamp-on meters, transformer ratiometers, power quality meters, harmonic power meters, data loggers, multimeters, light meters, micro-ohmmeters, oscilloscopes, cable testers, environmental testers, thermal imaging cameras and numerous other electrical test instruments. We are expanding our offering to include proven auxiliary relays, analog transducers, and panel meters from our European partners for demanding U.S. applications such as nuclear power plants and rail systems. In addition to our products, AEMC® offers seminars and webinars on ground resistance, insulation resistance, and power quality testing. Our products are backed by over 130 years of experience in test and measurement instruments and encompass the latest international standards for quality and safety. All AEMC® solutions are designed and manufactured to meet the latest international standards for quality and safety and are available through a worldwide network of distributors. We also develop custom products on an OEM basis. vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Aetheros develops AetherOS (AOS), a Linux-based operating system that transforms standard smart meters into intelligent 'edge computing' devices. Just as Android enabled phones to run diverse apps, AetherOS allows utilities to install third-party software on meters to manage solar power, EVs, and grid stability locally, without replacing the hardware.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization & Distributed Intelligence: The shift from centralized power generation to millions of distributed assets (solar, batteries, EVs) requires real-time processing at the 'edge' of the grid, which legacy dumb meters cannot handle.
vc_dossier.analogy: Android for Smart Meters

pitch_summary: Ampacimon provides grid monitoring solutions, specializing in Dynamic Line Rating (DLR) technology that enables utilities to optimize the capacity and reliability of their transmission and distribution networks using real-time sensor data.

vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Interconnection Queue Crisis. Thousands of renewable energy projects are stalled because the physical grid lacks capacity. Building new lines takes 10+ years; Ampacimon unlocks 'hidden' capacity in existing lines immediately.
vc_dossier.analogy: Waze for the Power Grid (Finding hidden capacity on existing 'roads' to avoid building new ones)
vc_dossier.moat_description: University spin-off (University of Liège) with patented vibration monitoring hardware. They hold the largest global dataset of Dynamic Line Rating (DLR) operations, creating a data advantage in predictive line behavior vs. software-only competitors.

name: Apricorn
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Apricorn Booths Ground Level — 6107 Mark As Visited Company Information www.apricorn.com About Apricorn  THE GLOBAL LEADER IN PORTABLE DATA ENCRYPTION Headquartered in Poway, California, Apricorn provides FIPS validated, hardware-based, 256-bit AES encrypted external storage products to companies and organizations that require high-level protection for their data at rest. From the beginning of our secure product development, all of our internal critical security componentry continues to be sourced from trusted companies from all over the world, originating from countries that remain in good standing with the United States. Since we began in 1983, dozens of award-winning innovations have been developed under the Apricorn brand as well as for a number of leading computer manufacturers on an OEM basis. Apricorn’s unique approach to employing 256-bit internal and portable encryption is particularly valuable for verticals whose data security practices are regulated (e.g., finance, healthcare, education, and insurance.) And for federal, state, and local governments, Apricorn's encrypted USB drives and devices set the standard for data security for both North America and the rest of the world. Since every Apricorn Aegis drive is encrypted and authenticated exclusively by way of its own onboard keypad and internal hardware, there is never any software involvement in these critical security parameters. As such, Apricorn device CSPs are never shared with that device's host computer. As we continue to create innovations to defend against today’s threats, as well as to anticipate tomorrow’s, rest assured that your secrets are safe with us. name: Arkion Solutions AB
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Arkion Solutions AB Booths Upper Level — UL742 Mark As Visited Company Information www.arkion.co About Arkion Solutions AB  Arkion offers an AI-powered software solution that transforms inspection data—including images, thermal, and lidar—into precise insights on the condition and health of power grids ranging from low to high voltage. Our platform streamlines access to this data and insights, tailored specifically to the demands of the power grid industry. Trusted by the world’s largest and most forward-looking power grid companies, Arkion is transforming the way we can care for our power grids to build a grid fit for a net-zero future. Utilizing cutting-edge Machine Learning and AI technologies, Arkion efficiently transforms vast volumes of images and 3D data points into structured insights regarding grid health. Our approach is characterized by AI-powered analysis, bolstered by validation from our internal quality assurance team, ensuring precision in every result and data improvement with every iteration. Arkion's ability to rapidly train models to detect a vast majority of common and critical defects on grids stems from our unparalleled database of high-fidelity data. Employing a "Human-in-the-Loop" methodology and harnessing the full spectrum of available data, we rapidly develop robust AI models, offering a swifter and more cost-effective alternative to our competitors. pitch_summary: Arkion offers an AI-powered software platform that transforms inspection data—including images, thermal, and lidar—into precise insights on the condition and health of power grids. The platform utilizes machine learning and a human-in-the-loop methodology to detect defects and support vegetation management for utilities across all voltage levels.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Arkion addresses the bottleneck of manual grid inspections by automating defect detection and vegetation management through a scalable, AI-driven software platform.
rationale: Arkion leverages computer vision and a proprietary 'Human-in-the-Loop' dataset to automate the labor-intensive process of grid inspection and vegetation management, offering a high-margin software business model. While the company faces the typical slow sales cycles of regulated utilities, its hardware-agnostic platform approach provides significant scalability and recurring revenue potential compared to service-heavy competitors.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Arkion (formerly Skyqraft) builds software that acts as an automated inspector for power grids. Instead of humans manually reviewing thousands of hours of drone or helicopter footage, Arkion's AI automatically scans images and LiDAR data to spot dangerous defects like rusting towers, broken insulators, or trees growing too close to power lines.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Resilience & Wildfire Mitigation
vc_dossier.analogy: Radiology AI for the Power Grid
vc_dossier.moat_description: Data advantage from processing millions of grid images to train specialized defect-detection models; shift from hardware-heavy drone operations to a scalable, software-only analytics platform.

name: Asplundh Engineering Services
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Asplundh Engineering Services Booths Ground Level — 1037 Mark As Visited Company Information www.asplundh.com About Asplundh Engineering Services  One Asplundh For more than 97 years, Asplundh has provided safe and cost-effective vegetation management and infrastructure design, construction, and support solutions to investor- and cooperatively owned utilities, departments of transportation and other municipal and government agencies. Through its One Asplundh approach the company provides access to its full complement of service offerings through a single point of contact. A family-owned and operated corporation headquartered near Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Asplundh has grown to employ more than 37,000 professionals who serve customers and communities throughout the U.S., Canada, New Zealand and Australia. Vegetation management is Asplundh’s original business, and the company is an industry leader in arboriculture, technology and safety practice. It offers a wide range of vegetation services that include scheduled and emergency tree pruning and removals, right-of-way clearing and maintenance with specialized equipment, integrated vegetation management with herbicides, and rapid, comprehensive storm restoration. Asplundh Infrastructure Group offers a unified approach to project management for a broad range of services including the construction and maintenance of overhead and underground power systems, roadway lighting, traffic signals and intelligent transportation systems, testing and commissioning, pole inspection and treatment, ami/amr deployments, and storm and emergency recovery. Asplundh Infrastructure Group includes the following companies: American Lighting and Signalization, Asplundh Electrical Testing, Asplundh Construction, Asplundh Engineering Services, Grid One Solutions, Utility Lines Construction Services and Traffic Control Devices. Across every service line Asplundh offers, safety is a core value. For every customer we serve, our number one priority is ensuring the safety and health of our employees, our partners, and the communities in which we work. This duty of care extends to emergency response in which, in our role as a first responder, we take every precaution to ensure public safety. We are further committed to providing a diverse and inclusive, understanding that a diverse workplace promotes employee engagement and improves business outcomes. Our management team promotes career advancement training at every level and encourages employees to gain certifications in arboriculture, herbicide application, line work, leadership and more. This commitment to career advancement contributes to Asplundh’s reputation for professionalism and safety. For more information, visit asplundh.com. pitch_summary: AssetCool provides a deep-tech solution using photonic coatings and robotic platforms to increase the capacity of existing power transmission lines by up to 30% through thermal management and surface optimization.
investment_thesis_one_liner: AssetCool offers a cost-effective alternative to physical grid expansion by using proprietary coatings and robotics to unlock hidden capacity in existing transmission infrastructure.
rationale: AssetCool fits the classic deep-tech venture profile by solving a high-value global problem (transmission congestion) with a proprietary material science and robotics moat, offering asymmetric returns if they become the standard for line uprating. The £10M raise and pilot traction indicate they have graduated from seed risk but still face the scaling hurdles of a hardware-enabled utility service.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: AssetCool uses specialized robots to apply a high-tech coating to existing power lines. This coating reflects heat and solar radiation, keeping the lines cooler. Because cooler wires can safely carry more electricity, this process effectively unlocks up to 30% more grid capacity without building new infrastructure.

vc_dossier.analogy: Sunscreen for Power Lines
vc_dossier.moat_description: Dual Moat: Proprietary 'photonic' nanomaterial formulation combined with a patented robotic deployment system ('CapacityN') capable of coating live lines.

name: Atop Technologies
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Atop Technologies Booths Ground Level — 6335 Mark As Visited Company Information www.atoponline.com/ About Atop Technologies  Founded in Taiwan over 30 years ago, ATOP develops both ready-made and customized industrial networking solutions for a wide range of industries. Over the years, ATOP has successfully deployed solutions across various sectors, including industrial automation, machine building, power substations, transportation, railways, and smart cities, with special expertise in energy and railway applications. As an ISO-9001 and ISO-27001 certified manufacturer, ATOP adheres to stringent global safety and operational standards. Their wide range of networking solutions not only meet international regulations such as EMC for harsh environments, but are certified for specialized industries, such as IEC 61850-3 for substation use, as well. Besides Ethernet switching, ATOP also stands out in protocol gateways and serial device servers, which are known for their high reliability and fault tolerance. These solutions enable seamless conversion between Ethernet and serial-based devices across widely used protocols in various industries, including Modbus, Profibus, IEC 61850, DNP3, and others. Looking forward, ATOP thrives in providing better software management, stronger, cost-effective hardware, and add-value features like wireless connectivity, redundancy, cybersecurity, and precise timing. ATOP’s commitment to excellence is rooted in its in-house manufacturing and dedicated R&D efforts. This approach allows the company to maintain strict quality control while driving continuous technological innovation, ensuring exceptional long-term performance even in the most challenging environments. pitch_summary: Base Power designs, manufactures, installs, and networks residential battery systems to create a decentralized utility model. By owning the assets and aggregating them into virtual power plants, the company provides homeowners with low-cost backup power while offering grid operators dispatchable, flexible capacity that rivals utility-scale plants.
customer_type: Residential Homeowners and Utility Grid Operators
investment_thesis_one_liner: Base Power vertically integrates the energy storage value chain to offer 90% cheaper backup power for consumers while building a high-margin distributed utility asset base.
rationale: Base Power disrupts the utility sector with a vertically integrated, asset-heavy 'decentralized utility' model that aggregates residential storage into Virtual Power Plants. While the extreme capital intensity of owning the assets and the logistical friction of residential installation pose significant risks, the potential to secure recurring grid services revenue while solving reliability issues offers massive venture upside.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Base Power is a modern, decentralized electric utility. Instead of building massive, centralized power plants, they install large battery storage systems in residential homes at a subsidized rate (approx. $700 vs. $18,000 retail). In exchange, they manage these distributed batteries as a single Virtual Power Plant (VPP), dispatching energy to the grid during peak demand to prevent blackouts and lower costs, while ensuring homeowners have backup power during outages.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Grid Capacity Crunch. US electricity demand is skyrocketing due to AI data centers and electrification, while extreme weather is destabilizing aging infrastructure (especially in Texas). Utilities cannot build power lines fast enough; Base Power offers a 'dispatchable' energy solution that deploys in months rather than years.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Starlink' of Energy Storage (Distributed hardware forming a resilient network) or 'SolarCity' for Batteries (Asset-heavy leasing model).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Vertical Integration & Balance Sheet Moat. Unlike software-only VPPs, Base Power manufactures its own hardware (building a factory in Austin) and owns the battery assets on customer walls. This allows them to capture the full economic value of power arbitrage and creates a high barrier to entry for competitors lacking their $1B+ capital scale.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Series C of $1 Billion led by Addition (October 2025)

vc_dossier.key_customers: Residential Homeowners (Texas/ERCOT market), Lennar (Homebuilder partnership), Grid Operators (ERCOT)

name: Battelle Energy Alliance (Idaho National Laboratory)
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Battelle Energy Alliance (Idaho National Laboratory) Booths Upper Level — MR-3873 Mark As Visited Company Information inl.gov/ About Battelle Energy Alliance (Idaho National Laboratory)  Idaho National Laboratory, managed by Battelle Energy Alliance, is one of 17 U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) national laboratories. Located in Idaho Falls, Idaho, INL employs more than 6,000 researchers and support staff with a common vision, to change the world’s energy future and secure our nation’s critical infrastructure. INL’s national security mission focuses on protecting the nation’s critical infrastructure, preventing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and providing direct support to America’s warfighters. From our decades-long work in building and testing more than 50 nuclear reactors in the high desert west of Idaho Falls, INL has developed a deep understanding of operational technology and the cybersecurity and engineering needed to secure systems and provide critical function assurance. For over a decade, INL has been conducting vulnerability assessments and developing technology and tools to increase infrastructure security and resilience. With a strong emphasis on industry collaboration and partnership, INL is enhancing power grid reliability, control systems cybersecurity and physical security systems. INL conducts advanced cyber training and oversees simulated competitive exercises for national and international customers. The lab supports cybersecurity and control systems programs for the departments of Homeland Security, Energy and Defense. INL staff members are also frequently asked to provide guidance and leadership to standards organizations, regulatory agencies and national policy committees. Prior to this position he served as the Department Manager for the Infrastructure Security team, responsible for subject matter experts at INL that specialize in power systems and cyber engineering. As a strategic leader for various Fortune 250 companies, Tony has driven innovation, fostered collaboration, and delivered impactful solutions in an ever-evolving technological landscape. Throughout Tony’s career, he has seamlessly navigated the intersection of technology, business strategy, and operations, enabling organizations to stay ahead in dynamic and competitive markets. Tony is an engineering executive with over 38 years of experience across diverse industries including defense, engineering, procurement, construction, telecommunications, wireless products, software R&D, wearable devices, Industrial IoT, and healthcare products and services.  Tony has worked with U.S. Navy, U.S Army Corp of Engineers, U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), Egyptian Electrical Authority, Hershey Chocolate, Becton Dickinson, Ericsson, Qualcomm, Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile, San Diego Padres, and regional utility companies. As Chief Power Grid Scientist at Idaho National Laboratory, she leads critical programs at the intersection of cyber-physical security, consequence-driven engineering, and operational transformation for U.S. infrastructure.  She has directed more than $300 million in strategic R&D investments, developed real-time situational awareness tools for small utilities, and provided high-level cybersecurity guidance to the White House. Dr. Stewart has testified before Congress on national security threats tied to adversarial technologies in the U.S. energy sector. Her cross-sector contributions range from grid modernization at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory to cyber incident response efforts supporting hundreds of electric cooperatives nationwide.  With a foundation that includes applied engineering consulting, Dr. Stewart has consistently bridged the gap between innovation, policy, and frontline implementation. She helped launch the first operational micro-PMU network and founded a national cybersecurity conference for utilities. Her ongoing mission is to enable secure, digitally-optimized, and resilient energy infrastructure at scale. name: Big Sky Aerial Solutions
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Big Sky Aerial Solutions Booths Ground Level — 5544 Mark As Visited Company Information www.bigskyaerialsolutions.com/ About Big Sky Aerial Solutions  Big Sky Aerial Solutions provides electric utilities with reliable, safety-driven aerial data and inspection solutions designed to support operations, engineering, vegetation management, and asset planning. Our services are built around how utilities actually use data—prioritizing clarity, defensibility, and real operational value rather than experimental technology. Aerial Inspection Services include distribution, transmission, and substation inspections using high-resolution RGB and thermal imagery. Big Sky performs component-level inspection of poles, conductors, hardware, insulators, transformers, and substation equipment, with thermal collections timed for peak or seasonal load conditions to identify overheating and performance issues. All inspection results are reviewed by experienced analysts, certified linemen, and thermographers, with issues classified and ranked to align with utility maintenance workflows. Inspection data is fully GIS-integrated and delivered through major mapping systems and the INSPECTR platform. LiDAR & Corridor Mapping services provide high-accuracy LiDAR data for transmission and distribution systems. Deliverables support clearance analysis, vegetation encroachment modeling, and engineering workflows, including PLS-CADD-ready point clouds for compliance and design. These datasets are well-suited for line rebuilds, reconductoring projects, and capacity upgrade planning, and are repeatable to support change detection and long-term asset management. Vegetation & Wildfire Risk Analysis helps utilities identify and prioritize right-of-way vegetation concerns while integrating terrain and wildfire risk factors. These analyses support defensible wildfire mitigation planning and risk-based maintenance decisions. Clear, actionable mapping products are delivered to guide field crews and vegetation contractors efficiently and safely. Substation & Facility Modeling combines aerial and terrestrial data capture to produce accurate 3D models of substations and utility facilities. These models provide reliable existing-conditions documentation to support planning, upgrades, and expansions, while reducing site visits and improving coordination across engineering, operations, and management teams. INSPECTR – Inspection Visualization & Action Platform provides a web-based, map-centered environment for reviewing inspection imagery and findings. INSPECTR centralizes large volumes of RGB, thermal, and inspection data, applies dynamic severity rankings for prioritization, and allows inspection results to be layered with operational context such as wildfire risk, outage history, and load. The platform also tracks repair actions, mitigations, and resolution status, creating a clear system of record that supports audits, regulatory compliance, and defensible decision-making. Storm Response & Rapid Assessment services enable rapid deployment following storm events to support damage assessment and line patrols. Aerial identification of downed vegetation and damaged assets allows utilities to receive maps and imagery quickly, improving restoration planning, crew efficiency, and field safety during emergency response. Utility-Focused Operations are built around safety-first, utility-approved sUAS workflows and experience supporting electric cooperatives, municipal utilities, and investor-owned utilities. All deliverables are designed to integrate seamlessly with existing utility systems and processes, with an emphasis on practical, dependable solutions that utilities can rely on today.  About Big Sky Aerial Solutions Product Categories IT/OT > Mapping Equipment and Solutions/GIS Transmission > Drones/Helicopters/Inspection Transmission > Vegetation Management/Wildfire Mitigation Collateral  WHITE PAPER  INSPECTR — Visual Asset Management for Grid Resilience  BROCHURE  Summary of Services Contact Us  Austin Seback  CEO  I lead Big Sky Aerial Solutions, delivering high-precision geospatial solutions for power utilities, AEC, and mapping projects. We combine sUAS/LiDAR technology, GIS, and photography-driven insights to help clients make smarter, faster, and more cost-effective decisions.  We transform large and complex spatial datasets — from point clouds and 3D models to imagery — into visually compelling, actionable insights. Whether inspecting utility corridors, documenting construction progress, or mapping terrain, we ensure clients can clearly interpret and act on their data.  Core strengths: - sUAS & LiDAR operations at scale with accuracy and precision. - GIS integration, photogrammetry, and point-cloud analysis. - Photography-informed visualization for clarity and decision-making. - Optimized workflows to reduce field time and improve data accuracy. - Converting raw geospatial data into actionable insights for planning, design, and asset management.  I’m passionate about combining technology, creativity, and leadership to turn geospatial data into strategic decisions for utilities, infrastructure, and civil projects. name: Black & Veatch Corporation
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Black & Veatch Corporation Booths Ground Level — 4815 Mark As Visited Company Information www.bv.com/en-US About Black & Veatch Corporation  Black & Veatch at DistribuTECH: Driving Grid Modernization For more than 110 years, Black & Veatch has delivered innovative infrastructure solutions that power communities and enable progress. Today, we’re leading the charge in grid modernization—helping utilities and energy providers build smarter, stronger, and more resilient systems for a rapidly evolving energy landscape. Our expertise spans advanced distribution management systems (ADMS), automation, private networks and spectrum, DER integration, and OT cybersecurity—all designed to optimize reliability and accelerate the transition to cleaner, more connected energy. pitch_summary: Buzz Solutions provides an AI-powered visual intelligence platform that automates the inspection and monitoring of power grid infrastructure. By analyzing data from drones, helicopters, and ground-level captures, the platform identifies structural defects and vegetation hazards to help utilities prevent outages and wildfires.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Camus Energy builds software that gives electric utilities a real-time 'control room' for the modern grid. name: CARIAN
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral CARIAN Booths Upper Level — UL915 Mark As Visited Company Information thecariangroup.com/ About CARIAN  CARIAN is a woman-owned consulting and advisory firm built exclusively for the power sector. We partner with investor-owned electric and gas utilities to plan, manage, and deliver complex capital infrastructure, including transmission, distribution, grid modernization, energy efficiency, data centers, and nuclear generation. We are a pure-play power firm. We do not operate outside the power sector. Power is all we do. That focus means our teams speak the language of utility operations, understand regulatory and rate case dynamics, and know how to navigate the organizational complexity that comes with large capital programs. Today, we manage over $1 billion in active utility capital programs nationwide, with nearly all of our work performed under prime contracts directly with utilities. Utilities hire us to own outcomes. Our clients include some of the largest investor-owned utilities in the country, and they bring us in when predictability, governance, and delivery certainty matter most. Our services span three areas: Program Management. We provide program and project delivery, PMO leadership, project controls, portfolio planning, and regulatory readiness support, including management of energy efficiency portfolios. Our teams embed with utility organizations to drive accountability, identify risk early, and keep programs on schedule and on budget. Field Services. We put boots on the ground through construction oversight, quality assurance, safety, and contractor management. We maintain a physical presence alongside clients and their contractors to ensure what gets planned actually gets built. Digital & Analytics. We design and deploy reporting systems, program performance dashboards, and operational tools that give utility leaders real-time visibility into cost, schedule, safety, and productivity. Our approach is practical: technology in service of better decisions, not technology for its own sake. What sets CARIAN apart is the combination of advisory rigor and an execution and delivery mindset. We do not hand over a strategy deck and walk away. We stay through delivery, operating as an extension of our clients’ teams with low-noise communication and a bias toward getting things done. CARIAN is headquartered in New Jersey, with teams embedded at client sites across the country. name: CelPlan Technologies, Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral CelPlan Technologies, Inc. Booths Ground Level — 4648 Mark As Visited Company Information celplan.com About CelPlan Technologies, Inc.  CelPlan is a global technology consulting and systems integration firm supporting utilities, critical infrastructure operators, and enterprises through the full lifecycle of private and mission-critical networks. With decades of hands-on experience and a team of senior engineers, architects, and consultants, CelPlan delivers practical, vendor-neutral solutions grounded in real-world deployment expertise. CelPlan specializes in helping utilities plan, deploy, and operate private wireless networks, including Private LTE. Our services span strategic consulting, spectrum and technology strategy, detailed network design and engineering, and operational support. We provide troubleshooting, performance optimization, and managed services to ensure networks meet long-term reliability, scalability, and security requirements. In parallel, CelPlan delivers in-depth technology training programs for engineering, operations, and leadership teams, translating complex wireless concepts into actionable knowledge. Beyond communications networks, CelPlan offers turnkey deployment and integration of physical security and sensing systems. This includes video surveillance and access control systems, commissioning of AI-driven video analytics, and integration of sensors across operational environments. Our team supports end-to-end delivery—from architecture and design through installation, commissioning, and performance validation—ensuring systems are operationally aligned with utility workflows and regulatory constraints. CelPlan also supports advanced analytics and digital transformation initiatives, integrating AI solutions with operational data to improve situational awareness, asset monitoring, and decision-making. We provide LiDAR-based mapping and modeling services to create high-fidelity digital twins of substations and critical facilities, enabling improved planning, safety analysis, and long-term asset management. Known globally for technical leadership, CelPlan’s experts are industry authors, trainers, and conference speakers, and our RF planning tools are used in universities worldwide. Technology- and vendor-neutral by design, CelPlan helps clients navigate evolving technologies with confidence, delivering solutions that are engineered for performance today and sustainability over decades. name: CENTRII
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral CENTRII Booths Upper Level — UL800 Mark As Visited Company Information cyberenergia.com/ About CENTRII  Centrii a cybersecurity company purpose-built to protect the operational technology (OT) environments that power the world’s energy infrastructure. As energy systems become more digital, interconnected, and regulated, Centrii helps operators move beyond fragmented security tools toward a unified, risk-driven approach to OT cyber resilience. At the core of our offering is Centrii Portal, Centrii’s OT cybersecurity platform designed specifically for energy and industrial environments. Centrii provides deep visibility into OT assets, communications, and vulnerabilities - without disrupting critical operations. Built with the realities of energy OT in mind, the platform supports legacy systems, modern control architectures, and hybrid IT/OT environments across generation, transmission, distribution, and renewables. Centrii Portal goes beyond traditional monitoring by delivering regulatory compliance, actionable threat intelligence, and financial risk insight in a single platform. Energy operators can continuously assess and demonstrate compliance with key regulations and standards such as NERC CIP, IEC 62443, and regional regulatory frameworks. Compliance data is automatically mapped to operational environments, reducing audit burden while increasing confidence with regulators and stakeholders. The Centrii portal also equips organizations with OT-focused threat intelligence that is relevant, contextual, and operationally actionable. This intelligence-driven approach helps security and operations teams move from reactive defense to proactive risk management. What truly sets Centrii apart is our focus on financial risk quantification for OT cyber threats. Centrii Portal translates technical cyber risks into clear business and financial impact -such as potential downtime, safety implications, regulatory penalties, and revenue loss. This enables executives, boards, and risk leaders to make informed investment decisions, align cybersecurity with enterprise risk management, and communicate cyber risk in business terms.  About CENTRII Product Categories IT/OT > Cybersecurity IT/OT > SCADA & Control Systems Policy and Regulation > NERC/CIP Compliance (Cybersecurity) Collateral  WHITE PAPER  A Practical Guide to Cyber Compliance for Power Systems  BROCHURE  Securing energy operational technology (OT) with advanced cybersecurity Contact Us  Richard Pfeifer  Head of Sale USA  The future of energy is digital, distributed, and interconnected — which makes cybersecurity the backbone of reliability.  I lead U.S. strategy and commercial execution for Cyber Energia, aligning OT resilience with the financial, operational, and regulatory demands shaping renewable energy, BESS, microgrids, and data-center power.  My focus is direct: Reduce risk. Protect availability. Strengthen bankability. Drive adoption.  Operators are expanding portfolios while navigating regulatory pressure, insurer scrutiny, and increasingly frequent OT-targeted attacks. Most teams still lack unified visibility, have uncontrolled vendor access, and struggle to quantify downtime in financial terms.  That’s where I operate.  My background spans SaaS, cybersecurity, energy intelligence, and capital markets. I work with asset managers, operators, OT/ICS engineers, CISOs, and compliance leaders to turn operational exposure into clear business impact — and to accelerate the adoption of the technologies that harden critical infrastructure.  If you’re shaping the next generation of energy or data-center power, let’s connect.  Read More  Rafael Juan Molina Narezzi  Co- Founder  Rafael is the Managing Director of Cyber Energia and an OT cybersecurity expert with over two decades of experience as a business and technology leader for global enterprises. Rafael has spearheaded the transformation of Cyber Energia from incubation within CPF Energy to a leading managed service provider with international clients, including FTSE 100 companies and major private equity firms. Previously, as Group CTO at CFP Energy, Rafael drove technological innovation, leveraging in-house data science and analytics to turn technology into a profitable revenue stream. As CIO at NextEnergy Capital / Wise Energy, his strategic leadership led to pivotal advancements in asset management and operational efficiency through machine learning and AI. Rafael founded the prestigious Cyber Security Summit in South America and contributes as a guest lecturer and speaker worldwide. His ongoing mission is to advance cybersecurity measures that protect and enhance the sustainability of the global renewable energy landscape.    Read More  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: CENTRII is a specialized OT cybersecurity company providing a unified platform designed to protect energy infrastructure across generation, transmission, and distribution. customer_type: Utility Operators, IPPs, and Infrastructure Asset Managers
investment_thesis_one_liner: CENTRII bridges the gap between operational technology security and corporate risk management by quantifying the financial impact of cyber threats on critical energy infrastructure.
rationale: Centrii addresses the high-growth OT cybersecurity market with a scalable software platform that differentiates itself by translating technical NERC CIP compliance into financial risk metrics for C-suite buyers. While the sector has entrenched incumbents (Dragos, Nozomi), the unified risk-quantification approach creates a defensible wedge in the regulated utility sector.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Centrii (formerly Cyber Energia) provides a cybersecurity 'immune system' specifically designed for wind farms, solar arrays, and battery storage. Unlike standard IT security tools, their software understands the unique physical languages (OT protocols) of power machinery, preventing hackers from physically damaging generators or destabilizing the grid.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Digitalization of Danger' in Energy. As power grids decentralize into millions of connected assets (solar/wind/batteries), they expose critical infrastructure to cyberattacks. Simultaneously, new strict regulations (like EU's NIS2 and US NERC CIP) are forcing operators to adopt specialized protection or face massive fines.
vc_dossier.analogy: The CrowdStrike for Renewable Power Plants
vc_dossier.moat_description: Vertical Specificity & Protocol Fluency. While generic cyber firms protect email and cloud servers, Centrii builds proprietary 'OT' (Operational Technology) detection that understands the specific command codes of wind turbines and inverters. This allows them to spot anomalies that look 'normal' to standard IT security tools, creating a high barrier to entry for generalist competitors.
vc_dossier.key_investors: CFP Energy (Strategic/Corporate parent), Angel Investors (Jonathan Navon, Rafael Narezzi)
vc_dossier.key_customers: CFP Energy (Partner/Customer), Various UK Wind & Solar Asset Operators (400+ sites in pipeline as of 2024)

name: Checon, LLC
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Checon, LLC Booths Upper Level — UL239 Mark As Visited Company Information www.checon.com About Checon, LLC  Checon LLC — Booth UL239 (DISTRIBUTECH 2026) Checon engineers copper and aluminum bus bars—rigid and insulated —with integrated silver contacts and silver (ultra-low contact resistance) and tin (corrosion-resistant joints) plating for high-current power distribution, and power disconnect, transformer disconnect, and automatic transfer switch applications. Why it matters : Scalable & flexible: Built to pair with busbar trunking and switchgear for quick reconfiguration and tap-offs as loads grow. Efficient: High-conductivity Cu options minimize I²R losses/voltage drop; Al variants meet ampacity at lower weight and cost. Reliable: Silvered interfaces and insulated assemblies support predictable temperature performance and short-circuit withstand when designed into compliant systems. Core products & options: Rigid, insulated bus bars (Cu/Al): precision-machined sized for high current in tight footprints. Integrated silver contact fabrications and plating: silver for ultra-low milliohm contact resistance and heat shedding; tin for durable, cost-effective bolted connections. Value add: punched patterns, studs/PEMs, insulation/over-molding, and labeling, How we help design teams: Checon collaborates on metal selection (Cu/Al), thickness, silver contact integration, joint design, and plating plan. We tune geometry for temperature rise, magnetic forces, creepage/clearance, and torque, then prototype quickly. Our vertically integrated North American facilities handle machining, contact assembly fabrication, precision plating, and finishing for consistent quality and dependable lead times. Copper vs. Aluminum: Copper: best for peak current density, tight voltage-drop budgets, maximum thermal headroom. Aluminum: best for weight/cost advantages—engineered cross-sections achieve required ampacity. In both cases, silver at contact points reduces resistance and heat; tin protects broad joint areas. Where this fits: Utilities/industry: substations, switchgear, reclosers, motor control, and high-cycle DC links. Let’s build your next system. Bring your drawings or duty cycle to Booth UL239 to review samples, plating options, and case studies—or book a design review with Checon's Applications Engineering and Product Sales group.  About Checon, LLC Product Categories Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Other Electrical Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Switches Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Transformers  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy

While competition is intensifying, the strong regulatory tailwinds (NERC CIP, NIS2) and the critical nature of securing cyber-physical systems provide a deep, enduring moat.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Claroty builds cybersecurity software that protects physical machinery and industrial equipment. Unlike standard antivirus that protects laptops and emails (IT), Claroty protects the 'Operational Technology' (OT) that runs power grids, oil pipelines, and factories, ensuring hackers cannot shut down physical operations or cause safety hazards.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Convergence of IT and OT. Industrial assets (turbines, pumps, grid controllers) were previously offline ('air-gapped'), but are now being connected to the internet for efficiency and AI analysis. This connectivity exposes critical infrastructure to ransomware and state-sponsored cyberattacks, creating an urgent need for specialized security.
vc_dossier.analogy: The CrowdStrike for Industrial Assets
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) technology that understands obscure industrial protocols (e.g., Siemens S7, Modbus) which standard IT security tools cannot read. They have a massive database of industrial asset signatures and strong network effects through strategic partnerships/investments from the largest hardware vendors (Rockwell, Schneider, Siemens).

pitch_summary: ConnectDER designs and manufactures UL-listed meter socket adapters (MSAs) that simplify the connection of distributed energy resources like solar panels, battery storage, and EV chargers directly to the electrical meter, bypassing complex and expensive main panel upgrades.
investment_thesis_one_liner: ConnectDER accelerates the transition to residential electrification by providing a plug-and-play hardware interface that significantly reduces installation time and costs for distributed energy resources.
rationale: ConnectDER solves a critical, expensive bottleneck for residential electrification (main panel upgrades) with a scalable, patent-protected hardware product. The high regulatory barrier to entry serves as a moat, positioning it as a prime acquisition target for major electrical incumbents as DER adoption scales.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: ConnectDER manufactures a 'smart collar' adapter that sits between a home's electric meter and the meter socket. This device allows homeowners to plug in solar panels, EV chargers, and battery storage directly to the grid connection, bypassing the need for expensive and complex upgrades to the home's main electrical panel.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Electrification of Everything (EVs, Heat Pumps) is colliding with aging housing stock; 48 million U.S. homes lack the panel capacity to add new electric appliances without costly upgrades.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'USB Port' for the Home Electrical Grid
vc_dossier.moat_description: Regulatory Entrenchment & Utility Approvals: Their hardware is one of the few UL-listed and utility-approved devices allowed to physically sit between the utility meter and the home, creating a high barrier to entry for competitors who must navigate years of safety testing and utility pilots.

name: Crytica Security
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Crytica Security Booths Upper Level — UL730 Mark As Visited Company Information www.cryticasecurity.com About Crytica Security  Crytica Security is revolutionizing cybersecurity with its patented Rapid Detection & Alert (RDA™) system, providing real-time malware detection that reduces dwell time from over 180 days to seconds. Our lightweight system requires minimal utilization of system resources, making it ideal for small, resource-constrained devices — especially in OT environments — where traditional solutions often struggle. Crytica seamlessly integrates with existing cybersecurity stacks (XDR, MDR, EDR), enhancing defenses without major infrastructure changes. Focused on securing devices across OT, IIoT, IoT, and IT environments, we offer continuous protection with reduced false positives and actionable alerts because If You Can't Detect, You Can't Protect™.  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Crytica Security provides a patented Rapid Detection & Alert (RDA) system designed for real-time malware detection in OT, IIoT, and IT environments. Their lightweight solution minimizes resource consumption, making it ideal for securing resource-constrained devices in critical infrastructure where traditional cybersecurity stacks are often too heavy.
customer_type: Industrial Operators, Utilities, and Infrastructure Managers
investment_thesis_one_liner: Crytica bridges the security gap in critical infrastructure by offering a high-performance, low-overhead malware detection engine specifically optimized for the resource-constrained hardware found in OT and IIoT environments.
rationale: Crytica addresses a critical, regulatory-driven market (OT Cybersecurity) with a defensible technical wedge: securing the resource-constrained legacy devices that competitors often overlook. While the venture upside is clear due to NERC CIP tailwinds, the company faces significant execution risk in a crowded market dominated by well-capitalized unicorns like Dragos and Claroty.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Crytica makes a tiny, lightweight piece of software (a 'probe') that sits on critical industrial devices—like smart meters or power controllers. Unlike traditional antivirus that scans for known files, Crytica acts like a motion sensor, detecting the exact moment malicious code is injected into the device's memory, alerting operators in seconds.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Convergence of IT and OT': As power grids and water systems connect to the internet (IoT), they become vulnerable to cyberattacks (e.g., Volt Typhoon). Traditional security software is too heavy for these old, low-power industrial devices, creating a desperate need for lightweight protection.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Smoke Detector' for Critical Infrastructure (Passive until it senses a threat, then instant alarm).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented 'Rapid Detection & Alert' (RDA) technology that uses a micro-agent (only 70kb) capable of running on low-power legacy hardware where competitors like CrowdStrike cannot operate. It focuses on 'process interference' rather than file scanning, allowing it to catch 'zero-day' (unknown) threats.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Sierra Angels
vc_dossier.key_customers: Major U.S. Metro Public Utility (Deployed Feb 2025), targeted pilots in Water, Power, and Gas sectors.

name: Cyberlock Inc
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Cyberlock Inc Booths Ground Level — 5807 Mark As Visited Company Information cyberlock.com About Cyberlock Inc  CyberLock is a leading provider of key-centric access control systems. Over the past 25 years, we have consistently prioritized the security needs of our most critical industries. To address the specific requirements of power utilities, we have designed our products with exceptional versatility. By combining rugged, electronic cylinders with our CyberLock Flex hardwired system and keyless CyberLock Blue, NFC, and Flash technologies, facilities can secure a variety of access points, all managed through our CyberAudit-Web software management system. Our latest release, the IP68-rated NFC padlock with CMAC AES-256 challenge-response authentication, ensures the protection of critical assets, safeguarding against unauthorized access attempts. Recognizing that power utility access points are frequently situated in remote locations with limited power availability, our CyberKey smart keys provide all the necessary power to the lock cylinder, eliminating the need for hardwiring. Our cost-effective cylinders can be conveniently retrofitted into existing hardware on doors, cabinets, or perimeter gates. Programmable smart keys offer personalized privileges for each user, while audit trail records assist North American power facilities in complying with NERC CIP standards for physical security and documentation. pitch_summary: Deepmatrix is a geospatial analytics company that transforms large-scale data from LiDAR, drones, and satellites into actionable intelligence. vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Deepmatrix builds the 'operating system' for heavy industry assets. Their software ingests massive amounts of data from drones, satellites, and sensors to automatically detect faults in power lines, monitor mining excavations, and map urban infrastructure without human intervention.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Digitization of Dust'—Old-world industries like mining and utilities are facing a data deluge from drones and sensors but lack the software to process it. Simultaneously, the energy transition requires 3x more grid infrastructure, making manual inspection impossible.
vc_dossier.analogy: Databricks for Geospatial Data
vc_dossier.moat_description: Full-stack handling of the 'Geospatial ETL' problem. Unlike competitors that just do visualization or just do storage, Deepmatrix's 'Singularity' platform handles the entire lifecycle: Ingestion -> Cleaning -> AI Analysis -> Visualization, creating high switching costs for enterprise clients.
vc_dossier.key_investors: YourNest Venture Capital, Arali Ventures, Abhishek Goyal (Founder of Tracxn), IIT ISM (Incubator)
vc_dossier.key_customers: Mining Corporations, Power Transmission Utilities, Urban Land Management Agencies (Targeting US & Australia expansion)

pitch_summary: Delphire provides Sentinel, a field-proven wildfire detection system that utilizes sensors and Artificial Intelligence to provide real-time alerts, early-stage reporting, and visual verification to mitigate damage and assist in root cause analysis for utility infrastructure.

rationale: Delphire offers a high-leverage solution for the critical utility challenge of wildfire mitigation, combining proprietary hardware with AI for high-margin recurring alerts. While hardware-dependent, the urgent regulatory environment and high cost of failure for utilities create a strong venture-scale opportunity despite long sales cycles.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Delphire builds solar-powered AI 'lookout' devices called Sentinel units that are attached to power poles and in remote forests to detect wildfires. The devices use a mix of thermal cameras, smoke sensors, and visual cameras to identify a fire in under a minute and send a picture and GPS coordinates directly to emergency responders' phones.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Wildfire liability and climate resiliency; utilities are facing multi-billion dollar lawsuits for fire ignitions and are under extreme pressure to deploy early-warning monitoring systems.
vc_dossier.analogy: A 'Ring Doorbell' for the forest and power lines.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'Oracle AI' for real-time edge computing (analyzing video locally to save bandwidth), multi-sensor data fusion (combining visual, heat, and chemical smoke detection), and a hardware design that stays online in remote areas via satellite and solar power.
