name: DNP Users Group
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral DNP Users Group Booths Ground Level — 4810 Mark As Visited Company Information www.dnp.org/ About DNP Users Group  Join DNP-UG to shape the future. Valuable services and strategic benefits are included in your annual membership. Your priorities—cost efficiency, risk reduction, secure protocols, and cyber defense—are at the core of our mission. For more than 30 years, DNP-UG has been a trusted platform for protocol development, supported by expert teams committed to industry success. As a nonprofit, member-driven organization, your support helps us strengthen your systems. Our goal: enhance interoperability and cybersecurity through standards, conformance, guidance, and education. Why become a member? Access our library of standards, notes, and bulletins, participate in training (included) on complex topics such as IEEE Std P1815.2, SAv6, AMP, and Zero Trust; expand your professional network; and stay up to date on standards and best practices. We provide SME support and facilitate discussion forums. If you are an industry expert or seeking mentorship, join one of our committees to help develop standards. Participate in our Conformance Certification Program (CCP) to ensure your products remain up to date. Utilities and consultants can also benefit from CCP and use their membership to ensure vendor product certification. Take the next step today—Join the DNP-UG and lead the way in securing and modernizing critical infrastructure. Contact Sara Yuill at membership@dnp.org.  About DNP Users Group Product Categories Consultants/Project Services > Training/Education Distribution > Distribution Automation Distribution > SCADA & Control Systems Contact Us  Sara Yuill  Membership Coordinator  Ron Farquharson  President and COO of the DNP Users Group  Ronald Farquharson, RET, SMIEEE, is President and COO of the DNP Users Group, an independent consultant, & a Senior Life Member of IEEE. He chairs two PES working groups related to IEEE Std. 1815TM (DNP3) & IEC 61850, & serves on the DistribuTECH Advisory Committee. As a Principal Consultant, he offers services in intelligent grid technology research, planning, applications, & standards.   Ron's expertise covers electric utility transmission & distribution automation, including data communications, substation architectures, networks, gateways, synchrophasor measurement, precision time, equipment monitoring, & standards. He has supported utilities and research organizations with technology assessments, surveys, program reviews, requirement analysis, procurement, investment, & deployment planning. Ron authored many research reports & a road-mapping methodology involving infrastructure, standards, benchmarking, gap analysis, compliance, risk, & applications. After creating numerous roadmaps, he led a team that produced a Roadmap Guidebook with methodologies, lessons, recommendations, & best practices. vc_dossier.analogy: The 'CrowdStrike' for power plants and factories.

name: EcoMetricx
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral EcoMetricx Booths Upper Level — UL242 Mark As Visited Company Information www.ecometricx.com/ About EcoMetricx  EcoMetricx is a California-based energy orchestration company that helps utilities, aggregators, and energy program operators turn complex, fragmented data into coordinated, real-world action. As electrification, distributed energy resources, and decarbonization accelerate, energy organizations face increasing operational complexity, regulatory scrutiny, and market volatility. EcoMetricx addresses these challenges by providing an orchestration layer that connects data, forecasting, optimization, and execution across energy systems. At the core of our approach is an integrated sense–predict–optimize–act framework. The platform ingests and harmonizes high-volume, high-frequency data from advanced metering infrastructure (AMI), connected devices, customer systems, tariffs, weather, market data, and internal enterprise sources. This information is curated into a unified, trusted data foundation that supports both real-time operations and long-term planning. EcoMetricx applies advanced analytics, economics, and machine learning to anticipate system behavior and inform decisions. Capabilities include customer-, portfolio-, and grid-level forecasting; load disaggregation and response modeling; and dynamic program and asset evaluation. These predictive insights enable organizations to move from reactive operations to proactive planning. Building on these forecasts, we support optimization across multiple objectives—such as cost, reliability, emissions, and customer outcomes—while respecting operational, contractual, and regulatory constraints. The platform enables coordinated management of demand response, customer engagement programs, asset and portfolio operations, grid analytics, hedge and market exposure, and decarbonization initiatives. EcoMetricx operationalizes decisions through execution and learning. Actions can be dispatched through APIs, control systems, and customer communication channels, supported by dashboards, reports, and AI-enabled decision interfaces. Measurement and verification workflows provide audit-ready transparency for regulators and stakeholders, while continuous learning loops improve performance over time. With deep expertise spanning data engineering, data science, economics, and behavioral science, we help energy organizations align insight with action—delivering more efficient operations, stronger regulatory outcomes, and measurable progress toward reliability and decarbonization goals. EcoMetricx’s customers include Entergy, Franklin Energy, San José Clean Energy, Silicon Valley Clean Energy, and Xcel Energy.  About EcoMetricx Product Categories Customer Services & Management > Customer Data Management/Analytics Customer Services & Management > Demand Response Customer Services & Management > Residential Engagement Programs Collateral  BROCHURE  An Introduction to EcoMetricx & Our Services  BROCHURE  EcoMetricx: Energy, Orchestrated. Contact Us  Ben Westrich  Chief Economist  Benjamin is a distinguished U.S. Army veteran with 14 years of service, during which he was awarded the Bronze Star and completed multiple combat tours as a Forward Observer (13F). During these tours he served as a senior non-comissioned officer.  He holds a Bachelor of Arts degree, graduating summa cum laude with Highest Distinction in Economics and Mathematics from the University of Colorado, Colorado Springs. Benjamin furthered his education with a Master of Science in Economics from Purdue University, focusing on big data and time series forecasting, with a research emphasis on dynamic models. He is currently a PhD candidate at the University of California, Irvine, specializing in urban economics and machine learning, with research interests in causal inference, difference-in-differences, and urban price gradients.  In addition to his academic and military achievements, Benjamin is an entrepreneur. He founded and continues to serve on the board of a company dedicated to gym and retail brand development and niche market consulting.  Read More  Dr. Matt Harding  CEO  Dr. Matthew Harding is an Econometrician and Data Scientist who develops techniques at the intersection of machine learning and econometrics to answer Big Data questions related to individual consumption and investment decisions in areas such as energy, water, and health.  ‍He has extensive experience in designing and evaluating large-scale field experiments in collaboration with industry leaders to measure the individual and social consequences of individual or corporate choices and the extent to which Big Data can be used to improve choices and lead to more accurate, targeted programs and products.  ‍Matt has a wealth of applied research experience as the Founding Director of the Duke - UNC USDA Center for Behavioral Economics and Healthy Food Choice Research and the Duke Energy Data Analytics Lab. He has also worked as an expert consultant for the Department of Justice, World Bank, Apple Inc., and the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission.  ‍He is also currently a Professor of Economics and Statistics at UC Irvine. Matt held previous faculty positions at Duke University and Stanford University. Matt received his Ph.D. in Economics from MIT, his M.Phil. in Economics from the University of Oxford, and his B.A. in Economics and Philosophy from the University College London.  Read More  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: EcoMetricx provides an energy orchestration platform that uses a sense-predict-optimize-act framework to help utilities and aggregators manage complex data from AMI, IoT devices, and market sources. The platform applies machine learning and econometrics to deliver grid-level forecasting, demand response optimization, and measurement and verification for decarbonization programs.
customer_type: Utilities, Energy Aggregators, and Energy Program Operators
investment_thesis_one_liner: A sophisticated data orchestration layer led by academic experts in econometrics that bridge the gap between fragmented utility data and real-time grid optimization.
rationale: EcoMetricx represents a high-leverage software play that solves the data fragmentation problem inherent in utility AMI and DER deployments. While sales cycles are long, the platform's ability to provide a sense-predict-optimize-act framework creates a sticky operational moat in a rapidly decarbonizing grid.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: EcoMetricx builds AI software that helps power companies understand and predict how their customers use electricity. It analyzes data from smart meters to prove exactly how much energy is being saved by various programs, while using high-end encryption to ensure individual customer privacy is never compromised.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and strict new data privacy laws (like those in California) mean utilities need to analyze massive amounts of power data to keep the grid stable, but they cannot legally look at individual customer habits without the privacy-first technology EcoMetricx provides.
vc_dossier.analogy: A privacy-protected 'Google Analytics' for the power grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'Causal AI' models that distinguish between actual energy savings and random factors like weather changes, combined with a 'zero-trust' privacy architecture that meets strict utility regulatory standards (NIST and CPUC compliance).
vc_dossier.key_investors: Unknown
vc_dossier.key_customers: Silicon Valley Clean Energy (SVCE), Xcel Energy, Entergy, Apple, and the World Bank.

name: Edge Zero Pty Limited
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Edge Zero Pty Limited Booths Ground Level — 6225 Mark As Visited Company Information edgezero.co About Edge Zero Pty Limited  Edge Zero delivers the real-time operational visibility utilities need—without waiting for full AMI rollout or costly infrastructure overhauls. Our platform creates a data layer for the last mile, giving utilities live insight into transformer-level voltage, current, and power quality. This enables faster fault detection, reduced truck rolls, improved SAIDI/SAIFI performance, and more confident DER integration. We help utilities address immediate operational challenges on the low voltage network—the most underserved and least-instrumented part of the grid. By equipping the secondary side of the grid with real-time data, utilities can strengthen reliability today and prepare for a more complex, distributed energy future. Edge Zero’s solution is purpose-built for operations. It’s fast to deploy, works with or without AMI, and integrates seamlessly with existing GIS and ADMS platforms. Our EdgeSensors support both single- and three-phase configurations and are equipped with remote firmware updates, cloud reporting, and built-in Wi-Fi, cellular and Bluetooth connectivity. Our platform is already trusted by utilities across the U.S. and internationally—from Vermont to Sydney—to improve reliability, optimize grid planning, and expand DER hosting capacity. For utilities facing tighter budgets, regulatory scrutiny, and accelerating electrification, Edge Zero offers a pragmatic way to uplevel system awareness without overhauling core infrastructure. Think of us as a scalable operational upgrade—one that enhances visibility, strengthens resilience, and complements your existing systems. Whether you’re a cooperative, municipal, or IOU, Edge Zero provides the last-mile intelligence that helps you stay ahead of emerging risks, meet performance goals, and serve your communities with confidence. Edge Zero is the fastest way to gain real-time visibility at the edge of the grid—so you can deliver reliability now, and flexibility next. pitch_summary: Elastic Energy provides real-time grid interactivity and revenue optimization for distributed energy resource (DER) developers. Their platform utilizes the Elastic Energy Router to provide edge intelligence, enabling residential and commercial projects to participate in grid services and energy arbitrage while offering vendor-neutral fleet management across multiple OEMs.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Elastic Energy bridges the gap between hardware-agnostic fleet management and grid-edge revenue maximization for DER developers.
rationale: Elastic Energy addresses the critical bottleneck of DER interoperability by providing a vendor-neutral hardware/software gateway that enables sophisticated revenue stacking. The platform's ability to offer real-time edge intelligence creates a sticky ecosystem for developers, though they face risks from incumbents moving toward standardized open protocols.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Elastic Energy builds a software layer that connects and controls different home energy devices—like solar panels, batteries, and heat pumps—regardless of their brand. By acting as a universal remote for these assets, the platform allows homes to automatically reduce energy use when the grid is stressed and sell power back to the market when prices are high.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' (EVs, heat pumps) combined with surging power demand from AI data centers is overwhelming the existing power grid. To avoid massive blackouts and expensive infrastructure upgrades, the grid needs software to intelligently coordinate millions of decentralized 'mini-power plants' in people's homes.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Air Traffic Control' for solar panels and home batteries.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Their defensibility lies in 'Universal Compatibility.' Most competitors are locked into specific hardware brands, but Elastic's software works across any manufacturer (OEM) or protocol without requiring rewiring or firmware changes. This makes them a 'plug-and-play' standard for installers who don't want to be tied to a single vendor.
vc_dossier.key_investors: BDC Capital, Cool Climate Collective, Sidecut Ventures, Spring Activator
vc_dossier.key_customers: Residential solar installers, asset owners, and energy aggregators

Other applications like DLR and DER Impact enable utilities to deliver power at the safest and lowest cost. Meta-Alert® can be integrated with the utilities’ systems (SCADA, A/DMS, OMS) for faster and safer response to grid events. pitch_summary: Electrical Grid Monitoring (EGM) provides the Meta-Alert AI Analytics Platform, combining physical sensors and communication systems to monitor transmission and distribution lines for pre-fault conditions, wildfire mitigation, and dynamic line rating (DLR).
investment_thesis_one_liner: EGM bridges the gap between physical grid infrastructure and digital intelligence through integrated sensing and AI analytics that prevent outages and mitigate climate-related grid risks.
rationale: EGM provides a high-moat integrated solution that captures proprietary empirical data for critical wildfire mitigation and Dynamic Line Rating applications. While the hardware-heavy deployment creates friction, the AI-driven predictive analytics offer high-margin recurring value to regulated utilities.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: EGM develops 'The Meta-Alert System,' which consists of smart sensors that clip onto existing high-voltage power lines and software that analyzes the data. It acts like a digital nervous system for the electric grid, allowing utilities to see exactly where power is being lost, detect equipment failure before it causes a fire, and manage the increased demand from electric vehicles and solar power without needing to build new physical lines.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization and Renewable Integration. Traditional power grids are 'blind' to what happens between the power plant and the home. As we add unpredictable solar and wind energy and heavy EV charging loads, utilities need real-time data to prevent blackouts and manage congestion on aging infrastructure.
vc_dossier.analogy: A Fitbit for the electric grid that monitors 'heart rate' (current) and 'blood pressure' (voltage) to prevent a 'heart attack' (power outage).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary multi-sensing hardware and AI algorithms that monitor seven different parameters (including line sag and temperature) simultaneously from the wire itself. This creates a high barrier to entry compared to software-only startups because the hardware is patented and must meet rigorous utility-grade safety certifications that take years to achieve.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Israel Innovation Authority, The Portland Trust, and several private family offices and utility-focused private equity groups.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Israel Electric Corporation (IEC), and various pilot deployments with utilities in the United States and Europe.

rationale: Eli Technologies captures venture-scale upside by digitizing the fragmented, high-friction processes of residential electrification permitting and incentive capture. While competition from solar sales platforms exists, their focus on automating technical site assessments provides a specific and scalable software moat.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Eli Technologies builds software that helps home contractors (like HVAC and solar installers) automatically find and apply for government rebates and tax credits. Estimated annual revenue is undisclosed as they are a seed-stage startup, but they have piloted their platform with customers performing over $200M in home upgrades.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) and the 'Electrification of Everything.' Billions of dollars in new rebates for heat pumps and solar are currently trapped behind complex, manual government paperwork that Eli's software digitizes.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'TurboTax' for clean energy rebates or the 'Stripe' for climate incentives.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Regulatory data moat: Eli builds and maintains a proprietary database of highly fragmented and constantly changing rebate rules across thousands of different local utilities and state agencies, which is difficult for competitors to replicate manually.

pitch_summary: Engineered Intelligence offers an AI-driven platform called ENGIN™ that integrates asset, grid, spatial, and real-time data to help utilities optimize capital and O&M investments, improve grid reliability, and streamline regulatory outcomes.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Engineered Intelligence leverages AI to unify disparate utility data streams into a single system-wide view, enabling more efficient grid planning and infrastructure investment.
rationale: Engineered Intelligence leverages a high-margin SaaS model that addresses the trillion-dollar utility modernization and wildfire mitigation challenges through AI-driven asset health analytics. While it faces the typical hurdles of long utility sales cycles and complex data integration, its focus on strategic capital allocation provides clear venture-scale leverage.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Engineered Intelligence provides a software platform called ENGIN™ that acts as a predictive 'stress test' for power grids. It analyzes utility data to identify which specific power lines, poles, or transformers are most likely to fail. Unlike basic tools, it models the entire grid as a connected system, allowing utilities to see how a single equipment failure might cascade into a neighborhood-wide blackout, helping them spend their repair budgets more effectively.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' is doubling the load on aging 20th-century power grids. As utilities face extreme weather and rising demand from EVs, they are moving from 'fix it when it breaks' to 'fix it before it breaks' to avoid massive liability and regulatory penalties.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'MRI for the Power Grid' — providing a deep, diagnostic view of internal infrastructure health that simple visual inspections miss.
vc_dossier.moat_description: The company's defensibility is built on proprietary 'Network-Level Risk Modeling' that treats the grid as a physics-based system rather than a list of parts. This methodology delivers >99% outage prediction accuracy. Their high switching costs are bolstered by deep integration into the utility's long-term capital planning and regulatory compliance workflows.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Unknown (Company currently appears to be bootstrapped or grant-funded)
vc_dossier.key_investors: None identified
vc_dossier.key_customers: ATCO, Toronto Hydro, ENMAX, EPCOR, Fortis Alberta, and Versant Power

name: Enline
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Enline Booths Ground Level — 2949 Mark As Visited Company Information www.enline.energy/ About Enline  4 COMPELLING REASONS WHY ENLINE MATTERS: Dynamic Line Rating (DLR) Functionality at Ambient Adjusted Rating (AAR) Price Points: Enline is a new entrant to North America with a proven and fully functional DLR that exceeds FERC 881 standards and already performs comparably to our US competitors on three other continents. However, our version costs about 70% to 85% less and can be deployed roughly 3 to 4 times faster. Building on a Foundation: Enline's approach centers on creating a mirror-image 3D Digital Twin Replica of the target asset, coupled with the minimum number of physical sensors needed to continuously verify the >95% accuracy of our system. Once created by our team, this digital twin enables rapid addition of additional beneficial offerings, such as our Network State Estimation (NSE), which can significantly boost the operational resilience of the connected system. ABB's Choice: Enline's platform has been chosen as ABB's strategic partner to provide Dynamic Line Rating (DLR) and Network State Estimation (NSE) to its Advanced Energy Management System (AEMS) clientele worldwide. It's not "Us or Them": If a client wants to use a traditional "Sensor-Heavy" DLR on their "Congestion-Plagued" flagship transmission lines, we completely understand. However, if they seek an elegant, proven, cost-effective, and much less labor-intensive way to 1) optimize achievable capacity by more than 20%, 2) significantly reduce unnecessary operational expenses, and 3) easily improve their real-time monitoring capabilities across a much broader portion of their transmission portfolio, then they really should know about us.  About Enline Product Categories Distribution > Advanced Distribution Management Systems (ADMS) Distribution > Vegetation Management/Wildfire Mitigation Transmission > SCADA & Control Systems Collateral  BROCHURE  Enline's Capital Efficient DLR Offering  CASE STUDY  Reducing Vegetation Related Outages with Digital Twin and Vegetation Management Contact Us  Duarte Fleming  CGO  Duarte Fleming, Chief Growth Officer at Enline, brings over 10 years of experience in industrial AI and machine learning and holds an MSc in Electrical Engineering and Telecommunications, with a background as Lead Data Scientist at Siemens and co-founder of a tech startup.  Manuel Lemos  CEO  Manuel Lemos, CEO and co-founder of Enline, showcases over 15 years of experience and holds an MSc in Civil Engineering. With a background as the Director of Business Development at Mota Engil Energia and leadership roles at VOITH SIEMENS, including General Manager and Sales Director for LATAM. Manuel also serves as a Non-Executive Director at Hydroplus Global.  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Enline provides a 3D Digital Twin-based platform for Dynamic Line Rating (DLR) and Network State Estimation (NSE), offering a low-sensor, cost-effective alternative to traditional hardware-heavy monitoring systems for power transmission and distribution. Their technology enables utilities to optimize grid capacity by more than 20% while reducing deployment time and capital expenditure by up to 85%.
customer_type: Electric Utilities and Transmission System Operators (TSOs)
investment_thesis_one_liner: Enline disrupts the high-cost, hardware-centric DLR market with a software-first digital twin approach that increases grid capacity at a fraction of the cost and deployment time of incumbents.
rationale: Enline presents a high-leverage venture opportunity by replacing expensive, hardware-heavy monitoring with a software-centric digital twin approach that scales rapidly across existing transmission infrastructure. Their strategic partnership with ABB and compliance with FERC 881 signals strong market validation and a clear path to global utility adoption.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Enline creates a software-based 'digital double' of power lines that monitors their performance and detects faults in real-time. Unlike traditional solutions, it does not require installing physical sensors or hardware on high-voltage wires, instead using physics-based algorithms and existing grid data to predict maintenance needs and prevent accidents like wildfires.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization and Wildfire Prevention: As the world shifts to renewable energy, aging power grids are struggling to handle the load and are increasingly responsible for catastrophic wildfires. Utilities are desperate for remote monitoring solutions that are fast to deploy.
vc_dossier.analogy: A remote health-tracker for the power grid that does not require a wearable.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary sensorless technology. By using advanced physics-based algorithms to model transmission lines remotely, Enline avoids the high costs, safety risks, and maintenance associated with physical hardware (IoT) sensors used by competitors.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Criteria Venture Tech, Santander InnoVentures, EIT InnoEnergy, HCapital Partners, Portugal Ventures
vc_dossier.key_customers: EDP (Energias de Portugal), Sterlite Power, Neoenergia

pitch_summary: Exodigo provides a non-intrusive underground mapping solution using multi-sensor fusion, 3D imaging, and AI to create accurate subsurface maps, reducing the need for exploratory excavation in utility and infrastructure projects.
customer_type: Utilities, transportation providers, and government agencies
investment_thesis_one_liner: Exodigo de-risks critical infrastructure development by applying elite military-grade signal processing and AI to provide unprecedented visibility into the subsurface, drastically reducing utility strikes and project delays.
rationale: Exodigo offers a high-leverage AI platform that solves the multi-billion dollar problem of underground line strikes and exploratory excavation costs. While the business requires physical sensor deployment, the proprietary multi-sensor fusion and AI interpretation provide a deep technical moat and software-like scalability in data value.

vc_dossier.hq_location: Tel Aviv, Israel and Palo Alto, California, USA
vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Exodigo uses a combination of high-tech sensors (mounted on drones or carts) and AI to create detailed 3D maps of what lies beneath the ground. This allows construction and utility companies to see pipes, cables, and soil layers without having to dig 'exploratory holes,' preventing accidental damage to existing infrastructure.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and aging urban infrastructure require massive new underground construction; however, accurately mapping the existing web of buried pipes and wires is currently a manual, error-prone process that costs the global economy over $100B annually in damages and delays.
vc_dossier.analogy: An 'MRI for Construction Sites' that provides a complete internal view of the earth before a single shovel hits the dirt.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Defensibility is built on a proprietary 'Multi-Sensor Fusion' engine. While competitors use single sensors (like just Ground Penetrating Radar), Exodigo combines data from magnetic, electromagnetic, and satellite sources, processing it through signal-processing algorithms developed by elite military intelligence veterans. This achieves 99% accuracy compared to the 50% industry standard.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Zeev Ventures, Greenfield Partners, 10D VC, Square Peg, JIBE, National Grid Partners, Vintage Investment Partners, Leblon Capital, Alpha Partners
vc_dossier.key_customers: National Grid, PG&E, LA Metro, Amtrak, HS2 (UK High-Speed Rail), and Israel Electric Corporation.

name: EXOSENS
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral EXOSENS Booths Ground Level — 6050 Mark As Visited Company Information www.exosens.com/ About EXOSENS  Exosens is a high‑tech leader with over 85 years of expertise in electro‑optical technologies for amplification, detection, and imaging. Its portfolio includes travelling wave tubes, advanced cameras, neutron and gamma detectors, and light‑intensifier tubes, supporting customers in demanding environments. With 11 R&D and production sites across Europe and North America and more than 1,800 employees, Exosens is recognized globally for innovation and tailored solutions. At DISTRIBUTECH 2026, Exosens will showcase its intensified SUV camera for corona discharge detection and the Ceres T thermographic camera for real‑time monitoring of transmission lines. Visit Exosens in San Diego from February 2–5, 2026, to explore these technologies firsthand.  Product Categories Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Sensors Collateral  BROCHURE  Ceres T 1280  BROCHURE  Power Grid Surveillance Solutions Contact Us  Jeremy R Head  Regional Sales Manager-Eastern North America  Exosens delivers cutting‑edge imaging technologies that help utilities detect faults early and enhance the reliability of high‑voltage power networks.   Our SUV solutions (Photonis brand) combine a high‑sensitivity image intensifier with a high‑performance CMOS sensor, enabling precise, daytime‑capable detection of corona discharge in high‑voltage power lines. This intensified imaging architecture ensures exceptional sensitivity and accuracy, supporting proactive maintenance and reducing the risk of equipment degradation or failure.   Complementing this, our LWIR solutions (Xenics brand) provide powerful thermal imaging capabilities for early identification of power line defects linked to rising temperatures and system stress. Designed with compact SWaP characteristics, these LWIR cameras and cores integrate seamlessly with industry‑standard interfaces such as MIPI CSI‑2, USB, and UVC, making them ideal for inspection systems, drones, and industrial monitoring platforms. Together, our SUV and LWIR technologies offer a comprehensive, multi‑spectral approach to grid surveillance, empowering operators to prevent outages, minimize maintenance costs, and strengthen grid resilience. This intensified imaging architecture ensures exceptional sensitivity and accuracy, supporting proactive maintenance and reducing the risk of equipment degradation or failure.   Complementing this, our LWIR solutions (Xenics brand) provide powerful thermal imaging capabilities for early identification of power line defects linked to rising temperatures and system stress. Designed with compact SWaP characteristics, these LWIR cameras and cores integrate seamlessly with industry‑standard interfaces such as MIPI CSI‑2, USB, and UVC, making them ideal for inspection systems, drones, and industrial monitoring platforms. Together, our SUV and LWIR technologies offer a comprehensive, multi‑spectral approach to grid surveillance, empowering operators to prevent outages, minimize maintenance costs, and strengthen grid resilience. pitch_summary: Expand Power manufactures modular, multiport solid-state transformers designed to address infrastructure bottlenecks for data centers and renewable energy by providing more customizable and cost-effective power conversion hardware.
customer_type: Data Center Operators and Renewable Energy Infrastructure Developers
investment_thesis_one_liner: Leveraging deep technical expertise in power electronics to replace traditional transformers with highly scalable solid-state technology for the rapidly expanding data center and renewables markets.
rationale: Expand Power is a high-conviction venture play targeting the critical power conversion bottleneck in AI data centers and renewable integration with modular silicon-carbide technology. While hardware capital intensity and manufacturing scaling present hurdles, the team's pedigree and the $100B+ market for high-efficiency, space-saving solid-state transformers provide significant venture-scale upside.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Expand Power builds smart, 'solid-state' power transformers that replace traditional, bulky grid hardware with compact electronics. Their flagship product, PowerGuard, is 70% smaller than standard equipment and includes built-in sensors to monitor safety and grid health in real-time.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The global transformer shortage (lead times now exceed one year) and the massive demand for grid-side power from AI data centers and EV charging hubs that lack physical space for old-school equipment.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Solid State Drive' for the power grid—replacing old, heavy, mechanical-like parts with high-speed digital electronics.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patent-pending hardware designs using wide-bandgap semiconductors and proprietary firmware that allows for fine-grained control of electricity flow, which legacy hardware cannot replicate.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Grant of $50K in January 2025; previously raised a Seed round in late 2024.
vc_dossier.key_investors: American-Made Solar Prize, VentureWell, Urban-X, Activate Global, Joules Accelerator, Cyclotron Road, Dominion Energy Innovation Center.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Targeting data center operators, utility companies (like Dominion Energy), and industrial developers needing rapid power deployment.

pitch_summary: Fire Neural Network (FNN) provides a centralized AI enterprise platform, the Wildfire Hub, designed to track, manage, and mitigate wildfire risk and liability for utilities. The platform assists with Wildfire Mitigation Plans (WMPs), vegetation management, and real-time situational awareness to establish and prove a standard of care for grid assets.
investment_thesis_one_liner: FNN addresses the massive financial and operational liability of wildfire risk for utilities through an AI-driven situational awareness platform that automates compliance and risk mitigation.
rationale: Fire Neural Network offers a highly scalable AI SaaS solution addressing the existential multi-billion dollar liability threat utilities face from wildfires. While utility sales cycles are a significant hurdle, the platform's ability to codify and prove 'standard of care' provides a powerful regulatory driver for adoption.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Fire Neural Network (FNN) provides a hardware-and-software system that detects 'High-Risk Lightning' strikes—rare, long-duration electrical discharges that cause the majority of lightning-ignited wildfires. By using a patented sensor network and AI, the platform alerts utilities and emergency responders to potential fire ignitions within seconds, often before smoke or flames are visible to cameras or satellites.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Wildfire liability and grid resilience; electric utilities are facing multi-billion dollar legal exposures from fires, driving a shift from reactive firefighting to proactive, AI-driven ignition prevention.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'ShotSpotter' for wildfire-starting lightning strikes.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary defensibility through patented 'High-Risk-Lightning' (HRL) hardware sensors and a specialized AI model trained on lightning physics to distinguish fire-starting strikes from the 95% of lightning that is harmless.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Accelerator funding from 35 Mules and Cox Cleantech in mid-2025; previously supported by NSF and USDA grants.
vc_dossier.key_investors: National Science Foundation (NSF), U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Cox Cleantech, 35 Mules (Florida Power & Light accelerator), Endless Frontier Labs.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Florida Forest Service, Clay Electric Cooperative, San Bernardino County Fire Department, and the Australian Bushfire Initiative.

name: Firescape Inc
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Firescape Inc Booths Upper Level — SU-5A Mark As Visited Company Information www.firescape.ai About Firescape Inc  Firescape provides wildfire risk and mitigation analytics software to electric utilities. Public utilities face increasing challenges in managing the growing threat of wildfires and ensuring uninterrupted power supply while safeguarding their infrastructure. We leverage satellite imagery, weather data and asset data with AI to enable better preparedness, response and recovery to catastrophic events. Firescape's geospatial platform provides a holistic approach to wildfire mitigation by with situational awareness of wildfire spread, predictions of where to do fire protections settings such as non-reclose or even public safety power shutoffs, as well as long-term mitigation investment optimization. By leveraging Firescape's software, utilities can make fast, repeatable, defensible decisions to prevent wildfires and reduce impacts.  Product Categories Consultants/Project Services > Engineering/EPC Distribution > Vegetation Management/Wildfire Mitigation Transmission > Vegetation Management/Wildfire Mitigation Collateral  BROCHURE  Firescape Contact Us  Carter Breckenridge  Sales  Holly Eagleston  CEO and Founder  Dr. Eagleston is the founder of Firescape, a wildfire risk mitigation SaaS and consulting company dedicated to helping utilities safeguard critical infrastructure and communities they serve from catastrophic wildfire. She has over a decade over experience in geospatial science, wildfire science and energy security. She previously served as a Principal Member of Technical Staff at Sandia National Laboratories where she led $6M in R&D projects funded by the Department of Energy. She has a PhD from Virginia Tech in Geospatial and Environmental Analysis, and worked for the Bureau of Land Management mapping active wildfires and fire suppression operations. She founded Firescape to help utilities make fast, defensible decisions on wildfire mitigation.  Read More  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Firescape provides an AI-driven geospatial platform for electric utilities to analyze wildfire risks, predict spread, and optimize mitigation investments using satellite imagery and weather data.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Firescape addresses critical utility liability and grid resilience by transforming satellite and weather data into actionable wildfire mitigation and investment strategies.
rationale: Firescape offers a high-leverage SaaS platform addressing the massive, existential liability of wildfire risk for utilities through AI-driven geospatial analytics. While it faces the standard hurdles of long utility sales cycles and established competitors like Technosylva, its ability to optimize CapEx investments provides a compelling ROI for regulated buyers.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Firescape provides an AI-powered platform that helps electric companies predict wildfire risks in real-time. By analyzing satellite images and weather data, the software tells utilities exactly where a fire might start or how it might spread, allowing them to turn off power lines only when absolutely necessary to prevent disasters without causing wide-scale blackouts.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Increasing legal and financial liability for power companies caused by utility-ignited wildfires and the rising cost of insurance for the energy grid.
vc_dossier.analogy: A Google Maps-style navigation system for predicting wildfire risk and behavior on the electric grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Exclusive licensing and technology transfer of physics-based wildfire simulation and satellite data analysis tools developed over several years at Sandia and Los Alamos National Laboratories.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Grant from the New Mexico Advanced Energy Award Pilot Program (May 2025)
vc_dossier.key_investors: New Mexico Economic Development Department, Los Alamos National Laboratory (NM LEEP), Sandia National Laboratories
vc_dossier.key_customers: Western U.S. electric utility companies (currently engaged via regulatory pilots and stakeholder meetings with the Arizona Corporation Commission).

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: FlyFreely provides a software platform that acts as a digital mission control for companies using drones. It helps them schedule flights, manage pilot licenses, track maintenance, and ensure every flight follows government safety regulations automatically.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and aging infrastructure are driving a massive shift toward using drones for automated inspections of power lines, wind turbines, and solar farms to reduce human risk and costs.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Salesforce' for commercial drone fleets.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Defensibility stems from 'Compliance Lock-in.' name: Forsite Consultants
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Forsite Consultants Booths Upper Level — UL140 Mark As Visited Company Information forsite.ca/ About Forsite Consultants  Forsite brings decades of experience and expertise to its full spectrum of geospatial intelligence services. From data collection and analysis to future-ready insights, we have the capacity to devise and deliver the essential site-based intelligence our clients need to make smart, safe, actionable decisions. Our heritage bridges the natural and digital worlds by combining the practical knowledge of more than 200 professional foresters, technical specialists, analysts, and pilots with a range of leading geospatial technologies and a fleet of 55+ aircraft. Able to deliver services across the United States and Canada from over 33 locations, we are trusted partners for our public and private sector clients. Forsite’s diversity and depth of knowledge and skills is always expanding, and currently includes natural resource and environmental management, digital inventory services, high-density Lidar collection and analysis, oil and gas pipeline monitoring, wildfire risk management, and more.  About Forsite Consultants Product Categories Energy Trading/ Energy Markets > Risk Management Transmission > Vegetation Management/Wildfire Mitigation Contact Us  John Davies  Manager - Wildland Fire  John is a Registered Professional Forester with the Association of B.C. Forest Professionals with over 30 years of wildland fire management experience. He has a solid foundation in wildfire management and fire ecology and applies his operational fire knowledge to all aspects of his work. His interests are wildland fire and fuel management, prescribed burning, community interface protection, the rehabilitation of sensitive ecosystems. He is passionate about working with First Nations to build capacity within their membership with regards to wildland fire and burning, communities to develop responsibly following FireSmart guidelines, and with forest licensees to integrate fire back into forest management.   John started community protection and wildfire management work in 2004 as one of only a few professional foresters in BC that had extensive practical operational experience in wildfire suppression, fuel management operations, and prescribed burning. He has developed this extensive knowledge of the ecological role of fire, fire behaviour, how fuel conditions affect wildfire behaviour, and of tactical strategies required to protect communities and other values. This knowledge is a result of hundreds of hours fighting forest fires, and countless hours prescribing, implementing and monitoring fuel management and prescribed burning projects during his 30-year career in wildfire management.  Read More  Mike Parlow  Manager - Digital Inventory  Mike Parlow has successfully led and managed remote sensing projects for the past 25 years. Mike has managed technology projects in forestry and aerospace partnered with federal and state governments, large corporate clients, the Department of National Defense, and multiple organizations within the US Department of Defense. These efforts have ranged from pure research & development projects to system integration work involving leading edge technology and systems. Mike was a founding partner in Object Raku Technology and was a key contributor to the creation of Object Raku’s Tree Species Identifier (TSI) software suite. He led the Object Raku team to its acquisition by Forsite Consultants in June 2019 and now heads the Remote Sensing Inventory group in Forsite. Mike holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree from the University of Alberta and earned corporate finance expertise during a ten year career in commercial banking prior to co-founding Object Raku. name: Fugro
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Fugro Booths Ground Level — 5806 Mark As Visited Company Information www.fugro.com/ About Fugro  Fugro: Driving Innovation in Power Utility Networks with Lidar and ROAMES As power utilities face increasing challenges—aging infrastructure, climate-driven risks, and the growing demand for renewable integration—accurate, actionable data has never been more critical. Fugro is leading the way with advanced geo-data solutions that transform how utilities manage transmission and distribution networks. At the core of this transformation are two powerful technologies: Lidar and Imagery. Lidar is a cornerstone of Fugro’s asset management strategy. Through high-resolution aerial and ground-based Lidar scanning, we capture and create 3D models of transmission corridors, substations, and surrounding environments. This data provides utilities with unparalleled visibility into their networks, enabling them to identify vegetation encroachment, assess structural integrity, and detect potential hazards before they escalate. Lidar’s accuracy supports optimized maintenance planning, reduces operational risk, and ensures compliance with stringent regulatory requirements—all while minimizing environmental impact. Building on this foundation, Fugro’s ROAMES (Remote Observation, Automated Modeling, and Engineering System) platform revolutionizes network management by converting Lidar and imagery data into a dynamic digital twin of the entire asset network. This virtual environment allows utilities to visualize assets in real time, simulate scenarios, and apply predictive analytics for proactive decision-making. With ROAMES, utilities can forecast asset performance, prioritize maintenance, and respond quickly to emerging threats such as storm damage or wildfire risk—without relying solely on costly field inspections. name: Fulcrum
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Fulcrum Booths Ground Level — 3049 Mark As Visited Company Information www.fulcrumapp.com About Fulcrum  Fulcrum is a field-first platform for managing how fieldwork gets done and how it gets documented. Organizations use Fulcrum to support inspections, vegetation management, preventive maintenance, equipment installations, and response work that needs to follow defined processes and produce reliable proof of completion. It gives the field a single system to run work consistently, adjust workflows as requirements change, and operate even when offline. Fulcrum brings structure to field operations by combining process management with data capture in a way that fits real fieldwork. Teams design workflows once, refine them over time, and deploy them across crews and projects without rebuilding tools. In the field, staff follow clear steps and record photos, checks, measurements, and observations as part of doing the job. In the office, teams see consisten, high-quality data that support compliance, reporting, oversight, and planning, while reducing rework and operational risk. Fulcrum also acts as the connective layer between the field and the rest of the organization. The platform integrates with GIS, enterprise systems, IoT devices, and other field technologies, including deep, two-way integration with Esri ArcGIS. AI-powered capabilities like Audio FastFill fit into those workflows by reducing repetitive input and supporting hands-free documentation during fieldwork. By bringing workflows, integrations, and AI support into one platform, Fulcrum helps field teams get work done with fewer obstacles and gives leaders a clearer view of execution. rationale: Fulcrum provides a high-leverage SaaS platform that digitizes essential field workflows for critical infrastructure, creating significant defensibility through deep GIS integration and regulatory compliance mapping. Its expansion into AI-powered data entry and offline-first capabilities positions it to scale efficiently across large, fragmented utility workforces.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: A software platform that replaces paper and clunky old apps with a digital 'brain' for utility field crews. It allows workers to use their phones or tablets to inspect power lines, manage vegetation near grids, and map out energy infrastructure in real-time, even when they are offline in remote areas.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization (The 'Electrification of Everything'). As utilities rush to upgrade aging power grids to handle EVs and renewable energy, they are desperate to digitize field operations that still rely on manual data entry and outdated software.
vc_dossier.analogy: The Salesforce for Field Operations.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Defensibility is rooted in deep integration with Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and a proprietary AI layer (FastFill) that automates data entry from field photos and voice. High switching costs exist because it becomes the core workflow for safety-critical utility inspections.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Future Grid provides software that acts like a high-definition 'Google Maps' for electricity companies. It takes data from the smart meters already installed on people's homes and turns it into a real-time dashboard that shows exactly where the power grid is struggling, where solar panels are pushing too much energy back into the system, and where wires might be about to fail.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything.' As millions of people install solar panels and EV chargers, the old power grid is becoming unstable because it wasn't designed for energy to flow in two directions. Future Grid helps utilities manage this chaos without having to dig up streets to lay new cables.
vc_dossier.analogy: A 'Check Engine Light' and real-time diagnostic tool for the entire city's power grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: The company has a 'Data Moat' built on proprietary algorithms that can process massive amounts of messy data from millions of different smart meters. Once their software is integrated into a utility's core operations, the 'switching costs' are extremely high because the utility becomes dependent on their real-time safety and reliability alerts.

name: G3-Alliance
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral G3-Alliance Booths Ground Level — 4049 Mark As Visited Company Information g3-alliance.com/ About G3-Alliance  The G3-Alliance is a not-for-profit member organization created in 2011 to standardize and promote G3 communication technology globally. The G3 technology uses radio (RF) as well as the existing powerlines (PLC) for robust and cost-effective data communication in smart metering, smart grids, smart cities and other applications. It is an open standard published by ITU and the G3-Alliance operates a successful certification program enabling seamless interoperability between devices from different manufacturers, ensuring long-term support and preventing vendor lock-in! The G3-Alliance counts nearly 100 members from over 30 countries who are international key stakeholders of the smart grid ecosystem. Members include utilities, semiconductor companies and meter manufacturers. Over 100 million products have already been deployed in more than 30 countries around the world. G3-Hybrid – Redefining connectivity for Smart Solutions: G3-Hybrid is a groundbreaking communication technology standard that seamlessly integrates wireless (RF) and wired (PLC) technologies in one, unified mesh network. G3-Hybrid sets a new standard by maximizing coverage and connectivity while minimizing the complexity and costs associated with network installation and management. Visit our booth #4049 to learn more from utility member experts! pitch_summary: GeoCam provides mobile mapping and AI-driven visual intelligence solutions for electric utilities, enabling automated asset inventory, vegetation management, and infrastructure inspection through high-resolution imagery and computer vision.

rationale: GeoCam addresses the highest OpEx line item for most utilities—vegetation management and asset inspection—using high-margin computer vision software. While hardware-enabled, the scalability of the AI-driven data processing creates significant venture upside compared to traditional manual inspection services.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: GeoCam uses airplanes equipped with specialized high-resolution cameras to fly over energy infrastructure, like oil and gas pipelines. Their software automatically analyzes the footage to find gas leaks and broken equipment that are invisible to the naked eye, replacing the need for slow and dangerous manual ground inspections.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: New environmental regulations, specifically the EPA's 2023 Methane Rule, which mandates that energy companies find and fix gas leaks much more frequently and accurately to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
vc_dossier.analogy: A medical-grade MRI for thousands of miles of energy pipelines.
vc_dossier.moat_description: A proprietary database of aerial imagery used to train specialized computer vision algorithms that can identify tiny equipment defects and gas plumes from several thousand feet in the air with high accuracy.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Seed (Last public activity noted in 2015 via Y Combinator)
vc_dossier.key_investors: Y Combinator, Data Collective (DCVC), and various angel investors.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Oil and gas exploration companies, pipeline operators (midstream), and utility companies responsible for regional gas distribution.

name: Gill Group
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Gill Group Booths Upper Level — UL339 Mark As Visited Company Information gillinstruments.com/ About Gill Group  Gill Instruments builds meteorological instrumentation for those who can’t afford guesswork. For 40 years, we’ve taken a deliberately uncompromising approach to meteorological and environmental measurement. No fragile parts. No inflated promises. No performance that only works on paper. Our ultrasonic anemometers and weather stations are engineered for operators who need accurate data they can stake decisions on - the kind of decisions that move markets, protect assets or keep operations running when conditions turn hostile. We sit at the heart of some of the world’s most demanding operations: stabilising power grids, supporting dynamic line rating, guiding renewable assets, informing aviation decisions, and powering smart-city intelligence. If you’re working in a sector where the environment dictates performance, chances are you’re already using Gill, directly or indirectly. We’re not in the business of “nice-to-have” sensors. We build the kit operators rely on when accuracy, durability and trust genuinely matter. Why Gill Instruments Meteorological sensors provide utilities real-time insight into the environmental conditions that influence grid performance and risk. They can track factors such as temperature, wind speed, humidity, solar radiation and precipitation, which directly affect the thermal capacity of transmission lines. This data can support proactive decisions allowing operators adjust line ratings, anticipate fire weather, understand how assets respond to changing conditions and protect infrastructure from environmental stress. It also helps them correlate environmental factors with asset behavior, enabling predictive maintenance, reducing downtime, improving reliability and reducing operational costs. Our anemometers and compact weather stations are built for harsh environments. With no moving parts, they are simple to install and need very little maintenance, which makes them ideal for remote or hard-to-reach sites. Our power transmission monitoring solutions for performance monitoring and asset protection. MaxiMet - Integrated, multi-parameter compact weather stations • Wide model range with different combinations of accurate sensors • Easy set-up and integration • Robust construction for land and marine applications WindSonic – High quality, general purpose, ultrasonic wind sensors • High accuracy, low cost wind measurement • Excellent reliability, low maintenance • Models and outputs to suit varied applications WindObserver - Robust ultrasonic wind sensors for challenging environments • Precision wind measurement • Robust stainless steel construction • Models for marine, aviation & hazardous areas WindMaster - High quality, general purpose 3-axis (3D) wind sensors • High accuracy 3-axis ultrasonic wind or air-flow measurement • Fast reliable output rates up to 32Hz • Land and marine based commercial and scientific applications  About Gill Group Product Categories Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Sensors IT/OT > Maintenance, Management & Monitoring Systems IT/OT > Predictive Maintenance  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Ruggedized, shoebox-sized servers that process massive amounts of data directly on-site (like at a mine or wind farm) instead of sending it to a distant data center, reducing power and cooling needs by up to 80%.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The explosion of 'Edge AI' which requires intense computing power to be physically located near sensors (in factories, ships, or energy sites) to avoid the delays and high costs of cloud computing.
vc_dossier.analogy: A 'Server-in-a-Box' for the middle of nowhere.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'EdgePod' hardware architecture that meets strict military-grade ruggedness standards while using a fraction of the power of standard server racks. Their design eliminates the need for specialized air-conditioned server rooms in harsh environments.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Accelerator / Incubator in May 2024; Grant from VIATEC BOOST in July 2024.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Plug and Play Tech Center, IP2 Launchpad, VIATEC, PacifiCan (Canadian Federal Economic Development Agency).
vc_dossier.key_customers: Target sectors include Defense (Maritime/Navy), Offshore Wind (Consortium partners for grid stabilization), and Industrial Mining.

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Greenwood Power Inc Booths Ground Level — 543 Mark As Visited Company Information www.greenwood-power.com/ About Greenwood Power Inc  Greenwood Power is a rapidly growing and cutting-edge European developer and manufacturer of specialized low voltage (LM) and medium voltage (MV) voltage and current sensors for the smart/power grid (non-conventional instrument transformers). name: Grid Solutions
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Grid Solutions Booths Ground Level — 5947 Mark As Visited Company Information gridsolutions.co.jp/en/ About Grid Solutions  Grid Solutions, Inc. is a smart grid software company specializing in VPP solutions, enabling reliable and economically efficient participation in grid and energy markets. For BESS applications, Grid Solutions provides end-to-end optimization and control, executing charge and discharge operations while strictly respecting real-world customer constraints such as contracted demand limits, state-of-charge requirements, reverse power flow restrictions, and market rules. These solutions are commercially deployed today, supporting practical Virtual Power Plant (VPP) and flexibility programs. Building on this proven foundation, Grid Solutions extends its technology to data center environments, where direct control is often neither feasible nor desirable. In this context, Grid Solutions does not replace DCIM, BMS, or IT orchestration systems. Instead, our software acts as a decision-making layer that determines whether, when, and under what conditions flexibility can be used—without compromising SLAs, future expansion, or regulatory compliance. By clearly separating execution and decision layers, Grid Solutions enables both customer-side batteries and data centers to contribute flexibility safely and predictably. As power systems become increasingly constrained, Grid Solutions provides the intelligence required to align operational execution with grid, market, and decarbonization objectives. name: GridSeer
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral GridSeer Booths Upper Level — SU-7A Mark As Visited Company Information gridseer.com/ About GridSeer  GridSeer delivers an AI-driven software and analytics platform that improves reliability, reduces risk, and cuts cost in large energy systems. The key challenge we’re addressing with GridSeer is the difficulty of integrating distributed energy resources for optimized performance. These resources range from wind, solar and batteries in grid applications, to boilers, chillers, steam generators and thermal storage for campus heating and cooling applications and even EV network design for optimized charging and discharging of vehicle batteries. While crucial for a secure energy future, these resources are variable and unpredictable, making it hard for providers and users to optimally balance supply and demand. As energy demand grows, especially as energy assets move more and more to the edge of the grid, the need for smarter energy management tools becomes critical to avoid higher risks, costs, and reduced reliability. GridSeer uses probabilistic forecasting and risk awareness to go beyond traditional energy system models. Instead of preparing for the "most likely" future scenario, our software evaluates all possibilities, enabling energy providers and users to make smarter, more cost-effective decisions for real-time energy resource deployment. GridSeer isn’t just a forecasting tool—it’s a decision-making platform. Using machine learning tools, GridSeer analyzes historical and real-time data from energy meters, energy assets and weather patterns. GridSeer predicts load and demand fluctuations and recommends adjustments to optimize the energy system while also reducing reliance on costly backup power. While it faces significant competition from established grid software incumbents, its probabilistic approach offers a distinct technical advantage for complex, real-time resource deployment.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: GridSeer provides an AI-driven software platform that acts like a sophisticated weather forecast for power grids and large energy consumers. Unlike traditional tools that guess the most likely outcome, GridSeer’s tech predicts all possible future energy scenarios and assigns a probability to each, helping operators make better decisions about when to buy, sell, or store power to reduce costs and prevent blackouts.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Electrification of Everything & Grid Volatility. As the world shifts to wind and solar (which are unpredictable) and AI data centers drive record-high power demand, the old ways of managing the grid are failing. Extreme weather and fluctuating renewable energy require smarter, risk-aware forecasting to keep the lights on.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Waze' for the Power Grid (predicting and navigating 'energy traffic' and weather risks in real-time).
vc_dossier.moat_description: GridSeer’s moat is built on proprietary 'probabilistic' algorithms developed at Duke University’s GRACE Lab with over $2.9 million in federal R&D funding (ARPA-E). Their defensibility lies in deep academic intellectual property that transitions energy forecasting from simple point-predictions to complex risk-aware simulations.

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral GridUnity Booths Ground Level — 1044 Mark As Visited Company Information gridunity.com About GridUnity  GridUnity is the industry leader in interconnection life cycle management, delivering cutting-edge software solutions that eliminate bottlenecks in the interconnection process and accelerate the transition to a more affordable, sustainable, and resilient energy future. We unite all grid interconnection stakeholders on a single platform that converts centralized data into actionable intelligence and accelerates the transition to a reliable, sustainable, and cost-efficient electric grid. ‍ GridUnity is a trusted partner to leading utilities, grid operators, and policymakers. Our technology solutions tackle the interconnection queue backlog by significantly reducing processing times. Whether cutting transmission interconnection timelines from years to months or enabling distribution applications to be processed within a day, we help accelerate energy projects at every scale. GridUnity is backed by a five-year R&D investment strategy focused on AI, automation, and predictive analytics; a $50 million matching DOE funding and GRIP award recognition for our leadership in grid modernization and I; and adoption by leading ISOs, RTOs, utilities, and transmission owners. GridUnity has been recognized as a leading innovator in grid technologies: U.S. Department of Energy Awardee Power & Utilities Tech Pioneer 2024 (Darcy Partners)  About GridUnity Product Categories Grid Edge and Behind-the-Meter Technologies > DER Interconnection IT/OT > Enterprise Software/Platform Systems Transmission > Resource Interconnection Collateral  BROCHURE  GridUnity Intelligence Lab Brief Contact Us  Ashley Kelly  VP, Sales  Ed Sutton  Director Distribution Growth & AI Innovation  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: GridUnity provides an interconnection life cycle management platform that automates and streamlines the complex process of connecting energy projects to the power grid. By utilizing AI and predictive analytics, the platform helps utilities, ISOs, and RTOs eliminate interconnection queue backlogs and significantly reduce project processing timelines.
customer_type: ISOs, RTOs, Utilities, and Transmission Owners
investment_thesis_one_liner: GridUnity is the mission-critical software layer addressing the primary bottleneck in the energy transition: the massive interconnection queue backlog.
rationale: GridUnity solves the single largest bottleneck in the energy transition—interconnection backlogs—via a high-leverage SaaS platform. While utility sales cycles are notoriously long, the company has secured critical regulatory tailwinds and DOE backing, positioning it as a defensible infrastructure layer.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: GridUnity provides a cloud-based software platform that automates the slow, manual process of connecting new power sources—like solar farms, wind parks, and EV charging stations—to the existing electric grid. It acts as a digital coordination layer between energy developers and utility companies to clear the massive 'waiting line' for new energy projects.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Interconnection Backlog.' Thousands of clean energy projects are currently stuck in multi-year administrative queues because utilities use outdated manual systems to review their impact on the grid. GridUnity's automation is critical to meeting federal and state decarbonization deadlines.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'TurboTax' for power grid connections.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Network effects and high switching costs: The platform is already integrated into the operations of utilities and grid operators serving over 50% of the U.S. population (including CAISO and MISO). Once a utility standardizes its engineering reviews on GridUnity's software, replacing it requires a massive regulatory and technical overhaul.
vc_dossier.total_raised: Undisclosed (Private VC) plus $49.5M in Federal Grants
vc_dossier.latest_round: U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) GRIP Grant of $49.5M in October 2024 (as part of a $99M project cost-share).
vc_dossier.key_investors: U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), Office of Scientific and Technical Information (OSTI). Private venture investors are undisclosed.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Southern Company, Entergy, Southern California Edison (SCE), Midcontinent Independent System Operator (MISO), and Southwest Power Pool (SPP).

pitch_summary: Based in San Diego, GridWrap provides high-quality grid-enhancing solutions for utility and grid infrastructure, focusing on improving the reliability, resilience, and capacity of the distribution network to support clean energy goals.
investment_thesis_one_liner: GridWrap provides essential grid-enhancing solutions to harden distribution infrastructure and increase capacity, addressing critical bottlenecks in the global transition to clean electricity.
rationale: GridWrap provides critical physical infrastructure hardening for distribution networks, positioning it as a high-moat player in utility resilience. While the high deployment friction and CapEx-heavy sales cycle are typical for hardware, the massive global demand for grid-enhancing technologies (GETs) offers significant venture-scale upside if their IP is proprietary.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: GridWrap makes industrial-strength 'bandages' using aerospace materials to reinforce old or damaged wooden power poles and electrical wires. This allows power companies to fix aging infrastructure in minutes for a fraction of the cost of replacing them, while also making the grid more resistant to wildfires and storms.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Climate Resilience and Grid Hardening. With aging infrastructure causing massive wildfires (like the Smokehouse Creek Fire) and extreme weather increasing, utilities are desperate for fast, low-cost ways to strengthen the grid without the multi-billion dollar price tag of burying lines underground.
vc_dossier.analogy: Duct tape for power grids, but made with rocket-ship materials.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary, patented composite materials (BULLWRAP and DEMIRWRAP) that are lightweight but strong enough to double the weight-bearing capacity of poles. Their tech is validated by major research bodies like the Department of Energy and independent labs like San Diego State University.
vc_dossier.key_investors: U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), CalSEED, EnergyLab, Launch Alaska, Rice Alliance.
vc_dossier.key_customers: PG&E (Innovation Summit partner), Elia Group (Belgium pilot), EPRI (Electric Power Research Institute).

name: HAMPTON TEDDER ELECTRIC
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral HAMPTON TEDDER ELECTRIC Booths Upper Level — UL813 Mark As Visited Company Information www.hamptontedder.com/ About HAMPTON TEDDER ELECTRIC  Founded in 1958, Hampton Tedder Electric is a family owned and operated electrical contractor specializing in high voltage systems. For more than sixty years, we have provided comprehensive design, construction, maintenance, and testing services for overhead and underground. Our reputation has been built on safety, reliability, and technical excellence, making HTE a trusted partner to utilities, municipalities, and private system owners. Headquartered in Montclair, California, Hampton Tedder Electric has operated from the same facility for over sixty three years. Our nine acre headquarters is fully equipped with the tools, equipment, and materials required to construct complete high voltage systems. To better serve our clients, we now operate three offices and nine construction yards throughout California, Nevada, and Arizona, allowing us to respond quickly to projects and emergencies across the United States. Hampton Tedder Electric has successfully completed more than one billion dollars in high voltage projects. Our experience includes work for schools, hospitals, universities, utilities, municipalities, renewable energy facilities, and industrial clients. We maintain an exceptional safety record with an Experience Modification Rate of 0.58 and perform more than six thousand field safety inspections each year. Our mission is to be the safest high voltage contractor in the United States, and safety, compliance, and efficiency are the foundation of every project we perform. Our workforce is comprised of master journeymen, high voltage designers, linemen, cable splicers, civil operators, and test technicians. Each employee is provided with modern technology, tools, and equipment to safely design, build, maintain, and restore high voltage systems. Hampton Tedder Electric has logged more than ten million man hours on high voltage projects with very few incidents, reflecting our strong culture of continuous improvement and accountability. HTE’s managers and supervisors collectively bring more than five hundred years of high voltage field experience. Every IBEW certified supervisor and foreman is carefully selected to lead crews with professionalism, technical expertise, and a strong commitment to safety. Our teams are qualified to work on systems up to five hundred kilovolts and are certified to perform work for city, county, state, federal, and private agencies. Hampton Tedder Electric provides twenty four hour emergency response. We maintain more than five hundred pieces of heavy duty equipment and a ten million dollar inventory of high voltage materials ready for immediate installation, including power cable, transformers, switchgear, poles, hardware, conduit, and duct bank supplies. As a WBENC certified woman owned business, HTE proudly supports supplier diversity goals while delivering dependable high voltage solutions nationwide. Our approach combines proven methods with forward thinking innovation, ensuring every project meets evolving industry standards. We invest heavily in training, safety programs, and equipment modernization to continuously improve performance. Clients rely on Hampton Tedder Electric for responsive communication, disciplined project management, and consistent execution. Whether supporting routine maintenance, major infrastructure upgrades, or critical emergency restoration, our teams deliver dependable results while protecting people, assets, and communities through careful planning and disciplined field operations across diverse operating environments nationwide. vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: HData provides a software platform that acts like a specialized search engine and automated assistant for the energy industry's legal and financial paperwork. It uses AI to quickly read through thousands of pages of government energy filings, helping utilities and regulators find facts, compare costs, and submit mandatory reports in hours rather than months.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Energy Transition Bottleneck. To hit climate goals, the U.S. needs to build massive amounts of new power lines and solar farms, but every project requires slow, manual approval from government regulators. HData's AI speeds up this 'regulatory red tape' to keep pace with the urgent demand for grid expansion and AI-driven power needs.
vc_dossier.analogy: The Bloomberg Terminal for Energy Regulation.
vc_dossier.moat_description: HData owns the industry's largest digital library of structured and unstructured energy regulatory data, dating back decades. This proprietary data serves as the 'training fuel' for their specialized AI, making it difficult for general AI companies to provide the same level of accuracy and citation for legal energy proceedings.

pitch_summary: HomeBoost is an AI-powered platform that digitizes and streamlines home energy assessments for homeowners, BPI-certified professionals, and utility providers, using automated reporting and imaging to increase program throughput and residential energy efficiency.

investment_thesis_one_liner: HomeBoost addresses the residential energy efficiency bottleneck by replacing manual audit workflows with an AI-driven digital platform that enhances data consistency for utilities and lowers customer acquisition costs for contractors.
rationale: HomeBoost leverages AI to digitize a traditionally labor-intensive manual bottleneck in the energy efficiency value chain, offering high scalability via a platform model that connects homeowners, pros, and utilities. However, success depends on maintaining high data quality across diverse residential environments and navigating fragmented utility incentive programs.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: HomeBoost provides a DIY kit called 'BoostBox' that lets homeowners perform their own professional-grade energy audit. You get a thermal camera to plug into your phone, follow an app's instructions to find air leaks and insulation gaps, and then receive a custom report on how to lower your bills and claim government rebates.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and record-high utility costs, coupled with new massive government rebates for home efficiency (Inflation Reduction Act).
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'DoorDash' for home energy audits—ordering a box of tools to your door instead of waiting for a contractor to show up.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary AI and computer vision software that translates raw thermal images captured by untrained homeowners into BPI-certified (Building Performance Institute) professional reports.
vc_dossier.key_investors: True Ventures, Gigascale Capital, Incite.org, Moxxie Ventures, Dominion Energy Innovation Center, Bronze.

vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Climate Resilience' and 'Infrastructure Security' driver; as natural disasters increase and global conflicts rise, the need for 'always-on' monitoring of energy grids, ports, and borders has become a national security priority.
