With two decades of industry expertise, IKE has become the standard for eight of the 10 largest investor-owned electric utilities in North America and five of the 10 largest communications companies in the United States. Designed and delivered with industry expertise, IKE solutions have wide-ranging use cases including pole inspections, field data collection, pole loading analysis, make-ready engineering, network-level assessments, and permitting. The result: Overhead asset management that is efficient, reliable and, above all, safe. pitch_summary: Intelfuse provides specialized data management and analytics platforms focused on vegetation management and wildfire mitigation for both distribution and transmission utility sectors.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Intelfuse addresses a critical utility pain point by modernizing wildfire risk management and grid reliability through automated vegetation analytics.
rationale: Intelfuse leverages a highly scalable software-as-a-service model to address the critical and non-discretionary wildfire mitigation budgets of regulated utilities. While long sales cycles and data ingestion complexities remain hurdles, the shift from manual inspection to automated analytics offers significant venture-scale upside in the utility sector.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Intelfuse uses laser-scanning technology (LiDAR) to create a high-precision 3D digital map of power lines and the surrounding trees. Their software identifies specific tree species and growth patterns to tell utility companies exactly which branches are most likely to cause a wildfire or power outage, turning massive amounts of raw data into prioritized 'to-do' lists for trimming crews.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Wildfire Liability and Climate Resilience. Utilities are facing billions in legal liabilities from fires sparked by power lines; Intelfuse allows them to move from 'cutting everything' to 'precision trimming' as weather events become more extreme.
vc_dossier.analogy: An 'MRI' for the Power Grid's safety.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary AI algorithms capable of 99% measurement repeatability and automated 'species-level' identification. This allows the software to predict different growth rates for different trees, which is much harder to replicate than simple distance measurements. They also feature deep integration into utility 'Work Management Systems,' creating high switching costs.
vc_dossier.key_investors: NextEra Energy, Florida Power & Light (FPL) via the 35 Mules Innovation Hub.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Florida Power & Light (FPL), PG&E, American Electric Power (AEP), Duke Energy, EvoEnergy (Australia), and ElectraNet.

name: IONATE
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral IONATE Booths Ground Level — 4834 Mark As Visited Company Information www.ionate.energy/ About IONATE  IONATE is building the hardware-software backbone for smart grids. The hardware, the Hybrid Intelligent Transformer (HIT) innovates upon fundamental electrical building blocks, transformers, turning them into all-in-one smart devices. Coupled with IONATE’s AI-enabled software, this technology transforms rigid, old power systems into smart, flexible, inherently efficient platforms. The hardware The Hybrid Intelligent Transformer (HIT) does what solid-state transformers promised: it detects, analyses and resolves power disturbances in real time. It controls voltage with sub-millisecond precision, suppresses both voltage and current harmonics and achieves full four-quadrant reactive power control. The HIT does this all in one device that maintains >99% efficiency, the footprint and reliability of a transformer. This boost operational safety and efficiency in grids, power generation, and data centers alike. The software By managing and cleaning power inside the transformer itself, each HIT lights up a real-time control node in systems that used to be passive and dark. Coordinated by IONATE’s Aurora, their network will unlock a step change in efficiency, renewables hosting capacity, and achieve true smart grid capabilities with AI-enabled control. A grid with IONATE’s technology and no other changes can have 33% more Distributed Energy Resources (DERs) safely 25% more power through the existing poles and wires, deferring capital upgrades 6% lower losses. This year, IONATE’s technology will be deployed in Portugal and Spain with energy giant EDP, followed by a solar installation in Austria with Wiener Netze, as well as data center and C&I projects in the US.  About IONATE Product Categories Distribution > SCADA & Control Systems Distribution > Substation Automation Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Transformers Collateral  BROCHURE  IONATE Brochure Contact Us  Luca Mezossy-Dona  Co-Founder & CGO  Luca is an Oxford-trained neuroscientist with an MBA and a career in energy tech startups. pitch_summary: IONATE develops the Hybrid Intelligent Transformer (HIT) and the Aurora software platform to modernize power grids. Their hardware replaces traditional passive transformers with smart devices capable of sub-millisecond voltage control and harmonic suppression, while their AI-enabled software coordinates these devices to increase renewable energy hosting capacity and grid efficiency.
customer_type: Utilities, Data Centers, Solar Developers, and C&I Enterprises
investment_thesis_one_liner: IONATE modernizes grid infrastructure by turning standard transformers into intelligent nodes, enabling significantly higher DER penetration and deferred capital upgrades for utilities.
rationale: IONATE presents a high-leverage opportunity by digitizing the core physical components of the grid, enabling significant capacity increases without massive civil works. While the 'rip-and-replace' hardware model introduces high deployment friction and capital requirements, the embedded AI software creates a defensible network effect as more nodes are deployed.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: IONATE makes 'smart' versions of the heavy metal boxes (transformers) found on power poles and in substations. While traditional boxes just sit there passively changing voltage, IONATE's version uses internal sensors and digital controls to automatically balance electricity flow in real-time. This prevents power surges, reduces waste, and allows the grid to handle more solar panels and electric vehicle chargers without needing expensive new wiring.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Strain from AI and Electrification. The global power grid is reaching its breaking point due to massive electricity demand from new AI data centers and the 'electrification of everything' (EVs, heat pumps), making smart hardware that squeezes more capacity out of existing wires essential.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Intel Inside' for the power grid's hardware.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary Hardware-Software Integration. Their 'Hybrid Intelligent Transformer' (HIT) is a patented physical device that uses advanced magnetics to control power flow directly at the hardware level. This is significantly harder to replicate than pure software, as it provides a 'drop-in' physical replacement for 100-year-old infrastructure while gathering high-fidelity data that software-only competitors cannot access.
vc_dossier.key_investors: AlbionVC, In-Q-Tel (IQT), IQ Capital, JGC MIRAI Innovation Fund, Santander InnoEnergy Climate Fund, Antares Ventures, Zero Carbon Capital, Cycle Group
vc_dossier.key_customers: EDP (major utility in Spain/Portugal/Brazil), National Grid Electricity Distribution (UK utility), and NATO (through the DIANA Accelerator program).

pitch_summary: Joulea offers an energy assessment platform for commercial buildings that integrates autonomous drone inspections with AI-powered diagnostics to identify energy waste and optimize building performance.

investment_thesis_one_liner: Solving the scalability bottleneck of commercial energy audits by replacing manual inspections with autonomous hardware and AI-driven thermal analysis.
rationale: Joulea transforms a labor-intensive manual audit industry into a high-leverage SaaS and robotics platform with significant scalability across commercial real estate. While drone regulatory hurdles and local competition exist, their AI-integrated approach offers a high-margin data play for energy decarbonization.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Joulea is an energy assessment platform that uses autonomous drones to find energy leaks in large commercial buildings. By applying aerospace engineering principles (the same used to design rockets), it creates a 'digital twin' of a building to identify where air and heat are escaping, allowing owners to lower costs and carbon emissions without manual inspections.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Real Estate Decarbonization: With buildings accounting for 40% of global carbon emissions, commercial owners are under intense regulatory and investor pressure to reach 'Net Zero' and meet ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) targets.
vc_dossier.analogy: An MRI for building energy loss.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary autonomous drone technology and aerospace-grade 'Digital Twin' modeling. Unlike traditional manual auditors who use handheld cameras, Joulea's drones use LiDAR and thermal sensors to map the entire building envelope simultaneously, providing a level of data accuracy and speed that is difficult for competitors to replicate.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Accelerator/Incubator ($100K) in February 2025; previously received a $1.5M Grant from the U.S. Department of Energy in 2023.
vc_dossier.key_investors: U.S. Department of Energy (DOE), Cox Cleantech, Techstars (via Cox Cleantech Accelerator), and the Advanced Technology Development Center (ATDC).
vc_dossier.key_customers: Institutional real estate owners and National Asset Managers; successfully completed a pilot with 10 ENERGY STAR-certified buildings in Atlanta.

name: Juniper Systems
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Juniper Systems Booths Upper Level — UL819 Mark As Visited Company Information www.junipersys.com About Juniper Systems  Juniper Systems Inc. is a leading manufacturer of ultra-rugged field computing solutions, GNSS receivers, and mapping software designed for professionals working in demanding environments. Headquartered in Logan, Utah, Juniper Systems serves a global customer base across utility, environmental, geospatial, and infrastructure sectors—delivering reliable tools that empower accurate data collection, asset mapping, and field operations. For the utility industries represented at DISTRIBUTECH—including electric, water, and gas—Juniper Systems offers a complete ecosystem of hardware and software that simplifies and enhances field data workflows. Whether mapping underground infrastructure, inspecting utility assets, or conducting field audits, Juniper’s solutions are built to withstand the harshest conditions while delivering professional-grade accuracy. At the core of Juniper’s offering is the Geode GNSS Receiver, a compact, affordable, and scalable device that provides sub-meter to centimeter-level accuracy. Compatible with SBAS, RTK, and Atlas correction services, the Geode enables precise location data for mapping utility lines, valves, hydrants, meters, and other critical infrastructure. Its open interface allows seamless integration with Juniper’s rugged handhelds and tablets, as well as third-party devices running Windows, Android, or iOS. Juniper’s Mesa Rugged Tablets and Archer Handheld are engineered for field professionals who require durability, long battery life, and ergonomic design. These devices are IP68-rated, MIL-STD-810H tested, and feature sunlight-readable displays, hot-swappable batteries, and optional GNSS expansion pods for enhanced accuracy. Whether deployed in remote substations, urban environments, or hazardous locations, Juniper’s hardware ensures uninterrupted performance and data integrity. Complementing the hardware is Uinta Mapping and Data Collection Software, a user-friendly platform that enables field crews to create detailed maps, capture custom asset data, and generate sharable reports. Uinta supports form-based data entry, aerial imagery overlays, and real-time syncing, making it ideal for utility inspections, maintenance documentation, and infrastructure planning. Juniper Systems’ total solution—rugged hardware, high-accuracy GNSS, and intuitive software—is trusted by utilities of all sizes to improve operational efficiency, reduce downtime, and enhance safety. From mapping underground gas lines to inspecting electrical grids and documenting water infrastructure, Juniper empowers field teams to work smarter and faster. With a commitment to quality, customer support, and continuous innovation, Juniper Systems is a reliable partner for utilities embracing digital transformation and smart infrastructure. As the energy and utility landscape evolves, Juniper remains focused on delivering tools that help organizations modernize their field operations and make data-driven decisions. Kasco’s core strength lies in its ability to design, industrialize, and scale AI systems from data acquisition to deployment in real-world environments. This includes proprietary software frameworks, edge and cloud computing architectures, and custom hardware integration. A key asset is Kasco A.I. (KAI), the company’s proprietary AI framework that integrates dataset management, custom deep-learning algorithms, continuous model improvement pipelines, and APIs for enterprise integration. This platform enables faster development cycles, reduced human effort, and consistent performance gains across products. The company’s flagship products are mature, market-validated solutions (TRL 9): MVI (Multi Vision Inspection): an autonomous system for inspecting power distribution and transmission assets using ground vehicles and drones with RGB and thermographic cameras, reducing inspection costs by up to 85% and significantly increasing coverage and speed. CCV (Cargill Cattle View): an AI-based livestock monitoring platform using drone imagery to analyze herd behavior, feeding patterns, and productivity, improving protein gain and operational decision-making in confined cattle operations. KSIM (Kasco Smart Inspection for Manufacturing): an industrial quality-inspection system capable of analyzing up to 500 SKUs per minute using unsupervised learning and golden-sample matching. ZERO (Zero Accident): a real-time work-safety solution using 3D vision and edge AI to detect unsafe behaviors, missing PPE, and risk situations, issuing immediate alerts to prevent accidents. Kasco has a strong track record in R&D, with projects funded by programs such as ANEEL P&D, FINEP, FAPESP, and RNP, and maintains active partnerships with large enterprises including energy utilities, global agribusiness players, and consumer-goods manufacturers. The company is a member of the NVIDIA Inception program and has been recognized multiple times in national innovation rankings. Driven by its mission to create innovative technologies that solve global challenges, Kasco continues to expand internationally while delivering scalable, reliable, and sustainable AI solutions that transform critical operations across industries.  About KASCO AI Product Categories Finance/Investment > T&D Asset Analytics Transmission > Drones/Helicopters/Inspection Transmission > Safety Equipment and Systems Collateral  WHITE PAPER  KASCO SOLUTIONS PRESENTATION Contact Us  Diogo Caetano  Director of AI Solutions for Utilities  Diogo Gará Caetano is a Brazilian electrical engineer, entrepreneur, and deep-tech innovator with more than 15 years of experience in research, development, and industrial deployment of advanced technology solutions. He holds a B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, as well as an M.Sc., Ph.D., and Post-Doctorate in Electrical Engineering from the University of Campinas (UNICAMP), one of Latin America’s leading engineering institutions.  Diogo is the co-founder and Director of Innovation at KASCO, a deep-tech spin-off from UNICAMP focused on Artificial Intelligence, computer vision, and embedded systems for utilities, agribusiness, and industrial applications. He has led the conception and execution of multiple TRL-9 products, including autonomous inspection systems for power grids, AI-based safety solutions for field operations, and high-performance visual inspection platforms for industrial production lines.  Throughout his career, Diogo has coordinated and executed large-scale R&D projects, and has collaborated with major companies including electric utilities, global agribusiness firms, and consumer-goods manufacturers. He is an inventor on several patent filings and has authored scientific publications in areas such as thermography, computer vision, and intelligent inspection systems. His work bridges academic research and real-world deployment, with a strong focus on scalability, reliability, and measurable operational impact. name: Kevala, Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Kevala, Inc. Booths Ground Level — 6209 Mark As Visited Company Information www.kevala.com About Kevala, Inc.  The Kevala platform combines the largest, most valuable, and comprehensive energy data repository with differentiated analytics capabilities to solve the world’s most complex energy challenges, accelerating the transition to a clean energy future. Our cutting-edge solutions support utilities, regulators, developers, and investors in making data-driven decisions that optimize grid reliability, resilience, and long-term costs. Our Core Solutions Electrification Impact Studies - Analyze how widespread electrification affect the distribution and transmission grid. We provide essential insights to utilities, regulators, and stakeholders, enabling them to proactively plan for infrastructure upgrades, maintain reliability, and accurately forecast cost impacts, thereby ensuring a smooth, sustainable transition to widespread electrification. Our models quantify the spatial and temporal impacts of projected adoption scenarios, giving a clear roadmap for necessary investments. Integrated Grid Planning (IGP) - Built specifically for the new paradigm of distribution grid planning, Kevala’s IGP suite addresses the complex and intertwined challenges of the evolving energy landscape. This includes managing the increasing penetration of DERs like rooftop solar and battery storage, supporting the electrification of transportation and building loads, and meeting the non-negotiable need for enhanced grid reliability and resilience against extreme weather events and other disruptions. Our platform facilitates least-cost planning by evaluating traditional infrastructure investments alongside non-wires alternatives (NWAs). Production Cost Modeling (PCM) - Utilities require robust, data-driven decision-making tools to plan effectively for future demand fluctuations, major infrastructure investments, and evolving energy policy changes. Our PCM offering empowers utilities to conduct highly accurate simulations and analyses, leading to informed planning decisions that optimize long-term operational costs, ensure grid stability, and meet regulatory requirements. This capability is crucial for resource adequacy and long-term financial health. Predictive Interconnection Siting Metrics (PrISM) - Slow and complex interconnection processes are a significant barrier to the rapid deployment of clean energy and electrification projects. Our PrISM offering dramatically improves this process by providing developers and utilities with high-resolution, predictive metrics on potential grid impacts and likely costs and timelines. This allows both parties to make informed siting choices upfront, significantly reducing soft costs, accelerating project development, and streamlining the overall interconnection queue process, unlocking clean energy capacity. Project Siting - Streamline and optimize the development and financing of new solar, storage, and large load projects. By providing comprehensive, location-specific insights into transmission, sub-transmission, and distribution network capacity, constraints, and upgrade costs, our Project Siting offering enables developers and investors to efficiently evaluate potential sites. This reduces financial risk, accelerates project timelines from months to weeks, and ensures that capital is deployed where it can have the greatest impact on decarbonization and grid needs. Kevala empowers organizations to navigate the complexities of the modern energy transition, make informed decisions, optimize investments, and accelerate the essential shift to a clean energy future. For more information on how we transform data into actionable intelligence, visit us online at www.kevala.com and meet our experts in person at Booth 6209.  About Kevala, Inc. vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' is creating a massive bottleneck for the power grid. As millions of EVs and heat pumps come online, the existing infrastructure is being pushed to its limit, requiring precise mapping and predictive analytics to manage the transition without failure.
vc_dossier.analogy: Google Maps for the Power Grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary Data & Regulatory Integration: Kevala builds defensibility by ingesting and standardizing fragmented utility data that is difficult to access, combined with a 'first-mover' position in providing the analytics used by state regulators (like the CPUC) to set policy.

name: La Marche
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral La Marche Booths Ground Level — 842 Mark As Visited Company Information www.lamarchemfg.com About La Marche  La Marche Manufacturing is a U.S.-based, vertically integrated leader in dependable AC and DC power solutions, serving the utility, energy distribution, industrial, and power generation markets for over 80 years. With a long-standing reputation for engineering excellence, La Marche designs and manufactures high-quality battery chargers, power supplies, rectifiers, engine start systems, and fully customized charging solutions that meet the demanding requirements of mission-critical operations worldwide. Our products are specifically engineered to support utilities and energy distributors in maintaining reliable and efficient electrical infrastructure. From grid-scale power generation to industrial applications, La Marche solutions are trusted to deliver consistent performance, minimize downtime, and optimize operational efficiency. By combining decades of experience with a deep understanding of industry needs, we provide innovative, durable, and cost-effective solutions that help our customers succeed in a rapidly evolving energy landscape. As a vertically integrated manufacturer, La Marche retains full control over the design, engineering, and production of every component. This approach allows us to maintain the highest quality standards, respond quickly to custom requirements, and implement innovative features that enhance safety, efficiency, and reliability. Our commitment to in-house manufacturing ensures that every product leaving our facility meets rigorous performance standards and is built to last, even in the most demanding environments. La Marche’s portfolio includes specialized solutions for battery charging, power rectification, engine starting, and complex custom systems. Our products are widely used by utilities, independent power producers, oil and gas operators, energy distributors, data centers, and industrial facilities that require dependable, mission-critical power. Designed for environments where operational continuity is non-negotiable, our solutions support critical infrastructure, ensuring reliable energy delivery, backup power, and seamless system performance. By focusing on reliability, innovation, and engineering excellence, La Marche has become a trusted partner for companies across multiple sectors that cannot compromise on power performance or operational uptime. At DistribuTECH, La Marche Manufacturing showcases our dedication to supporting the energy distribution and utility sectors. Our solutions are designed to address the challenges of modern power networks, including integrating renewable energy sources, supporting distributed generation, and ensuring robust backup and engine start capabilities. Visitors to our booth will see how our engineering expertise, extensive product portfolio, and customer-focused approach make La Marche a leading choice for critical power infrastructure. pitch_summary: Linebird develops specialized robotic payload systems for commercial drones that enable physical contact with live transmission and distribution power lines for maintenance and testing.
customer_type: Electric Utilities and Drone Service Providers
investment_thesis_one_liner: Linebird reduces risk and increases grid reliability by automating hazardous live-line maintenance tasks through drone-integrated robotics.
rationale: Linebird offers a high-leverage hardware solution that replaces dangerous, manual utility labor with specialized robotic drone payloads, creating a significant safety and efficiency value proposition. While it faces long utility sales cycles and complex FAA regulations, its unique IP in live-line physical contact provides a defensible moat in the grid hardening market.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Linebird builds specialized robotic equipment that attaches to industrial drones, allowing them to physically touch and test live power lines. Traditionally, checking these lines for damage required humans to climb poles or use massive trucks; Linebird's tech lets drones do this work safely while the electricity is still flowing.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The aging global power grid is increasingly prone to failure, yet there is a massive shortage of skilled 'linemen' to perform high-risk manual inspections.
vc_dossier.analogy: A robotic stethoscope for the power grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented hardware (Osprey NPS) specifically engineered to manage massive electromagnetic interference and safely land sensors on high-voltage transmission lines.

pitch_summary: LineVision is a grid-enhancing technology company that provides a grid intelligence platform for electric utilities. By utilizing advanced sensors and analytics, they deliver dynamic line ratings (DLR) and network-wide monitoring to improve the capacity, reliability, and safety of transmission and distribution assets.
investment_thesis_one_liner: LineVision enables utilities to unlock significant latent capacity on existing power lines, providing a scalable and cost-effective alternative to physical transmission builds in the face of rising electrification demand.
rationale: LineVision offers a high-leverage solution to grid congestion by using proprietary sensor data to unlock latent capacity in existing transmission assets. While hardware-reliant, the scalable analytics platform and strong regulatory tailwinds for Dynamic Line Ratings (DLR) provide significant venture-scale upside.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: LineVision provides hardware sensors that monitor high-voltage power lines from a distance to determine their real-time health and capacity. Their software calculates exactly how much electricity can safely flow through existing wires based on current weather conditions (like wind and temperature), often revealing 40% more available space than utilities previously realized. This allows power companies to connect more renewable energy and data centers to the grid immediately without the 10-year delay and massive expense of building new physical towers.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Grid Bottleneck'—The transition to renewable energy and the surge in AI data center power demand are overwhelming the aging electric grid. Building new transmission lines is slow and expensive, forcing utilities to adopt 'Grid Enhancing Technologies' (GETs) to unlock capacity in the infrastructure they already own.
vc_dossier.analogy: Waze for the Power Grid—it provides real-time 'traffic' and 'road condition' data for electricity, showing utilities where they have open capacity to move more power instead of relying on a static, outdated map.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'non-contact' sensor technology that can be installed on towers in weeks without turning off the power (a significant advantage over competitors who require 'live-wire' work). The company holds 20+ patents and a massive proprietary dataset of power line behavior across diverse climates, which fuels their highly accurate predictive models.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Climate Innovation Capital, S2G Ventures, Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund, Marubeni, National Grid Partners, Clean Energy Ventures, UP Partners, Zoma Capital
vc_dossier.key_customers: National Grid, AES Corporation, Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA), Xcel Energy, and Duquesne Light

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Locusview Solutions Booths Ground Level — 1539 Mark As Visited Company Information www.locusview.com/ About Locusview Solutions  Locusview is now part of Itron, bringing even greater scale and innovation to Digital Construction Management for utilities. Built by and for the energy industry, our field-first platform connects all construction stakeholders—from the field to the office—enabling real-time visibility and seamless collaboration throughout the job lifecycle. From pre-construction planning through post-construction closeout, Locusview digitizes entire workflows—including high-accuracy digital as-builts, complete material traceability, quality inspections, OQ verification, and contractor invoicing—replacing paper, consolidating disconnected tools, and automating integration with all systems of record. Trusted by 25+ utilities and 180+ contractors, with 6,300+ active users managing $17B+ in supported construction projects, Locusview delivers measurable results: 90% less time entering data into systems of record, 70% reduction in project cycle time, 50% reduction in overcharges and surveying costs, and 90% reduction in work order rejection rates. As a complete turnkey solution with integrated hardware, software, and managed services, we eliminate the complexity of managing multiple vendors while maintaining the configurability and low TCO that utilities demand. Our philosophy—decouple user experience from underlying technology, productize industry best practices, and maintain a field crew-focused, workflow-driven approach—ensures COTS software that works out-of-the-box while meeting individual utility needs through integrations easily supportable by operations or IT teams. pitch_summary: LōD builds energy-intelligent software that transforms datacenters into flexible assets for the power grid by integrating real-time grid conditions, energy prices, and carbon signals with device-level control and workload orchestration.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Unlocking latent grid flexibility within datacenters through intelligent software orchestration to optimize energy costs and carbon performance.
rationale: LōD addresses the urgent need for datacenter load flexibility by bridging the gap between facility hardware and volatile energy markets. The platform's ability to orchestrate compute workloads alongside power consumption creates a high-leverage software moat in a rapidly expanding sector.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: LōD provides a software platform that acts as a 'smart controller' for energy-heavy buildings like data centers. It automatically shifts how and when these facilities use electricity based on real-time price changes or stress on the power grid, helping operators save money and preventing local blackouts.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'AI Power Crunch' and grid capacity limits; as AI data centers consume massive amounts of energy, utilities are increasingly requiring them to be 'flexible'—meaning they must be able to turn down their power usage instantly when the grid is overloaded.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Nest Smart Thermostat' for industrial-scale data centers.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'Workload Routing' technology that can move digital tasks to different physical locations based on energy prices, alongside specialized algorithms (e.g., Coincidental Peak Algorithm) that predict and avoid expensive grid spikes.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Accelerator (Google for Startups: AI for Energy) in September 2025
vc_dossier.key_investors: Google for Startups, Plug and Play Tech Center, VentureLabs (SFU)

name: Magment Americas
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Magment Americas Booths Upper Level — SU-10A Mark As Visited Company Information www.magment.co/ About Magment Americas  Magment was founded to help accelerate the energy transition by solving one of the most urgent bottlenecks in electrical infrastructure: the growing shortage of transformers and the long lead times that are now constraining grid expansion in the U.S., especially as AI data centers drive unprecedented demand for reliable, high-density power. To address this, Magment powers the energy transition with magnetizable construction materials and delivers MagPower-3H™, a solid-state transformer platform built around the precast 3H™ component. MagPower-3H™ achieves high power, high voltage, and high frequency simultaneously, surpassing the traditional 200 kVA industry limit, and enabling megawatt-scale architectures that legacy designs have struggled to reach. It provides digitally controlled voltage, frequency, and power-quality management in a compact, fire-safe, efficient, oil-free system that is scalable for modern U.S. grids and data-center-grade reliability. It is also a safer, more sustainable alternative to legacy transformers. customer_type: Utilities, Data Center Operators, and Microgrid Developers
investment_thesis_one_liner: Magment is disrupting the legacy transformer market with solid-state technology and advanced materials to resolve critical supply chain constraints for AI data centers and grid expansion.

While capital intensive, their ability to bypass 2-year lead times for AI data centers provides an asymmetric market entry compared to legacy incumbents.

vc_dossier.hq_location: Munich, Germany (U.S. Operations in West Lafayette, IN)
vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: A materials science company that manufactures 'magnetic concrete' used to build roads that charge electric vehicles wirelessly as they drive. This technology turns the road itself into a giant charging pad, similar to how a smartphone charges wirelessly, specifically targeting heavy trucks and buses that cannot afford long charging stops.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The electrification of heavy-duty logistics and long-haul trucking, which currently suffers from 'range anxiety' and the massive weight/cost of batteries required for long distances.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Qi wireless charging pad' for highways and warehouse floors.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary patents on 'Magment' material—a specialized concrete composite made from cement and recycled magnetic particles (ferrite) that is significantly more durable and cheaper than traditional copper-coil-based wireless charging systems.

pitch_summary: Founded by experts from NASA and OpenAI, Matter Intelligence develops proprietary remote sensors capable of material analysis at the molecular level. These sensors are combined with an AI-driven predictive model to monitor and forecast changes in physical assets and vegetation, specifically targeting wildfire mitigation and infrastructure integrity.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A deep-tech approach to utility vegetation management that combines NASA-grade hardware with predictive AI to revolutionize wildfire risk assessment and asset monitoring.
rationale: Matter Intelligence combines elite aerospace hardware expertise with generative AI capabilities to create a high-moat data layer for the world's most critical infrastructure. While the integration of proprietary sensors introduces capital intensity and hardware risk, the ability to perform molecular-level material analysis at scale offers 10x better predictive capabilities for wildfire and failure mitigation.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Matter Intelligence builds advanced satellite and drone sensors that act like high-powered digital eyes, capable of identifying the chemical composition and temperature of objects on Earth. Unlike standard cameras that just take pictures, their 'hyperspectral' technology detects the unique molecular signatures of materials, allowing them to spot invisible things like methane gas leaks, rare mineral deposits for batteries, or the early stages of a wildfire.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The global energy transition requires a massive increase in mineral scouting (lithium, rare earths) and strict methane monitoring, creating a surge in demand for high-resolution planetary data that AI models can use to predict environmental risks.
vc_dossier.analogy: An MRI for the Earth.
vc_dossier.moat_description: The company possesses a technical moat through proprietary 'ultraspectral' sensor hardware that provides 10x higher resolution than current commercial competitors, combined with a unique database of material 'fingerprints' used to train their world-mapping AI.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Lowercarbon Capital, Toyota Ventures, Pear VC, Mark Cuban Companies, E2MC Ventures, Level Cubed, Terranova VC, Defense Angels
vc_dossier.key_customers: Currently engaging in early partnerships within the mining, insurance, and national security sectors; target customers include energy utilities and mineral exploration firms.

pitch_summary: Measurement Labs provides advanced spatial intelligence and mapping solutions leveraging AI and Machine Learning to assist utilities with distribution-level vegetation management and wildfire mitigation.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A specialized software platform addressing the high-priority utility need for wildfire risk reduction through automated vegetation analysis and spatial monitoring.
rationale: Measurement Labs addresses the critical wildfire mitigation market with a high-leverage AI/ML software model that scales without heavy hardware deployment. The primary risk involves competition from established satellite and LiDAR incumbents, but their specialized focus on distribution-level predictive analytics offers significant venture upside.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Context Labs provides a digital platform that acts as a 'truth machine' for energy companies. It collects data from satellites, ground sensors, and internal corporate records to prove exactly how much carbon or methane a company is emitting. By using blockchain-like technology, they create an unchangeable audit trail that energy companies use to prove their 'green' claims to regulators and investors, effectively eliminating 'greenwashing.'
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Carbon Accountability' Boom. As governments implement mandatory emissions reporting and carbon taxes, energy companies must transition from 'estimating' their pollution to 'measuring' it with empirical data to avoid legal liability and maintain access to capital.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Moody's' for Carbon Intensity (providing the 'credit score' for how clean an energy asset actually is).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Data Provenance & Cryptographic Attestation. Their 'Immutably' data fabric integrates disparate, high-velocity data (satellite, IoT, ERP) into a single, verifiable ledger. This creates high switching costs because their certificates are often required for high-premium 'Responsibly Sourced Gas' (RSG) contracts with major buyers.
vc_dossier.key_investors: BP Energy Partners (BPEP), Equinor Ventures, KPMG LLP, Shamrock Ventures, Neglected Climate Opportunities LLC, i(x) investments, and Barclays (advisor for current fundraising).
vc_dossier.key_customers: Williams (one of the largest US energy infrastructure operators), EQT Corporation (largest natural gas producer in the US), and Shell.

name: Megajoule Plus Systems (MPS)
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Megajoule Plus Systems (MPS) Booths Upper Level — SU-3B Mark As Visited About Megajoule Plus Systems (MPS)  MPS utilizes capacitor storage devices that minimize or even eliminate the reliance on batteries for backup power. The core of the MPS technology lies in its innovative use of capacitor storage devices. These devices can store and deliver large amounts of energy efficiently at many voltage levels simultaneously. MPS operates with an efficiency rate of 92%, transforming megajoules of energy from a high-voltage capacitor bank into multiple useful power levels currently not available in the market. Unlike traditional DC-DC topographies, MPS features a supervisory control system that transforms pulse-power capacitor-based stacked voltage into service voltage, compensating for the asymptotic capacitive voltage swings. Further, MPS can deliver large amounts of energy from the high voltage storage side to a load-driver linear service voltage. An integrated and innovative multi-filar inductor accommodates large currents. In addition, MPS features a unique switching process while recharging. In other words, MPS can deliver large amounts of energy from its high voltage side to drive multiple lower service-level voltage loads in a steady-state mode. Therefore, MPS allows the smooth and efficient transfer of high levels of energy from a capacitor bank to multiple loads with multiple voltages. It is a direct DC to DC voltage converter. MPS is superior than batteries for the following reasons. Batteries have a relatively flat discharge voltage; however, they are low voltage devices (around 1.5 volts per cell) unless one must connect many of them in series. Moreover, batteries have their environmental challenges. By contrast capacitors are lighter and today, power capacitors have the capacity of one to ten megajoules. But for capacitors, the discharge curve drops to 50% by only discharging 75% of its energy. That is why power capacitors can only be used as direct discharge systems for short bursts of energy.  About Megajoule Plus Systems (MPS) Product Categories Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Control Systems Collateral  BROCHURE  MPS Summary  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Megajoule Plus Systems (MPS) develops high-efficiency capacitor-based energy storage solutions designed to minimize or eliminate reliance on traditional batteries. Their technology features a proprietary DC-DC converter and supervisory control system that transforms pulse-power capacitor energy into multiple stable service-level voltages, achieving a 92% efficiency rate while addressing the environmental and discharge limitations of chemical batteries.
investment_thesis_one_liner: MPS offers a sustainable, high-efficiency alternative to batteries by leveraging advanced capacitor control and power electronics to provide reliable, high-voltage energy storage and multi-level voltage distribution.
rationale: Megajoule Plus Systems offers high-leverage IP in power electronics that solves the efficiency and discharge limitations of traditional capacitors, targeting high-value industrial backup markets. However, the company faces significant hardware capital intensity and a competitive battle against rapidly improving chemical battery energy densities.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Megajoule Plus Systems (MPS) builds a 'hybrid' battery for the power grid. It combines the high capacity of a traditional lead-acid battery with the fast-charging speed of a capacitor, resulting in a system that lasts 10x longer but costs roughly the same to manufacture.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything.' As EV charging and AI data centers strain the aging power grid, there is an urgent need for low-cost, high-durability storage that can handle rapid, repeated charging cycles better than Lithium-ion or standard lead-acid batteries.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Toyota Prius' of grid storage—a hybrid technology that bridges the gap between old-school batteries and high-tech capacitors.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary hybrid chemistry (Lead-Carbon/Capacitor) and patented power management hardware originally developed in collaboration with NASA and Russian research institutions, offering 5,000+ cycle life (10x better than lead-acid) at a disruptive price point.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Innovation Fund America, Joules Accelerator, MegaJoule Ventures
vc_dossier.key_customers: Target sectors include Commercial & Industrial (C&I) peak shaving and utility-scale grid stabilization (e.g., potential pilots with Duke Energy via Joules Accelerator).

pitch_summary: Micatu develops proprietary optical sensing technology that provides high-accuracy voltage, current, and temperature measurements for utilities, facilitating better grid management and integration of renewable energy.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Leveraging advanced optics to replace traditional instrument transformers, Micatu provides the precision data required for the modern, decarbonized smart grid.
rationale: Micatu provides a critical, IP-protected optical sensing technology that enables high-fidelity data collection necessary for a modern, intermittent grid. While hardware-heavy and subject to long utility sales cycles, the proprietary nature of their optical measurement platform offers a significant competitive moat over traditional legacy sensors.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Micatu makes specialized sensors that use light (optics) instead of traditional electricity to monitor power lines. This allows power companies to measure voltage and current much more accurately and safely, helping them manage the unpredictable flow of energy from wind and solar farms without the risk of equipment explosions or wildfires. Estimated annual revenue is undisclosed but the company operates as a growth-stage venture-backed firm.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization and Decarbonization. As more solar and wind energy are added to the grid, the flow of electricity becomes 'noisier' and harder to track; Micatu provides the precision needed to prevent blackouts and optimize these green energy sources.
vc_dossier.analogy: The high-definition digital sensor for the electric grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented optical sensing technology using the Pockels and Faraday effects. Unlike traditional sensors that use heavy magnets and oil, Micatu sensors use light, making them smaller, safer (non-explosive), and immune to the electrical interference that ruins data accuracy for legacy competitors. This makes them a mission-critical tool for utilities that cannot be easily replaced once installed.
vc_dossier.key_investors: WAVE Equity Partners, Empire State Development (ESD), US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
vc_dossier.key_customers: Eaton (OEM distribution partner), and major North American electric utility companies.

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Microsoft Corporation Booths Upper Level — MR-3868 Mark As Visited Company Information www.microsoft.com/en-us/industry/energy About Microsoft Corporation  Microsoft is at the forefront of the energy future by leveraging AI to power sustainable energy solutions. name: Milsoft Utility Solutions, Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Milsoft Utility Solutions, Inc. Booths Ground Level — 2346 Mark As Visited Company Information www.milsoft.com/ About Milsoft Utility Solutions, Inc.  Milsoft is a leading provider of software solutions purpose-built for electric utilities, helping cooperatives, municipal utilities, and investor-owned utilities plan, operate, and restore their distribution systems with confidence. For more than 35 years, Milsoft has focused on one core mission: giving utilities the tools they need to deliver reliable, affordable power in an increasingly complex grid environment. Milsoft’s integrated software suite supports the full lifecycle of utility operations—from long-range engineering analysis and system modeling to outage response, crew coordination, and customer communications. By connecting engineering, operations, and field workflows in a single ecosystem, Milsoft enables utilities to move faster, make better decisions, and reduce risk across the organization. At the foundation is Milsoft Engineering Analysis, a trusted platform for accurately modeling electric distribution networks. Utilities use it to validate system capacity, plan for growth, integrate distributed energy resources like solar and EVs, and ensure compliance with industry standards. The result is smarter planning, fewer surprises, and confidence that today’s investments will support tomorrow’s demands. On the operations side, Milsoft’s FieldSyte and StormSyte solutions modernize outage management, crew logistics, and mutual aid coordination. Utilities gain real-time visibility into crews, vehicles, and resources—allowing them to restore power faster, communicate more effectively, and document events with precision. During major storms, StormSyte simplifies mutual aid by helping utilities request, assign, and track external crews efficiently, reducing restoration times and administrative burden. Milsoft also enhances the customer experience through intelligent communication tools that proactively inform customers during outages and system events—reducing inbound call volume while increasing transparency and trust. What sets Milsoft apart is its utility-first approach. The software is designed around real-world utility workflows, supported by industry experts who understand the operational, regulatory, and financial pressures utilities face every day. Milsoft solutions scale with the utility, integrate with existing systems, and deliver measurable value—improved reliability, lower operational costs, faster restoration, and better planning outcomes. In a rapidly evolving energy landscape, Milsoft helps utilities stay ahead by turning data into insight and complexity into clarity.  About Milsoft Utility Solutions, Inc. name: Molecule Systems
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Molecule Systems Booths Upper Level — SU-18A Mark As Visited Company Information www.moleculesystems.com/ About Molecule Systems  Molecule Systems provides the execution infrastructure required to turn distributed energy resources (DERs) into reliable, grid-ready assets. As DERs scale rapidly across the grid, utilities are discovering that participation alone does not equal performance. Traditional Virtual Power Plants (VPPs have largely focused on enrollment, scheduling, and market access—issuing signals and hoping assets respond. That approach works for participation, but it breaks down when reliability, verification, and operational trust become the bar. Molecule was built to address the missing layer: deterministic, on-site execution. Molecule is an edge-based Infrastructure-as-a-Service platform that operates behind the meter, where devices physically live and where control can actually be enforced. Rather than acting as a centralized scheduler in the cloud, Molecule functions as the local execution environment that translates grid intent into real, verifiable behavior across batteries, EV chargers, solar, and other flexible loads. This distinction matters. Cloud-based VPP platforms and aggregators can coordinate schedules, but they rely on APIs, OEM logic, and best-effort connectivity for execution. Molecule embeds directly at the site or gateway level, enabling real-time orchestration, fallback logic, and device-level authority even under stressed grid conditions. The result is predictable response, five-minute telemetry, and performance verification during events—not hours later. Think of the difference as the gap between planning and operations. Many VPPs act as planners, deciding what should happen. Molecule acts as the on-site operator, ensuring it actually does happen. Molecule’s platform is designed as long-lived infrastructure, not fixed-function software. Utilities invest over 15–20 year horizons, while markets, programs, and operating requirements change far faster. Molecule’s execution layer is continuously updatable, allowing utilities and partners to adapt dispatch logic, orchestration strategies, and control policies over time without stranding physical assets. For utilities, Molecule enables DERs to behave less like probabilistic resources and more like dispatchable infrastructure—supporting higher control maturity, reduced operational risk, and confidence in real-world performance. For OEMs, Molecule provides a way to make hardware grid-ready without building and maintaining complex control software in-house. For investors, Molecule represents the foundational execution layer that the distributed grid has been missing—turning intelligence and forecasts into measurable, reliable outcomes. Molecule’s mission is simple: close the execution gap so VPPs can earn the same operational trust as traditional grid resources.  About Molecule Systems Product Categories Grid Edge and Behind-the-Meter Technologies > DER Aggregators Grid Edge and Behind-the-Meter Technologies > Vehicle-to-X solutions IT/OT > Enterprise Software/Platform Systems Collateral  BROCHURE  DividendVPP - Energy that earns. (White labeled VPP platform one pager)  BROCHURE  Molecule OEM Platform Overview Deck Contact Us  Adam Boucher  CEO  Adam Boucher is a Founder and the CEO of Molecule Systems, an edge-based Infrastructure-as-a-Service platform built to make distributed energy resources operate with the reliability and predictability utilities expect from traditional grid assets.  Adam has spent over a decade in commercial energy project development, followed by the last eight years focused on software, controls, and grid integration. Working closely with utilities, OEMs, and developers, he repeatedly encountered the same challenge: while DERs were scaling rapidly, the software coordinating them was optimized for enrollment and scheduling, not deterministic execution.  He co-founded Molecule to close that execution gap.  At the core of Molecule is an edge-based operating system, originally derived from aerospace applications, designed for high reliability, continuous operation, and long service lifecycles. Running on-site and fully interoperable across devices and protocols, Molecule’s execution layer translates grid intent into real, verifiable behavior—enabling DERs to respond like infrastructure rather than best-effort resources.  As CEO, Adam leads product strategy, go-to-market execution, partnerships, and fundraising, with a focus on product-market fit and operational credibility. His work is guided by a simple belief: the distributed grid will only scale when DERs can be controlled, verified, and trusted in the same way as traditional generation.  Read More  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Molecule Systems is an edge-based Infrastructure-as-a-Service provider that bridges the execution gap for Distributed Energy Resources (DERs). While traditional Virtual Power Plants focus on cloud-based scheduling and enrollment, Molecule provides a deterministic local execution environment. Operating behind the meter, their platform ensures that grid signals are translated into verifiable, real-time performance across batteries, EV chargers, and solar assets, even during network instability.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Providing the mission-critical edge operating layer necessary to transform volatile distributed assets into reliable, dispatchable grid infrastructure.
rationale: Molecule Systems addresses the critical 'reliability gap' in VPPs by moving orchestration from best-effort cloud APIs to deterministic edge execution. This creates a high-leverage software layer essential for grid-firming DERs, though success depends on rapid integration with diverse OEM hardware and overcoming long utility procurement cycles.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Molecule Systems provides software that acts as a bridge between local energy hardware—like solar panels, batteries, and EV chargers—and the power grid. Their platform allows these distributed devices to be grouped together and managed as a 'Virtual Power Plant,' helping to stabilize the grid and generate revenue for owners by selling excess power back to utilities during peak times.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The massive shift toward decentralized power (Electrification of Everything) and the urgent need for 'Virtual Power Plants' to manage thousands of small energy sources to prevent grid instability.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Windows' or operating system for smart energy hardware.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Defensibility comes from their proprietary 'MOS 350' edge operating system, which runs directly on physical devices rather than just in the cloud. This 'edge-first' approach ensures the system keeps working even if internet connectivity is lost and allows hardware manufacturers to integrate grid-ready features using simple no-code tools.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Los Angeles Cleantech Incubator (LACI)
vc_dossier.key_customers: Sinexcel (energy storage manufacturer), Enersponse (grid management provider), EG4 Electronics

Today, mPrest has invested heavily in applying its technology for the energy industry, which is in the midst of one of the most disruptive changes since the invention of electricity – Decarbonization, Decentralization and Digitization – driving an urgent need for integration between legacy and new technologies. mPrest is empowering this transformation with its world-leading orchestration and optimization platform, bringing rapid AI and IoT transformation capabilities to the industry. pitch_summary: mPrest provides a mission-critical orchestration and optimization software platform for industrial IoT and the energy sector. Leveraging expertise from high-stakes defense applications like the Iron Dome, the company delivers DERMS, asset management, and grid flexibility solutions to help utilities manage the transition toward decentralized and digitized energy systems.
customer_type: Utilities, Industrial Enterprises, and Infrastructure Operators
investment_thesis_one_liner: mPrest offers a unique 'system of systems' orchestration layer that translates defense-grade reliability into scalable software for managing complex, decentralized energy grids and industrial assets.
rationale: mPrest provides a mission-critical orchestration layer with high technical defensibility derived from defense-grade reliability standards. While it faces long utility sales cycles and competition from industrial incumbents, its software-first approach to complex DER management offers high leverage and scalability.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: mPrest creates 'Mission Control' software for power grids. Just as air traffic control manages thousands of planes to prevent collisions, mPrest's software manages millions of different energy sources—like solar panels, electric car chargers, and traditional power plants—to ensure the grid stays balanced and doesn't crash.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Decentralization of Energy. We are moving from a world with a few giant power plants to one with millions of 'mini' power plants (rooftop solar, home batteries, and EVs). Existing grid software was not built to handle this complexity, creating an urgent need for advanced 'brain' software to manage the chaos.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Iron Dome' for the Power Grid (derived from the founder's background building the actual Iron Dome missile defense system).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Battle-proven technology lineage. mPrest uses the same logic and speed required to intercept missiles (Iron Dome) to manage power grid fluctuations in real-time. This 'high-stakes' reliability creates high switching costs and a 'system-of-systems' architecture that can plug into any existing utility hardware, unlike competitors who often require specific equipment.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Series A in 2017 ($10M); notably, a $200M+ acquisition bid by Ondas was blocked by the Israeli Ministry of Defense in early 2026 due to the company's sensitive military software roots.
vc_dossier.key_investors: GE Ventures (General Electric), OurCrowd, Angeleno Group, BIRD Foundation, Vector Limited, and Rafael Advanced Defense Systems.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Southern Company, New York Power Authority (NYPA), Endeavour Energy, Energy Queensland, and EDF Renewables.

name: Neara
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Neara Booths Ground Level — 6205 Mark As Visited Company Information neara.com/physics-enabled-digital-twin/ About Neara  Neara is the first physics-enabled digital twin that combines engineering-grade analysis at the individual asset level with network-wide scale. It goes beyond visualization, capturing real-world spatial relationships — and how they change in any condition — that are essential to answering any ‘what-if’ question about your network: • Between assets and their surroundings — in a >50 mph SW wind scenario, where will assets breach safe clearance thresholds? • Between assets themselves — if one pole fails, which other ones will go with it? • Across layers of workflows — if a tower gets moved inland, how will vegetation encroachment zones shift? It applies the same physics-verified rigor used in engineering design to the full set of critical infrastructure challenges — from asset management and wildfire mitigation to resiliency and reliability, and design and construction. It connects the granular perspective engineers need to maintain a structurally sound, safe system with the network-wide view leaders need to improve reliability and efficiency. With Neara, daily realities upgrade from: • Chasing risks by problem area to prioritizing context-agnostic risks by total network impact • Costly and inefficient manual processes to precise, automated workflows • Messy, anecdotal, project justification to easy-to-audit business cases that hold up from the field to the boardroom and courtroom Every analysis, from a single pole’s loading to a proposed new transmission route, is grounded in the same structural ground truth so infrastructure owners can prioritize and validate network investment to maximize impact and capital efficiency in every context on every timescale. Trusted by global utilities including Southern California Edison, CenterPoint Energy, HEDNO, and ESB, Neara has modeled millions of assets across four continents — reducing key processes from years to hours, restoring service >3× faster, and saving tens of millions in annual costs.  About Neara Product Categories IT/OT > Data/Digitalization IT/OT > Enterprise Software/Platform Systems IT/OT > Mapping Equipment and Solutions/GIS Collateral  WHITE PAPER  A Guide to Procuring a Physics-Enabled Digital Twin  WHITE PAPER  Optimize risk-cost tradeoffs across your network: How do you choose the right asset interventions with limited budget? pitch_summary: Neara provides a physics-enabled digital twin platform designed for utilities to simulate and manage their infrastructure. By combining engineering-grade structural analysis with network-wide spatial data, the platform enables utilities to automate risk assessments for wildfires, vegetation encroachment, and asset failures under various environmental scenarios.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Neara replaces manual, inefficient utility inspection processes with a scalable, physics-verified software layer that optimizes capital expenditure and improves grid resiliency through high-fidelity simulations.
rationale: Neara represents a high-leverage SaaS platform that transforms expensive, manual engineering workflows into scalable digital assets through its proprietary physics-based digital twin. While long utility sales cycles and data quality integration represent significant hurdles, the platform's ability to provide critical wildfire and resiliency modeling creates a sticky, regulatory-aligned moat.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Neara creates a 3D 'digital double' of the electric grid that lets utility companies simulate how their wires and poles will react to extreme weather like wildfires and floods. Instead of sending people into the field to inspect every pole, engineers use this software to stress-test the entire network from their desks to prevent blackouts and plan where to build new power lines.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and increasing climate volatility (wildfires and hurricanes) have made grid resilience a top priority. Utilities are under massive pressure to modernize aging infrastructure to handle both extreme weather and the surge in power demand from AI and electric vehicles.
vc_dossier.analogy: SimCity for the real-world power grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Neara's moat is built on a proprietary 'physics-enabled' engine that processes massive amounts of laser-scan (LiDAR) data to create high-fidelity 3D models. It is highly defensible because it moves beyond simple mapping into complex engineering simulations that are difficult for generic AI or mapping software to replicate, creating high switching costs once embedded in a utility's regulatory and maintenance workflows.
vc_dossier.key_investors: EQT, Partners Group, Square Peg Capital, Skip Capital, Prosus Ventures, OIF Ventures, Grok Ventures.
vc_dossier.key_customers: CenterPoint Energy, Southern California Edison, Ausgrid, SA Power Networks, Endeavour Energy.

pitch_summary: Noble Carbon manufactures affordable, backwards-compatible smart circuit breakers that fit existing residential and multi-family electrical panels to enable advanced energy monitoring, load management, and panel-free electrification upgrades.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Noble Carbon solves the residential electrification bottleneck with a low-cost, retrofittable hardware solution that avoids expensive main panel upgrades while enabling grid-interactive demand response.
rationale: Noble Carbon addresses the massive 'panel upgrade' bottleneck for home electrification by offering a lower-friction, retrofit-ready hardware solution that enables granular load control. While hardware-heavy, the ability to aggregate residential demand response provides significant software-like scale and platform potential.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Noble Carbon is a climate-tech startup that turns agricultural waste into charcoal (biochar) to permanently store carbon in the soil. Led by former leaders of the world's largest carbon trading desks, the company creates high-quality 'removal' certificates that help corporations meet their environmental goals. Unlike traditional offsets which pay others not to pollute, their process physically removes CO2 from the air and traps it for over 500 years.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Flight to Quality' in carbon markets, where corporations are shifting from cheap 'avoidance' offsets to high-durability 'carbon removal' to meet strict Net-Zero disclosure requirements.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Intel Inside' for biochar—providing the data and verification layer that makes carbon removal credits bankable and trustworthy.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary Data Integration: The company leverages the massive climate and satellite data network of its parent company (Arbol) to verify exactly how much carbon is stored. This technical stack, combined with the founders' historical dominance in carbon trading at Mercuria and Noble Group, allows them to 'insure' the validity of their credits, a major defensibility source in a market plagued by greenwashing.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Series B in 2024 (via parent company Arbol)
vc_dossier.key_investors: Mubadala Capital, Giant Ventures, Opera Tech Ventures, Telstra Ventures, FJ Labs
vc_dossier.key_customers: Targeting Fortune 500 technology and financial firms (e.g., sectors including Big Tech and Sustainable Aviation Fuel buyers).

pitch_summary: NODES AS is a Norwegian technology provider that operates a decentralized market platform for energy flexibility. Their solutions include a Trading Platform for unlocking the value of distributed energy resources (DERs) and a GridTools Platform that supports distribution grid operators in managing short-term operations and congestion.
customer_type: Distribution System Operators (DSOs) and Flexibility Service Providers (FSPs)
investment_thesis_one_liner: NODES provides the critical market-clearing infrastructure and operational tools required to transform distributed assets like EVs and batteries into active participants for grid stability and congestion management.
rationale: NODES provides a high-leverage software platform that creates a decentralized marketplace for energy flexibility, capturing value through network effects between utilities and DER owners. While the regulatory barriers to entry are high, the business model scales efficiently as an asset-light exchange for grid congestion management.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: NODES AS operates an online marketplace that acts like a stock exchange for 'spare' electricity. It allows power grid operators to pay businesses and individuals to temporarily turn down their power usage or turn up their batteries to prevent the grid from becoming overloaded. This helps stabilize the electricity network as more unpredictable wind and solar power come online.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and the rise of intermittent renewable energy. Because wind and solar don't always produce power when needed, and EVs put massive strain on local grids, operators need a way to balance supply and demand without spending billions on new physical cables.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Airbnb' for extra power grid capacity.
vc_dossier.moat_description: First-mover advantage in European flexibility market design and a strategic 'incumbent' moat: the company was founded as a joint venture between Nord Pool (Europe's leading power exchange) and Agder Energi. This gives them unique regulatory access, deep industry credibility, and a platform already integrated into major European grid systems.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Å Energi (formerly Agder Energi), Nord Pool Spot, Smart Green
vc_dossier.key_customers: Svenska kraftnät (Sweden's national grid), Vattenfall Eldistribution, Ellevio, Fingrid (Finland), Helen Electricity Network

Nordic delivers world-class hardware, embedded software, development tools, power management, world-class support, and cloud lifecycle services - all simplifying development for developers to build reliable, scalable, and future-proof connected products faster. By simplifying IoT development and enabling seamless, chip-to-cloud solutions, Nordic empowers businesses to create smarter, more sustainable, and connected products transforming lives and industries. Nordic proudly collaborates with key industry alliances, including the Bluetooth SIG, CSA, GSMA, DECT Forum, GSA, Thread Group, Wi-Fi Alliance, among others - shaping the future of wireless IoT innovation. name: Noteworthy AI
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Noteworthy AI Booths Ground Level — 812 Mark As Visited Company Information www.noteworthy.ai/ About Noteworthy AI  Noteworthy AI helps electric utilities strengthen grid resilience and reliability through AI-enabled, vehicle-mounted cameras and real-time analytics. By leveraging existing fleet vehicles, utilities can autonomously capture and analyze pole-mounted asset data at posted speed limits—transforming routine operations into powerful sources of grid intelligence. The Inspect Platform delivers actionable insights for asset inventories, condition assessments, lighting audits, vegetation management, third-party attachment reviews, and post-storm damage analysis—all from a single truck roll and at a fraction of traditional inspection costs. Data integrates seamlessly into GIS and work management systems, enabling real-time visibility and faster decision-making. vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: An AI-powered software platform that acts as a universal translator for the power grid. It allows smart devices like EV chargers, thermostats, and solar batteries to communicate their capabilities in plain English, allowing them to work with utility programs automatically without the need for rigid industry technical standards.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Demand Flexibility: As AI data centers and the 'electrification of everything' cause power demand to surge, the energy grid needs automated software to coordinate millions of distributed devices to prevent blackouts and manage peak loads.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Android' or 'Universal Translator' for the Energy Grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'typeless' architecture that uses Large Language Models (LLMs) to interpret device functions at runtime. This allows for instant interoperability between hardware and the grid, bypassing the years-long delays and high costs associated with traditional industry certification and standard-setting (like Matter or OpenADR).

vc_dossier.key_investors: Universal Devices (Corporate Sponsor), California Energy Commission (Grant Funding)
vc_dossier.key_customers: California Energy Commission (CEC), OpenADR Alliance, and major smart device manufacturers seeking grid-readiness.

full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Ofil Booths Upper Level — UL338 Mark As Visited Company Information ofilsystems.com/ About Ofil  Founded in 1993, OFIL Systems has been a leading provider of solar-blind UV (DayCor®) inspection systems in the high-voltage markets. We stand at the forefront of tackling the growing challenges in electricity. Our pioneering innovation, solar-blind UV technology, introduced a new era of predictive maintenance, enabling precise and real-time detection of corona partial discharges and arcing in full daylight. OFIL Systems’ cutting-edge Gridnostic platform elevates the inspection capabilities by enhancing grid reliability through image intelligence. Gridnostic is designed to revolutionize how electrical utilities manage and maintain their electrical assets, ensuring reliability, efficiency and safety. pitch_summary: OneLayer provides a specialized security and observability platform for enterprise private LTE and 5G networks, enabling automated device fingerprinting and the extension of existing IT/OT security frameworks to cellular domains.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A critical security layer for the enterprise adoption of private 5G, bridging the visibility gap between carrier-grade cellular technology and standard industrial IT/OT management stacks.
rationale: OneLayer offers high venture leverage by providing a critical security layer for the rapidly expanding private 5G/LTE market in industrial OT environments. While it faces competition from established IT security incumbents, its domain-specific focus on cellular orchestration and automated device fingerprinting creates a strong technical moat.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: OneLayer provides security software for private industrial mobile networks (LTE and 5G). Just as companies have private Wi-Fi, big industrial sites like power plants and mines are now building their own private cellular networks for better range and reliability. OneLayer acts as a security guard for these networks, identifying every connected device—from smart meters to robotic drills—and ensuring they are safe from hackers.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Industrial 5G Revolution. Utilities and factories are moving away from old wired systems and unreliable Wi-Fi toward private cellular networks to manage thousands of new sensors and automated machines.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Zero Trust' Firewall for private industrial cellular networks.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'OneID' technology that creates a permanent digital fingerprint for every device on a cellular network. This allows security teams to track a device even if it switches between cellular and Wi-Fi or changes its network address, something standard security tools struggle to do.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Maor Investments, McRock Capital, Chevron Technology Ventures, Viola Ventures, Grove Ventures, Koch Disruptive Technologies.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Evergy (electric utility serving 1.7M customers), Southern Linc (subsidiary of Southern Company).

name: OUTRAM RESEARCH LIMITED
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral OUTRAM RESEARCH LIMITED Booths Upper Level — UL214 Mark As Visited Company Information www.outramresearch.co.uk About OUTRAM RESEARCH LIMITED  Outram Research Ltd (Ranger Power Quality) is a family owned company with over 35 years of signal processing and data logger design experience, starting to specialise in power quality >25 years ago. We now manufacture, sell and hire out a wide range of high quality, high specification power quality troubleshooting and fault level monitoring equipment directly and through distributors around the world. We are privaledged to work with Synergy Systems, who look after our US Customer base. Outram continually enhance their range with unique & valuable features via customer interaction & innovation to make troubleshooting and analysis of Power Quality problems, G5/5 background harmonic studies, Load and Energy surveys as straightforward as possible for everyone involved. Outram’s latest innovation the Real Time Fault Level Monitor (RTFLM) offers the Prospective Fault Level (Short Circuit Current) on an electricity network in real time, based on rapid, recurring measurement of the dynamic source impedance and the operating voltage. The RTFLM can be deployed to measure the Fault Level at target voltages up to 33kV wherever Voltage Transformers (VTs) are available, notwithstanding other connection requirements. This data can facilitate integration of renewable generation supporting the transition to net zero, give real time visibility of fault level conditions, enhancing safety and asset protection as well as continuously monitor network conditions improving operational efficiency.  About OUTRAM RESEARCH LIMITED Contact Us  Duncan Dalton  National Sales and Onsite Engineer  Kate Edwards  Global Sales and Operations  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Overstory uses satellite imagery and artificial intelligence to spot trees and plants growing too close to power lines. This helps electric companies identify exactly where to trim branches before they touch live wires and cause forest fires or regional blackouts.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Skyrocketing wildfire liability and extreme weather events are forcing utilities to overhaul their maintenance; vegetation management is often the single largest operating expense for a power company.
vc_dossier.analogy: An MRI for the power grid's backyard.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary AI risk models trained on high-resolution satellite data that identifies individual tree health at 10,000x the precision of public maps, combined with a 'Fuel Detection Model' validated by fire scientists.
