name: Electron
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Electron Booths Upper Level — UL811 Mark As Visited Company Information www.electron.net About Electron  ABOUT ELECTRON: Electron’s mission is to unlock energy abundance by helping utilities deliver affordable, reliable grid capacity from millions of flexible distributed energy resources (DERs). Combining grid-aware analytics with market coordination to deliver value orchestration, Electron enables system operators and utilities to uncover, validate, and activate the value of distributed flexibility. Trusted by leading utilities worldwide, Electron is providing the digital foundations for a proof-led, low-cost, and resilient energy system. WHY ELECTRON? Electron’s technology strengthens, rather than replaces, existing market and control-system tools and teams. It connects DERMS, VPPs, trading platforms, and utility programs through a neutral coordination layer that standardises data exchange, enhances visibility, and removes the need for spreadsheets and manual processes. By linking these previously siloed systems, Electron helps the whole ecosystem deliver flexibility faster, more securely, and at lower cost. Key benefits include: 1) Faster, lower-cost deployment Utilities can identify and deploy flexibility within weeks, not years, unlocking network headroom without waiting for physical reinforcement. Delivered through a SaaS model, the platform can be deployed rapidly without heavy IT integration. The Grid Analytics capability can analyse millions of AMI meters-worth of utility data securely and efficiently (typically 2-4 weeks vs. 6-12mths), using existing datasets to produce actionable insights without direct access to operational systems-maintaining strong data-security boundaries. Likewise, the Flexibility Marketplace streamlines how utilities and VPPs interact, providing a neutral layer to transact market data whilst creating a secure airgap between participants. Together, this pragmatic approach to grid and market data dramatically reduces time to value for utilities and VPPs. 2) Solving the buy-side scaling problem The challenge today isn’t finding flexible assets - it’s enabling utilities to value and trust them. Electron combines grid analytics and market performance data to generate regulatory-grade, auditable evidence of flexibility’s cost-effectiveness. This gives utilities and regulators confidence to invest, plan, and report on flexibility as a dependable alternative to reinforcement, or indeed to justify why proactive grid upgrades were needed. 3) Grid-aware market coordination ElectronConnect enables multiple concurrent market products, coordinating dispatch to avoid overlaps and ensure flexibility only activates where it benefits the grid whilst avoiding double counting. 4) Ecosystem enablement and innovation Through open APIs and shared data standards, Electron provides a trusted platform on which others-utilities, aggregators, and third-party innovators-can build new services and value streams. This common foundation supports ongoing innovation and affordability while scaling the flexibility needed to flatten the duck curve.  About Electron Product Categories Energy Trading/ Energy Markets > Flexibility Grid Edge and Behind-the-Meter Technologies > DER Management Systems (DERMS) Policy and Regulation > FERC Rulemaking  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Electron provides a neutral coordination layer and marketplace for utilities and system operators to orchestrate distributed energy resources (DERs). Its platform combines grid-aware analytics with market performance data to enable the rapid deployment of flexibility, helping to unlock grid capacity and avoid costly physical infrastructure upgrades.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Electron is building the necessary digital infrastructure to scale flexibility markets, providing a neutral orchestration layer that bridges the gap between utilities and distributed energy resources.
rationale: Electron presents a high-leverage venture opportunity by acting as a neutral marketplace layer that facilitates network effects between utilities and DER aggregators. While it faces the headwinds of regulated utility procurement and complex grid regulations, its SaaS-based orchestration model offers the scalability required for venture-scale returns.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Electron provides a digital marketplace that allows the power grid to buy 'flexibility' from local energy users. Essentially, it lets the grid pay homes and businesses to briefly turn down their power usage or discharge their batteries when demand is too high, preventing blackouts without needing to turn on expensive, dirty backup power plants.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and the transition to volatile renewable energy (wind and solar) means the power grid can no longer rely on steady coal or gas plants. To stay stable, the grid now needs software to coordinate millions of small, decentralized assets like EV chargers and home batteries in real-time.
vc_dossier.analogy: An eBay or AirBnB for the local electricity grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Network Effects and High Switching Costs: As more energy assets (batteries, EVs) join Electron’s platform, the marketplace becomes more valuable to utility companies. Once integrated into a utility's regulated control systems to manage grid stability, the software is extremely difficult to replace.
vc_dossier.key_investors: East Innovate (East Alpha), Riverstone Holdings, Nesta, One Planet Capital, Kaluza, SYSTEMIQ, Tech Nation Group
vc_dossier.key_customers: UK Power Networks, SP Energy Networks, and various UK-based Distributed Network Operators (DNOs).

pitch_summary: eSmart Systems provides AI-powered software for the digitalization and intelligent asset management of critical energy infrastructure, utilizing its Grid Vision platform to transform imagery and GPS data into actionable digital assets.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A global leader in utility digitalization that leverages AI and computer vision to automate grid inspections, reducing operational risk and extending the lifespan of aging infrastructure.
rationale: eSmart Systems leverages high-margin AI and computer vision to disrupt the traditionally labor-intensive utility inspection market, offering significant software-driven scalability. While utility sales cycles are notoriously slow, their established global footprint and focus on critical brownfield infrastructure provide a strong defensive moat.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: eSmart Systems provides software that uses Artificial Intelligence to analyze photos of power lines and electricity towers taken by drones or helicopters. The software automatically spots broken parts, rust, or nearby trees that could cause power outages or wildfires, allowing utility companies to fix problems before they happen without having to send humans to climb dangerous equipment.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Resilience & Wildfire Mitigation: As power grids age and climate-driven disasters increase, utilities are shifting from 'reactive' repairs (fixing things after they break) to 'predictive' maintenance to avoid massive wildfire liabilities and ensure the grid can handle the increased demand from electric vehicles.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Palantir' for Power Grid Assets.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Data Network Effects & Strategic Integration: The company possesses a massive proprietary library of over 10 years of power grid imagery used to train its 30+ specialized AI models. Furthermore, its 'Grid Vision' platform is deeply integrated into the workflows of over 50 global utilities, creating high switching costs. Its 2024 strategic partnership with Quanta Services (a leading US grid contractor) provides a massive 'boots on the ground' distribution advantage.
vc_dossier.key_investors: TiLT Capital Partners (lead), Quanta Services, Energy Impact Partners, Equinor Ventures, Nysnø Climate Investments, Future Energy Ventures, Arosa Capital, and Kongsberg Group.
vc_dossier.key_customers: E.ON, Xcel Energy, Alliander, Fingrid, and Evergy.

name: Magnefy
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Magnefy Booths Upper Level — SU-9A Mark As Visited Company Information magnefy.com/ About Magnefy  Magnefy is redefining predictive maintenance for critical power infrastructure. Spun out of Stanford, we use non-invasive DC–high frequency magnetic sensing—costing only hundreds of dollars at the edge—to detect early-stage anomalies in transformers/inverters/switchgears (harmonics, partial discharge, arcing, and more) months before they become outages. Paired with our sensor-agnostic digital twin and AI copilot, we help utilities, IPPs and mission-critical facilities prevent costly failures, cut O&M costs, and make data-driven CapEx decisions while boosting power reliability and efficiency.  Product Categories Distribution > Asset Management Distribution > Distribution Data Management and Analytics Distribution > Fault Indication Monitoring Contact Us  Derrick Du  Founding Product Manager  Derrick Du is the Product Manager at Magnefy, where he leads product strategy and execution for the company’s AI-driven edge IoT sensing and analytics platform for predictive monitoring of transformers and switchgear. An experienced IoT practitioner, Derrick previously worked at Particle and IoTank, where he built and deployed scalable connected-device platforms across industrial and commercial applications. He brings deep expertise in edge devices, connectivity, and system integration, translating real-world IoT experience into reliable, field-ready products for critical power infrastructure.  Read More  Joseph Kao  CEO  Joseph Kao is the Founder and CEO of Magnefy, a seed-stage startup developing AI-driven magnetic sensing & digital twins for predictive monitoring of critical power assets such as transformers and switchgear. A materials scientist by training, Joseph brings over a decade of experience commercializing advanced sensing and hardware technologies across energy and industrial systems. His work focuses on delivering early, actionable insights that help utilities, power producers, and data center operators prevent outages, reduce risk, and optimize CapEx and OpEx as the grid modernizes. pitch_summary: Magnefy is a Stanford spin-out that provides low-cost, non-invasive magnetic sensing and AI-driven digital twin technology for predictive maintenance of critical power infrastructure such as transformers and switchgear, enabling early detection of anomalies months before failure.
investment_thesis_one_liner: Magnefy disrupts grid asset management by combining high-fidelity magnetic sensors with AI to offer a scalable, low-cost predictive maintenance solution for the aging electrical grid.
rationale: Magnefy offers a high-leverage hardware-enabled software model that solves the critical 'brownfield' problem of aging infrastructure through non-invasive, low-cost sensing and proprietary AI. While the company faces long utility sales cycles, its ability to provide high-fidelity predictive data at a fraction of the cost of traditional monitoring presents massive scale potential.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Magnefy builds sensors that act like a 'Check-Engine Light' for the high-voltage power grid. Their small, non-invasive devices clip onto massive electrical equipment like transformers and use magnetic signals to 'listen' for tiny electrical sparks or vibrations that signal a future failure. This allows power plants and data centers to fix equipment before it explodes or causes a blackout.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Electrification of Everything and AI Power Demand. As the grid ages and data centers consume record amounts of power, a single hour of unplanned downtime can cost over $100,000. Magnefy addresses the urgent need for grid reliability as demand outstrips the current infrastructure's health.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Fitbit' for Power Transformers.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Magnefy's defensibility comes from its proprietary Gallium Arsenide (GaAs) magnetic sensors and custom 'Edge AI.' These sensors capture 250x more high-frequency data (up to 50MHz) than standard tools, allowing them to detect 'hidden' signals of failure that competitors miss, all without needing to turn off the power for installation.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Dolby Family Ventures, Dangerous Ventures, Climate Capital, Antler, Cyan Ventures
vc_dossier.key_customers: Data Centers, Independent Power Producers (IPPs), Utilities, and Transformer Manufacturers (OEMs)

pitch_summary: ThinkLabs AI develops physics-informed AI digital twins and specialized AI agents designed to automate complex grid engineering tasks, including interconnection studies, real-time operational analytics, and transmission and distribution (T&D) co-simulation.
customer_type: Utilities, Grid Operators, and Energy Developers
investment_thesis_one_liner: Founded by industry veterans from Opus One Solutions and GE, ThinkLabs AI addresses the critical grid bottleneck by automating engineering workflows using high-fidelity, physics-aware artificial intelligence.
rationale: ThinkLabs AI addresses critical grid bottlenecks such as interconnection queues and real-time operational complexity through a highly scalable, AI-native software platform. The company's physics-informed approach creates a strong technical moat in a sector typically dominated by slower, deterministic incumbent solutions.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: ThinkLabs AI creates software that acts as an automated assistant for power grid operators. It uses artificial intelligence to predict and prevent electricity bottlenecks and blackouts caused by the surge of electric vehicle chargers, solar panels, and heat pumps. Unlike generic AI, their system follows the laws of physics to ensure the grid remains stable even as it becomes more complex to manage.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' (EVs, data centers, and renewables) is overloading a power grid designed for 20th-century stability, creating an urgent need for software-driven grid orchestration to avoid trillions in physical upgrade costs.
vc_dossier.analogy: A Google Maps for the Power Grid that provides real-time traffic management for electricity.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary 'Physics-Informed AI' models that combine electrical engineering mathematics with machine learning, fortified by exclusive intellectual property and historical data inherited through its spin-out from GE Vernova.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Powerhouse Ventures, Active Impact Investments, Blackhorn Ventures, Amplify Capital, Mercuria Energy Trading, GE Vernova, and a national US energy company.

name: Thor Poletest Limited
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Thor Poletest Limited Booths Ground Level — 4748 Mark As Visited Company Information www.thorpoletest.com/ About Thor Poletest Limited  THOR Poletest® is a complete, data-driven, non-destructive testing technology for assessing the health of wooden utility poles, empowering engineers and asset managers to make faster, objective, and more confident decisions. Using stress wave propagation, it delivers reliable, repeatable, and reproducible insights in under a minute, without damaging the pole. It is engineered for utility engineers, field inspectors, and asset managers who oversee essential infrastructure enabling users to visualize, rank, and manage networks efficiently. We empower asset teams to overcome challenges like aging infrastructure, resource constraints, and subjective assessments, ensuring safer networks and smarter investments. THOR Poletest reports RSV values for tested poles and visualizes them in its portal to support objective decision-making. Alongside RSV, THOR provides its Pole Health Index (PHI™) as the primary reporting metric, delivered through an intuitive traffic light system that reflects the overall health of each pole.  About Thor Poletest Limited Product Categories Distribution > Asset Management Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Poles Transmission > Maintenance, Management & Monitoring Collateral  WHITE PAPER  The Forgotten Factor of Wood Pole Condition Assessment White paper  BROCHURE  Handbook of Non-destructive Wood Pole Testing | THOR Poletest Contact Us  Yasmin Gunathilake  Client Success Coordinator  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Thor Poletest provides a non-destructive, data-driven testing technology that uses stress wave propagation to assess the structural integrity of wooden utility poles. By delivering objective health metrics and visualization via their Pole Health Index (PHI™) in under a minute, they enable utilities to efficiently manage aging infrastructure and prioritize maintenance investments.
customer_type: Utilities, Infrastructure Asset Managers, and Field Inspection Contractors
investment_thesis_one_liner: A hardware-enabled solution addressing the critical utility challenge of aging wood pole infrastructure through fast, objective, and non-destructive digital health assessments.
rationale: Thor Poletest provides a high-value, data-driven solution for the massive problem of aging wooden utility infrastructure by replacing subjective hammer-tests with objective physics. While the proprietary health index and portal provide venture-like software upside, the solution's growth is inherently limited by the manual, human-centric nature of field inspections.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Thor Poletest makes a high-tech hammer and sensor kit that uses sound waves to 'see' inside wooden power poles. It tells utility companies if a pole is rotting or weak in less than a minute, replacing the old method of manually drilling holes or hitting poles with a normal hammer to listen for hollow sounds.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Wildfire Liability & Grid Resilience. Utility companies are under massive pressure to prevent fires caused by falling poles. As power grids age (many poles are 50+ years old), companies need fast, data-driven ways to decide which poles to replace before they fail.
vc_dossier.analogy: The MRI for the power grid's wooden bones.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary Data & Hardware. They possess the world's largest database of Stress Wave Propagation (SWP) results with over 300,000 tests conducted. Their 'Pole Health Index' (PHI) is a proprietary scoring system that turns complex vibration data into an easy-to-understand 'traffic light' health score.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Undisclosed (Likely internally funded by parent company Groundline Engineering)
vc_dossier.key_investors: Groundline Engineering (Parent Company)

pitch_summary: TS Conductor specializes in the development and manufacturing of high-performance overhead conductors designed for transmission and sub-transmission systems, providing high capacity, low line losses, and low-sag performance to enhance grid reliability and efficiency.
investment_thesis_one_liner: TS Conductor offers a critical infrastructure upgrade that doubles the capacity of existing transmission corridors without requiring new permits or rights-of-way, essential for the global energy transition.
rationale: TS Conductor leverages proprietary materials science to provide a high-leverage solution for grid congestion and renewable integration via re-conductoring. While capital intensive, its ability to double line capacity without new rights-of-way creates a massive venture-scale opportunity in the transmission supercycle.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: TS Conductor manufactures high-performance power lines that can carry up to three times more electricity than traditional wires using existing utility towers. Their cables use a patented carbon-fiber core protected by an aluminum seal, making them lighter, stronger, and more efficient than the 100-year-old steel-core technology currently used by most power companies.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: AI-driven power demand and renewable energy integration. The existing power grid is a massive bottleneck; TS Conductor allows utilities to 'supercharge' existing lines (reconductoring) to meet skyrocketing electricity needs without the 10-year delay of building new transmission towers.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Fiber Optic' upgrade for the power grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented 'Aluminum Encapsulated Carbon Core' (AECC) technology. Unlike previous advanced wires that were brittle and required specialized training, TS Conductor’s design is durable enough to be installed with standard utility tools and crews, creating high switching costs for competitors whose tech requires a complete overhaul of field practices.

vc_dossier.key_customers: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA), Florida Power & Light (FPL), Salt River Project (SRP), Basin Electric Power Cooperative, Montana-Dakota Utilities (MDU)

pitch_summary: Ubicquia provides AI-driven platforms, sensors, and connectivity solutions designed to make existing utility and municipal infrastructure intelligent, focusing on grid resiliency, energy reduction, and operational efficiencies through massive data analytics.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A market-leading infrastructure-as-a-service play that modernizes the grid and urban environments by layering advanced AI and sensing capabilities onto existing transformer and streetlight assets.
rationale: Ubicquia leverages a massive global brownfield footprint of streetlights and transformers to deploy high-margin analytics via low-friction hardware retrofits. While utility sales cycles are notoriously slow, their successful penetration into 800+ customers and integration with OEMs demonstrates a scalable platform with significant data moats.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Ubicquia provides 'plug-and-play' hardware that snaps into the universal sockets found on top of almost every streetlight in the world. These devices turn basic light poles into smart nodes that can monitor traffic, provide public Wi-Fi, and detect power grid failures in real-time. Their platform also monitors electrical transformers to help utilities prevent expensive equipment damage and neighborhood-wide blackouts. Estimated annual revenue is approximately $60M-$100M.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization and Electrification: As cities and utilities face aging infrastructure and extreme weather, they need low-cost, rapidly deployable sensors to monitor power health and public safety without digging new trenches.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Roku' for streetlights—a simple device that plugs into existing hardware to unlock a suite of smart digital services.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Ubicquia holds a proprietary design and patents for a form factor that utilizes the standard NEMA electrical socket used by 450+ million streetlights globally. This allows for installation in under 15 minutes by non-specialized labor, bypassing the massive permitting and labor costs associated with traditional smart city hardware.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Fuel Venture Capital, SVB Financial Group, Somerston Group, TechConnect Ventures, TDF Ventures, Compass Group Equity Partners.
vc_dossier.key_customers: City of Miami, City of San Diego, Philadelphia, Orlando Utilities Commission (OUC), and Florida Power & Light (FPL).

name: Ubiik Inc.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Ubiik Inc. Booths Upper Level — UL635 Mark As Visited Company Information www.ubiik.com/ About Ubiik Inc.  Ubiik delivers high-performance wireless connectivity solutions for mission-critical utility and industrial applications. Ubiik continues to innovate in the private LTE and IoT space, addressing coverage limitations and cost barriers that hinder widespread IoT adoption. name: UCA International Users Group
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral UCA International Users Group Booths Ground Level — 4935 Mark As Visited Company Information ucaiug.org/ About UCA International Users Group  The UCA International Users Group (UCAIug) is a global, nonprofit, member-driven organization that promotes the adoption, implementation, and interoperability of open international standards used throughout the electric utility industry. Its mission is to enable seamless integration and communication between systems, devices, and applications that support modern, intelligent power systems. UCAIug serves as an umbrella organization for several key user communities — including the IEC 61850 Users Group, the Common Information Model (CIM) Users Group, and the Open Field Message Bus (OpenFMB) initiative. Together, these groups advance standardization and best practices for substation automation, enterprise data exchange, and distributed energy communications. Founded to accelerate the practical use of open standards, UCAIug provides a neutral forum where utilities, equipment manufacturers, software vendors, system integrators, and research organizations collaborate. Members work collectively to test interoperability, share lessons learned, and provide feedback to global standards bodies such as the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) and NIST. A cornerstone of UCAIug’s work is its interoperability testing and certification program. The organization defines and maintains test procedures, accredits independent test laboratories, and certifies products that conform to IEC 61850 and related standards. These efforts help utilities and vendors ensure reliable performance, reduce integration costs, and increase confidence in standards-based solutions. Beyond technical validation, UCAIug plays an active role in education and knowledge sharing. It organizes workshops, webinars, and international interoperability events where members validate multi-vendor interoperability in real-world scenarios. The group also manages online collaboration platforms and repositories for use cases, models, and implementation guides — supporting both beginners and advanced implementers. Membership in UCAIug is open to utilities, vendors, research labs, universities, and consultants worldwide, with tiered corporate levels based on company size and participation needs. Members gain access to specialized working groups, early drafts of standards, collaborative testing opportunities, and direct input into the evolution of future specifications. Governed by an elected Board of Directors and supported by committees for each technical domain, UCAIug maintains a transparent, consensus-based structure. This ensures that its activities reflect the diverse interests of global stakeholders — from transmission and distribution utilities to software developers and manufacturers of grid automation technologies. UCAIug’s work has become foundational to the smart grid ecosystem. Its initiatives help utilities move toward secure, interoperable, and standards-based architectures that support renewable integration, grid modernization, and digital transformation. By fostering cooperation among industry leaders and standards organizations, UCAIug continues to be a driving force behind interoperability and innovation in electric power systems worldwide.  About UCA International Users Group Product Categories Consultants/Project Services > Training/Education Distribution > Distribution Automation Transmission > Substation Automation Collateral  PRESS RELEASE  UCA General Information and Announcements  BROCHURE  UCA's IEC 61850 Interoperability Testing Event - 2026 Contact Us  Ryan Willcockson, PhD  President  Ryan A. Willcockson, PhD, is the President of UCA International Users Group (UCAIug), dedicated to advancing standards-based interoperability in utilities.  With expertise in leading user communities for IEC 61850, CIM, and OpenFMB, he bridges technical domains and stakeholder collaboration to accelerate grid modernization and standards adoption.  As a change catalyst and TEDx speaker, Dr. Willcockson emphasizes the importance of open standards and cooperative development in shaping the future of power systems.  Under his leadership, UCAIug continues to convene utilities, vendors, integrators, and researchers to conduct standards development, interoperability testing, certify conformance, share models and tools, and influence global standardization efforts. full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Uni-Trend Technology US Inc. Booths Upper Level — UL905 Mark As Visited Company Information www.uni-trendus.com/ About Uni-Trend Technology US Inc.  Uni-Trend Technology， widely known by its brand name UNI-T, is a leading manufacturer and solution provider of test and measurement instruments in the world, and also a national high-tech enterprise focusing on the independent R&D, production and sales of test and measurement instruments in China. Founded in 1988 and officially established as a corporate entity in 2003 with its headquarters located in Dongguan Songshan Lake National High-Tech Industrial Development Zone, Guangdong Province, the company has been committed to building a world-class national brand of instruments and meters. The company's main business covers four major product lines: general instruments, professional instruments, temperature and environmental testing instruments, and test equipment, with more than 1,000 product models in total. Its product range includes digital multimeters, clamp meters, infrared thermal imagers, digital oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, etc., and it also provides comprehensive solutions for new energy vehicle industry, lithium-ion battery testing, photovoltaic power station operation and maintenance, and other fields. These products are widely applied in electronics, rail transit, 5G new infrastructure, new energy, power construction, automobile manufacturing, environmental protection, and scientific research and education sectors. Uni-Trend is among the few comprehensive instrument companies globally that simultaneously layout electronic and electrical test instruments, power and high-voltage test instruments, temperature and environmental test instruments, oscilloscopes, signal generators and other equipment. The company has built modern manufacturing bases in Dongguan, Heyuan and Vietnam, with a 45,000-square-meter manufacturing base in Dongguan Songshan Lake High-tech Development Zone to ensure the stable and reliable quality of products supplied to the global market. It has obtained ISO 9001 quality management system certification, ISO 14001 environmental management system certification, as well as international product certifications such as CE, UL and CMC, which ensures that its products meet global safety and quality standards. pitch_summary: Viridi Parente develops fail-safe lithium-ion battery energy storage systems (BESS) featuring proprietary anti-propagation technology designed to prevent fires. Their AI-integrated systems are engineered for safe installation in occupied buildings and urban environments, enabling scalable energy optimization and remote monitoring.
customer_type: Commercial, Industrial, and Residential Real Estate
investment_thesis_one_liner: Viridi Parente addresses the critical safety barrier of urban battery storage by providing fail-safe, AI-optimized hardware that can be safely installed within occupied buildings.
rationale: Viridi Parente possesses a significant regulatory and technical moat through proprietary anti-propagation technology that enables Li-ion storage in high-density urban settings where competitors are often excluded. While the business is capital intensive, their focus on fail-safe safety standards for occupied buildings creates a premium niche within the massive energy storage market.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Viridi Parente builds heavy-duty battery systems that are designed to be 'fail-safe,' meaning they won't catch fire even if a single cell fails. This safety feature allows their batteries to be placed in locations where standard batteries are often restricted, such as inside occupied office buildings or within heavy construction equipment like excavators.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The Electrification of Everything & Fire Safety Regulations: As cities move to ban diesel generators and transition to indoor energy storage, the demand for high-density power that won't cause catastrophic building fires is skyrocketing.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Volvo' for Industrial Batteries (reputation built entirely on safety-first engineering).
vc_dossier.moat_description: Patented 'anti-propagation' technology derived from NASA-grade thermal management. While typical batteries can experience a 'chain reaction' fire (thermal runaway), Viridi’s architecture isolates failures to a single cell, allowing them to be the first to receive specific safety certifications for installation in occupied spaces.
vc_dossier.latest_round: Series C ($95M) in January 2022; Corporate Grant in April 2025.
vc_dossier.key_investors: National Grid Partners, Ashtead Group (Sunbelt Rentals), B. Thomas Golisano (Grand Oaks Capital), Impact Capital, Varia Ventures, Western New York Impact Investment Fund, California Energy Commission.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Sunbelt Rentals (electrification of construction fleet), National Grid (utility-scale storage and pilot projects).

name: vPAC Alliance
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral vPAC Alliance Booths Ground Level — 6115 Mark As Visited Company Information vpacalliance.com/ About vPAC Alliance  vPAC Alliance – Utility-Led Collaboration for Software-Defined Substations Booth #6115 The vPAC Alliance booth at DISTRIBUTECH is designed as a utility-led collaboration hub, not a traditional exhibit. Its purpose is to demonstrate—clearly and credibly—that Software-Defined Automation for substations is deployable today, using implemented, utility-validated solutions rather than conceptual demonstrations or future promises. At the center of the booth experience are two production-proven “solutions in a box,” grounded in real deployments from leading utilities and supported by an open, multi-vendor ecosystem. These implementations illustrate how compute, networking, and analytics come together to form a scalable, standards-based architecture—aligned with real-world utility requirements including cybersecurity, interoperability, lifecycle management, and operational reliability. Rather than product pitches, the booth is structured around live, peer-to-peer dialogue with utility leaders. Attendees engage directly with utilities operating vPAC-based architectures, enabling informed discussion around deployment realities, lessons learned, and realistic adoption paths based on production use rather than prototypes. Design & Experience The booth design emphasizes clarity, trust, and approachability through a clean, modern aesthetic and consistent visual language. Open sightlines, minimal clutter, and intentional lighting create an inviting environment that encourages longer engagement and conversation. Large-format architectural visuals and restrained messaging reinforce system-level thinking over component-level promotion. Sponsor recognition is integrated thoughtfully, strengthening credibility without overwhelming visitors. The result is a space positioned not to browse products, but to learn, validate, and discuss real-world solutions with peers. Engagement & Programming: A Key Differentiator The booth hosts live, moderated dialogue sessions throughout the event, featuring utilities—including Salt River Project (SRP) and Southern California Edison (SCE)—alongside OEMs and technology partners. Sessions focus on: Deployments happening now Lessons learned from implementation Incremental, realistic adoption strategies Coffee-served sessions increase dwell time and encourage repeat visits, transforming the booth into a destination for substantive, utility-driven conversation rather than a stop for passive viewing. Solution Readiness & Credibility A consistent message anchors the entire booth experience: These solutions are available for deployment today. Visitors have the opportunity to engage directly with utilities operating live vPAC-based systems, reinforcing trust, credibility, and practical relevance. The booth demonstrates how software-defined approaches modernize substation architectures without disrupting existing operations—enabling utilities to adopt new capabilities at a pace aligned with operational realities. Collaboration & Industry Impact The vPAC Alliance booth reflects true ecosystem collaboration, with shared ownership of dialogue sessions, demonstrations, and content across utilities, OEMs, and technology providers. All sessions are recorded and amplified through social media and post-event content, extending impact beyond the show floor and building momentum for continued engagement throughout 2026. The result is not just an exhibit—but a working model for how utilities and industry partners collaborate today to modernize grid infrastructure. name: WAIN Electrical Co., Ltd.
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral WAIN Electrical Co., Ltd. Booths Ground Level — 745 Mark As Visited Company Information www.wainelectric.com/ About WAIN Electrical Co., Ltd.  WAIN Electrical — Reliable Industrial Connectivity for Power, Energy, and Grid Infrastructure Founded in 2005, WAIN Electrical is a global manufacturer specializing in heavy-duty industrial connectors engineered for power systems, energy infrastructure, smart grids, substations, and utility-grade applications. For the past 20 years, WAIN has supported customers across the energy sector with durable, high-performance connectivity solutions designed for reliability in harsh and mission-critical environments. Powered by a 70,000-square-meter advanced manufacturing facility, WAIN integrates precision engineering, automated production, and rigorous testing laboratories to ensure product performance under extreme electrical, mechanical, and environmental conditions. Our strong R&D capabilities and extensive patent portfolio allow us to innovate rapidly and meet the evolving demands of the utility and energy industries. WAIN offers one of the industry’s most comprehensive connector portfolios, including rectangular connectors, circular connectors, high-voltage connectors for EV and ESS, energy storage and power-distribution connectors, panel-mount solutions, PCB connectors, and customized engineered assemblies. With more than 32,000 active product models, we support applications such as substations, transformers, switchgear, protection systems, wind and solar power, energy storage, industrial automation, and e-mobility infrastructure. Our products are certified and approved to major global standards—VDE, UL, CUL, CE, CQC, EN45545, and others—demonstrating WAIN’s commitment to safe, compliant, and utility-ready solutions. WAIN’s quality systems include ISO9001:2008, ISO14001:2004, IATF16949, and IRIS, ensuring consistent reliability from design to production. Serving more than 16,000 customers from over 70 countries worldwide, WAIN has become a trusted partner in the energy and industrial sectors. Our products are widely used in high-current transmission systems, energy storage racks, renewable power equipment, industrial machinery, rail systems, and electrical power distribution. With 1,100+ employees, our engineering and support teams are equipped to help utilities, EPC firms, integrators, and equipment manufacturers implement dependable and cost-effective connectivity solutions. WAIN’s global service network ensures responsive support wherever customers operate. We maintain offices across major Chinese cities, along with branch companies in Germany, Singapore, and the United States, supported by a worldwide network of agents and distributors.  About WAIN Electrical Co., Ltd. About WAIN Electrical Founded in 2005, WAIN specializes in high-quality heavy-duty industrial connectors used in power systems, energy storage, automation, machinery, EV/ESS, and industrial equipment. name: we-do-IT Inc
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral we-do-IT Inc Booths Ground Level — 5201 Mark As Visited Company Information wdigis.com/ About we-do-IT Inc  WDI is a global leader in utility data engineering, GIS modernization, and operational workflow transformation. We help utilities modernize faster and with greater confidence by delivering trusted data, advanced workflows, and deep category expertise that underpin next-generation platforms such as ADMS, digital twins, and decision intelligence systems. Utilities today operate in an environment of increasing complexity. Aging infrastructure, growing renewable integration, rising customer expectations, and regulatory pressure demand decisions that are transparent, defensible, and grounded in accurate, reliable data. Whether planning capital investments, improving system reliability, or advancing grid modernization initiatives, utilities need a strong data foundation to move forward with confidence. WDI serves as the backbone for this transformation. Our teams bring decades of hands-on experience across GIS, ADMS readiness, asset management, and large-scale data remediation. We specialize in turning fragmented, legacy, and operationally constrained data environments into decision-ready systems that utilities can trust. By combining expert-led services with modern engineering practices, WDI eliminates legacy bottlenecks, accelerates project timelines, and enables utilities to fully operationalize the advanced technologies reshaping the sector. At the core of every WDI engagement is a commitment to strengthening the pillars by which every utility is measured: Safety, Reliability, and Customer Affordability. Accurate data is not just a technical requirement—it is fundamental to protecting field crews, improving outage response, optimizing capital spend, and delivering reliable service at a sustainable cost. What truly sets WDI apart is our category expertise. Utilities achieve the greatest impact when advanced technologies are paired with specialists who understand the mission end to end—from planning and design through operations and execution. WDI supports some of the most complex utility environments in the world, processing more than two million work orders annually and delivering scalable, decision-ready data models that power enterprise systems and operational platforms. We partner with leading technology providers across GIS, digital twin, and decision-intelligence ecosystems to help utilities simulate outcomes before committing resources, reduce operational risk, and move from insight to execution with speed and clarity. Our role is to ensure the systems behind modernization are accurate, aligned, and ready for action. WDI empowers utilities to: Build ADMS- and digital-twin–ready data foundations Modernize enterprise GIS and asset workflows Accelerate capital planning and grid modernization initiatives Improve operational efficiency through expert-engineered processes Reduce risk, enhance reliability, and strengthen strategic decision-making With global delivery capabilities and a dedicated team of industry experts, WDI delivers transformation that is measurable, repeatable, and aligned with the real-world operational challenges utilities face every day. WDI — Trusted Data. Proven Expertise. Faster Modernization. vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: WeaveGrid builds software that acts as a bridge between electric vehicles (EVs) and the power grid. It helps utility companies manage the surge in electricity demand by automatically shifting EV charging to times when the grid is less stressed or when renewable energy (like wind and solar) is most abundant. This prevents local transformers from blowing out and saves drivers money through cheaper off-peak rates. Estimated annual revenue is approximately $15M-$50M.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: The 'Electrification of Everything' and the massive shift to EVs, which are projected to double residential electricity demand and threaten to overwhelm aging power grid infrastructure.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Air Traffic Control' for electric vehicle charging.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary data moats created by direct API-level integrations with major automakers (Toyota, Rivian, BMW) and utilities. This 'three-sided market' position (Drivers-Automakers-Utilities) creates high switching costs and regulatory barriers, as utility contracts often take years to win and integrate.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: WindBorne builds small, smart weather balloons that can stay in the air for weeks at a time to collect precise weather data from parts of the sky where current tools cannot reach, helping to predict extreme storms with much higher accuracy.

vc_dossier.analogy: The SpaceX for weather data.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Proprietary software that allows balloons to 'steer' themselves by moving between wind currents, combined with a unique database of atmospheric readings that covers 85% of the globe previously unmonitored by traditional systems.

name: Wingcopter GmbH
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Wingcopter GmbH Booths Upper Level — UL806 Mark As Visited Company Information wingcopter.com/ About Wingcopter GmbH  Wingcopter is a German drone technology company that develops, manufactures, sells and operates all-electric uncrewed aircraft systems, specializing in enhancing the logistics of urgently needed goods and remote sensing through high-end sensor systems. In a single 45-minute BVLOS flight, the Wingcopter 198 can scan 1,000+ hectares. By simultaneously capturing LiDAR and RGB data it allows the system to generate an exceptionally high point density and precision. Use cases include the inspection of long-range, linear infrastructure such as power lines, pipelines, railways and roads, as well as the wide-area mapping of terrain and vegetation that is difficult to access. Thanks to its patented tilt-rotor mechanism and proprietary software algorithms for seamless transition between two flight modes, the Wingcopter 198 can take off and land vertically like a multicopter, while flying long distances as efficiently and quickly as a fixed-wing aircraft, even in harsh weather conditions. rationale: Wirepas provides a high-leverage software-defined connectivity stack that scales massively across the utility sector with minimal capital intensity. Its pioneering role in the NR+ 5G standard creates a deep technical moat against traditional cellular and proprietary mesh incumbents.

The system is self-healing, meaning if one device fails, the others automatically find a new path to send information. As of late 2023, the company reported approximately $6.5M in annual revenue.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Decentralized Energy & Massive IoT
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Intel Inside' for massive smart-meter networks.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Defensibility is driven by over 100 patents and its position as the lead architect of the DECT NR+ global 5G standard. name: Workongrid
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Workongrid Booths Upper Level — UL644 Mark As Visited Company Information www.workongrid.com About Workongrid  Grid is an AI-Driven Operational Intelligence Platform for Utilities. Use Grid to ingest data from any source (HES, MDM, etc), analyze and run reports / dashboards on that data, & act on it through automated Business Process Management (BPM) rules. Grid's various products are: Grid Vault: Vault is our analytics, data warehousing and SMOC platform, that enables utilities to deploy intelligent operations centres for their mission-critical metering operations. It comes with built-in big data analytics, warehousing and visualization capabilities. Grid Ops: Ops is our highly configurable field operations and workflow management platform that covers various aspects of metering and non-metering workflows for utilities. Grid Flow: Flow is our integration and automation platform that enables out of box integrations with key technologies used across different legacy and modern utility solutions. It also comes with a built in event processing and business process management layer that enables smart automations. Grid Engage: Engage is our customer portal and mobile application that connects with the base Grid platform for providing tailored customer service solutions to utilities.  About Workongrid Product Categories Grid Edge and Behind-the-Meter Technologies > Advanced Metering Infrastructure IT/OT > AR/VR/Machine Learning/AI IT/OT > Enterprise Software/Platform Systems  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
pitch_summary: Workongrid provides an AI-driven operational intelligence platform for utilities, integrating data from HES and MDM systems to streamline meter operations, field workflow management, and customer engagement through automated business processes.
investment_thesis_one_liner: A comprehensive enterprise AI platform that bridges the gap between utility IT/OT silos to automate AMI operations and field workforce management.
rationale: Workongrid provides a high-leverage SaaS layer that transforms fragmented AMI and utility data into automated operational workflows, addressing a critical pain point in utility digital transformation. While it faces intense competition from legacy MDM and ERP incumbents, its AI-native integration approach offers superior agility for field operations and customer engagement.

vc_dossier.plain_english_summary: Workongrid provides a 'no-code' software platform that allows energy, utility, and mining companies to build custom mobile apps for their field workers. These apps replace paper forms and spreadsheets, helping teams track equipment maintenance, smart meter installations, and repairs in real-time without needing a software engineer.
vc_dossier.macro_trend: Grid Modernization & Electrification. As the world shifts to renewable energy, utilities are struggling to manage millions of new 'smart' devices (meters, solar panels, EV chargers) using old manual processes. They need flexible digital tools to coordinate massive field-worker fleets.
vc_dossier.analogy: The 'Airtable' or 'Monday.com' for the Power Grid.
vc_dossier.moat_description: Defensibility comes from 'workflow stickiness' and specialized industry templates. Once a utility maps its complex safety compliance and maintenance logic onto the platform, the cost of switching is extremely high. Unlike general low-code tools, they provide pre-built blocks specifically for energy assets like transformers and smart meters.
vc_dossier.key_investors: Indian Angel Network (IAN), Startup-O Ventures, Jaideep Mehta, KRS Jamwal, Pramod Jajoo, Shalil Gupta, and several existing customers who participated as angels.
vc_dossier.key_customers: Tata Steel, USolar, Aditya Birla, Jakson, and various public infrastructure projects.

Our product portfolio includes distribution transformers, power transformers, and intelligent switchgear, all designed to meet North American standards and customizable to suit diverse operational requirements. Our services cover the entire project lifecycle, from initial consultation and system design to installation, commissioning, and ongoing maintenance. Xenerpower’s technical team supports clients with equipment upgrades, troubleshooting, preventive maintenance, and emergency response, ensuring operational reliability and minimizing downtime. Amid growing challenges such as aging grid infrastructure, increasing renewable integration, and rising demand from data centers, Xenerpower addresses extended lead times, with current industry average 150 weeks for transformers - through strategic partnerships with established international manufacturers like Qinghe Electric, which brings over 30 years of industry expertise and large-scale production capabilities. We have an existing 32,000 sq ft Houston-based facory for winding, assembly, testing, refurbushment, distribution, technical service, and customer demonstration. Future expansion on our 5 acre land includes scaling toward a larger manufacturing, engineering, and R&D footprint to strengthen local production and service capacity. Proudly made in Texas, Xenerpower prioritizes local hiring and training, supports disaster recovery efforts, and contributes to the transition toward clean energy—positioning ourselves as a trusted community partner in building a resilient energy future. name: Zelisko
full_description: Feb. 3- 5 San Diego, CA Home Floor Plan Exhibitor Collateral Zelisko Booths Ground Level — 4243 Mark As Visited Company Information www.zelisko.com/en/ About Zelisko  Zelisko Energy, a subsidiary of Knorr-Bremse Group, has been a trusted name in the field of instrument transformers for over 60 years. Our product range includes high-precision, maintenance-free current and voltage transformers designed for both indoor and outdoor applications across low, medium and high voltage systems. These transformers are known for their durability, operating reliably in diverse environmental conditions worldwide. Zelisko’s state-of-the-art epoxy resin casting technology ensures long-lasting insulation performance and maintenance-free operationextending product life for many decades. Beyond traditional transformers, Zelisko also integrates intelligent sensors for monitoring voltage, current, and system health in real time. These compact, digitalready sensors support grid automation, predictive maintenance, and accurate metering in both conventional and smart grid infrastructures Zelisko offers solutions tailored to custom requirements, including special current and voltage transformers for unique applications. Our products comply with international standards such as IEC 61869, IEEE and ANSI, ensuring global applicability and reliability. Our instrument transformers come with best-in-class rated accuracy with ratio error as low as 0.2% Zelisko provides current and voltage transformers and sensors installed in a wide range of highvoltage, medium-voltage and low-voltage equipment. These devices deliver essential data for the supply and transmission of electrical energy. Hundreds of thousands of instrument transformers, designed and manufactured by Zelisko, are installed across a wide range of applications in the United States and around the world. These installations reflect decades of proven reliability, precision, and performance in diverse energy and industrial environments. Zelisko instrument transformers are available in a variety of designs for both indoor and outdoor applications. For over 60 years, these high-precision, maintenance-free transformers have been successfully deployed in all types of installation settings and weather conditions worldwide. Zelisko also plays a crucial role in the energy transition by supplying current and voltage sensors for automated transformer substations in medium-voltage smart grids. Zelisko products blend decades of expertise with forward-thinking engineering and innovation. A key example is the company’s highly automated epoxy-resin casting process, which ensures exceptional insulation quality. In addition to standard offerings, Zelisko provides tailor-made solutions for special applications, delivering customized products designed to meet specific customer needs and specifications. And it goes without saying that short, reliable lead times are a standard. To meet demanding requirements for quality, flexibility, delivery speed and competitive pricing, Zelisko continually refines its engineering and production systems. In particular, the advanced APG epoxy-resin casting process, combined with computer-aided product design, gives customers a distinct competitive edge. The proven reliability of Zelisko’s power transmission and distribution products is built not only on cutting-edge technology but also on decades of practical experience. For more than 60 years, Zelisko instrument transformers have demonstrated their performance in power grids worldwide – even under the harshest operating conditions  About Zelisko Product Categories Distribution > Protection and Control Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Sensors Hardware, Infrastructure, Equipment > Transformers Collateral  BROCHURE  Zelisko USA Product Brochure  DTECH 2026•©2026 All Rights Reserved  Sitemap |  XML Sitemap | Help | Privacy Policy
